name: Kathy Nelon
text: They are very helping and always disinfecting and love that I can get my meds delivered and also get text alerts letting me know when my meds are ready to be picked up as well.

name: Pat Hamilton McMurrey
text: The staff are friendly and helpful. The drive through is horribly slow at times!

name: Andrea Lovvorn
text:
Worst customer service I’ve ever seen from a pharmacy. CVS across the board has gotten lazy and is lacking in so many ways. I personally watched them answer the phone and continuously put patients on hold only to stand and talk to one another while counting. Two technicians and a pharmacist ran their mouths while the phone echoed “1 pharmacy call” over and over while they laughed and talked about their day, only to answer and ask the customer to hold until the phone started echoing “one pharmacy call” again and again. While a third was inputting RX into the computer at drop off. I watched them tell a customer in the drive through to hold while they pulled her RX only to stand and talk more.
Coming from surgery I was told that the wait for my RX it would be 2 hours minimum. We all know there is NO 2 hour wait for a “waiter” as Cvs calls them. I’ve never called this particular location and not been placed on hold less than 10 minutes. I now know why. CVS does not seem to care about the quality service they give like they once did. They do not appear to be understaffed, they appear to have a lazy work ethic and VERY poor bedside manner. In my opinion they need to clean house bc I wasn’t aware that the Caremark brand was willing to be represented in this manner.

name: C. Meadows
text: The store is usually well stocked, but prices are high.  The pharmacy is absolutely too busy.  The line for the pharmacy outside wraps around the building and there are two lines inside 4 and 5 people deep.  I switched pharmacies.

name: Jody Smith
text: Love this store. Staff always helpful and courteous. Clean neat and fully stocked.

name: Chanda Mitchell
text: The prices are too high when one can purchase the same items @ Walmart. However, it's very convenient

name: Cindy Layfield
text: Very nice staff , helpful and courteous.  Store very clean.

name: Paul Robinson
text: 10 minutes on hold and finally got a person to answer, but said she couldn't hear me.

name: Linda Oliver
text:
Went there because of my health Ins. Said that CVS is the pharmacy  I go to buy my over the counter Items.
So for I've been to 2 CVS an neither one of them had all the Items out on shelves that was OCT thur my Insurance company.  Kinda sad that CVS has the contract for ( Aetna) customers to come shop at an they dont hardly  have any ( OCT ) Items out to buy.

The last time I was there one of my prescriptions was missing and they never resolved the issue, even though they promised me they would figure out the issue. I had to transfer my prescription to another pharmacy. I may give them another chance one day.

I walk back in to purchase the bottle that broke but I cannot use it on the refund card bc it was alcohol so I had to spend more money. I will never be back and I cannot wait to talk to customer service in the morning. Very poor management I will never be back to that store again.

name: Toni Duplantis
text:
Wow.
As an RN, these people are not only rude, but have no knowledge of medications.
I’m so glad that I could advocate for myself!!!

They're great 😊 they've always been very kind and helpful! They always help even if I've got my hands full or they're busy. They've even called me to check if a medicine was OK with me when the doctor called it in. ❤
I even bumped into the pharmacist at the vet and he talked me through some questions I had about my son with asthma and meds and inhalers. He didn't mind at all! He loved to help and he and all the others there are always like that! Thank you all for always being so kind

Was told it still wasn’t ready that it would be another half hour...
I’m in desperate need of changing pharmacies. This one is terrible

Checking out can be an experience to where there were a line of eight of us with two registers only one was open and I believe the female didn't know what she was doing.I'm also glad that I checked in the bag for I walked out of the store because they give me the wrong prescription to a totally different person whose name was nowhere close to mine.

I now drive to Gadsden, an hour roundtrip out of my way, rather than here (6 minutes away) to deal with this poorly maintained attempt of a pharmacy.

text: These ppl that work in this store are to povide service to the consumer. They do nothing but judge ppl as THEY see fit. Your not GOD..... do your job like your surpost todo. Yes... these means you ....

name: Vicki Jones
text: Very friendly and helpful. More than the ladies had to be, that 's for sure... No insurance at the time but went way above and beyond to find discounts for my RX's ...

name: Erin Allen
text: Great staff! Never a line.

name: Nu won
text: ALWAYS, ALWAYS treats me like I'm important to them and they ALWAYS do whatever they can to make sure that my prescriptions are filled on time. If there are ever any problems,  they have it worked out before I ever arrive. Most places slowed down and had issues since the covid crisis. However, walmart pharmacy, in Gadsden specifically,  somehow improved on their service and I just know that I won't have to worry about anything when it comes to my prescriptions. It is every employee ranging from the pharmacist to the tech and cashier. Thank you! God bless you and your family!

name: jack nipper
text: Walmart pharmacy are dedicated workers pay should be more

name: Melody Green
text: Very pleased with their service. Have been polite and helpful. Email us when meds are due for refill and pickup. Thank you!

name: kimberlina68
text:
There is no management or guidance of the employees.  They are out of control with rudeness and absolutely zero customer service skills.  With just a little effort, this pharmacy could be great.  Honestly, they think if they are rude, then people will stop coming to the pharmacy and then they could just stand around doing nothing.

10/30/2020
If I could lower it below 1 star, I would.  My medications were ordered and paid for, on the website. This happen 10/23/2020.  Pharmacy was supposed to Fed Ex my 5 prescriptions to my home less than 10 minutes away because I have medical problems driving.  Anyway, I called Tues and was told by Sarah, the meds should be there by Wed 28th. I then called on 29th and was told there was another problem with Fed Ex and they would be there the next day (today).  Well today it is 3 pm and there is no Fed Ex package of my medicines that I need.  I tried to explain this to the Pharmacist, Michelle.  I thought she might be educated and actually have feelings about other people that are going through problems due to their lack of CUSTOMER SERVICE. At the least, they should have called me to explain.  She got very angry and before hanging up, starting yelling “oh my God, I can’t believe...   I just hung up, but I felt like I needed to let her know know she should say stuff like that without hanging up.  I have copies of my medicines being ordered on 10/23/2020 and Fed Ex tracking number being created on 10/26th.  It is 10/30th, and I still don’t have the medicine I need.  I pray no one there ever has to go through what I go through with them.

name: Angel (Angel)
text: I call in a medication at 12:47pm told to pick it up in 1.5 hours.  Go to pick it up and they have no record of me calling to fill it.  Phones are hard to get through.  Total rubish.

name: kram c.m
text: Have had no issues, they remind me of need for refills, always ready for pick up or drive through

name: Brenda Stallo
text: multiple times didn't fill the prescription and blamed the Doctors.  Multiple times did not refill the needles with the prescription for Insulin sq. Changed to the Wal Mart Pharmacy in Attalla. Its a 32 miles around trip from my home but I feel safer using them, they are friendly and not rude.  If I questioned a prescription at the East Gadsden Wal Mart Pharmacy I was treated as if I was bothering them even if they filled the prescription wrong.  I need to add that most of the prescriptions were for other family members and now I've been on hold at the East Gadsden WalMart for 16 minutes waiting to verify a prescription for a terminally ill relative.

name: Evelise Martinez-Elrod
text: Was supposed to have my prescription filled before July 1st. They just filled it on July 3rd....

name: Sharon Francis
text: This place is on unbelievable you order you medicine they don't fill it, Then you come pick it up and I tell you you didn't order it you come-back to pick it up couple days later,  Then I tell you they're out and I have to order it I came back 2 days later and say I need a  authorization then I come to pick it up after talking to my doctor to get the authorization, But guess what thats not what they needed! They needed  a new perscription because we were out of refills ? And each person wants to blame it on another person and I ask why don't you just call us and tell us that you didn't have it s or you need an authorization ?

name: Wendy Uhlman
text: It's okay.... Sometimes you get friendly service....

name: Chara Kelley (Sweet-Tea)
text: They are The Worst Pharmacy ! They play with people's prescriptions & they think everything is so funny ! People are sick and need their medicine, they should be ashamed of themselves & treat people with respect & dignity. All they care about is their self and collecting a paycheck!

name: Diane Sexton
text: Rude customer service

name: marcus johnson
text: Worst service ever.

name: Kiley Perethian
text: Close early. Open late. Very unprofessional and rude.

name: Sherry Howell
text: On multiple times they said my script had not been called in .I work for the doctor and was right there when it was called in .They are also very rude .Not to mention excessively long wait times

name: Carol Dillard
text: Never had my prescriptions correct.

name: virginia miller
text: It's. Alright

name: Lance Whestine
text: Rude and laugh and carry on 24/7

name: Steven Patterson (Realtor at eXp Realty)
text: I get almost all of my prescriptions filled here, and buy most of my vitamins here too. The pharmacy staff is very friendly and helpful. The pharmacist s will take the time to answer any of your questions even if you are not getting a prescription. I have shipped FedEx packages here occasionally.

name: Sondra Personal
text:
I was the only person in the drive through. The employee in the window was busy ,so I waited a few minutes before the drawer opened and I could tell her I was dropping off a prescription. It took a few minutes for her to look over the prescription, then drive off.
I get a voicemail my prescription is ready, so I go to pick it up. I am the 3rd person in the drive through and wait 30 minutes. I give the employee my name, then my address, paid, and left within a minute. What took the 2 cars before me so long?
If this was a one time thing, no problem. But this is a regular occurrence  with this particular Walgreens. I only go there because Walgreens bought Rite Aid which had been my pharmacy for years.

name: Brad Miller
text: This is one of the worst pharmacies I've ever been to. And I've been to pharmacies in Mexico if that says anything. You'd think that the employees were sloths. Everything takes forever and the employees could care less. It's not uncommon to sit in the pickup line for 30 minutes with only 2 cars in front of you. Be prepared to wait even longer if you go inside.

name: Janice Beard
text: Called a day ahead, for insulin pen refill. Called again to find out still in que, went to window and said come back in one hour. Came back and said not in stock. Maybe tomorrow a shipment might come in. How would you react?

name: Darius Frederick
text: As you can see the drive-thru was completely packed but the pharmacy is really quick and professional. they were able to keep the cars moving and was able to help everyone really fast!!

name: greg carroll
text: They worst customer service again . 1 presciption called in from another store , waited 15 minutes to get it, told I'd have to wait another 30 minutes.

name: Amanda Daniels
text: I can honestly say that I have never been treated so rudely in my life. The folks in the pharmacy are insanely rude, short and condescending! I know they are super busy. I get that. But, that is no reason to act like rudely to customers. I will never, ever go into this Walgreens again.

name: Candace Henderson
text: They're always fast and friendly.  :) I've always had great service.  Thank you Walgreens staff!

name: MARK Houston
text: They are terrible lost my Rx when handed to a rx young employee that took all my info told go look at the cameras

name: Gina Preston
text: Very disappointed in the service, quality of products and getting merchandise ordered in a timely manner.  Will look for another store for all of my photography needs.  Last order was 2 cards to be picked up at 9:00 and told by sales associate, Frances that my order was not ready and there was mo way my order would be ready that evening...very rude.

name: Pam Clark
text: If I could give them zero stars I would. The rudest staff in the pharmacy I've ever seen. The person helping me complained that she had to spend 20 minutes of her time helping me. REALLY??? Isn't she getting paid to do that? That is the last time I will go in there!

name: Payton Butler
text: RUDE!!! Always slow. Never offer to help with anything. I asked if they could call cvs across the street and see if they had something in stock and the employee’s response was “that would take me a long time, I can’t”. They will never have my business! CVS is so much better.

name: Eddie Snow
text: It’s a very slow pharmacy. I always get calls saying my prescription is ready. I drive 30 minutes to the store, use the drive thru, which is usually 4-5 cars in line, once at window they have not filled anything and I’m asked to come back in 15-20 minutes. I really wish they’d get some kind of organization or experienced help at this location.

name: Kathy Loggins
text: Will not be back, the advertised price on the marque and by the product was clearly labeled the product range up full price cashier would not give me said product at stated price even though they were marked in 3 different places, then she had nerve to ask me to restock if I did not want them.  Sorry left them at register for her to restock that is in her job description not mine.  Went else where found sane items for better price.

name: Mary Jane Powell
text: Hate to even give 1 star. These  are rude people in the pharmacy department.  They need to just hire all new staff for the front pharmacy.  Never had to deal with the actual pharmacist they may be good but the staff gets a zero.

name: Cody Britton
text: I started using this location as my pharmacy when I moved to Gardendale from Fultondale. It's been a terrible experience time after time. I now travel 15 minutes to the Fultondale location (vs about 3min to this location) just to avoid this terribly run operation.

name: Mariah Huffman
text: Went in (03/13/18 around 8pm) and they had exactly what I needed!! However once I got to the cashier (young black female) she was very rude and not helpful at all when I asked when would they restock the shelf near her register where I got the last of some candy, had a “I only work here” attitude!!

name: Pete Odom
text:
After answering all questions asked by pharmacy cashier, I was told that I would be advised when single prescription was ready. It was apparent that the pharmacy was busy so I waited patiently in the pharmacy seating area. After approximately 40 minutes,  noticing that the seating area had emptied out at least 2 times, I once again went to cashier. Original cashier wasn't there any longer so I spoke to another who looked up my request.
I was told that nothing had been entered and had to once again answer basic questions.  Once that was done my prescription was filled Immediately.
I believe the pharmacist there are very professional but there seems to be an issue with attitude at the cashier level. Since there were several cashiers at the windows,  I don't believe it was an issue of inadequate staffing.

name: Chris Adams
text:
Typical overpriced specialty retailer.  The pharmacy is ok although it is so rare that I use them I can't speak much to that.  Usually, it's that I need something on the fly and they happen to be close by.  Everything is priced for people that use their card.  I can't stand all this card nonsense almost everywhere you go.  Price is $2.99 then get to the register and it's $5.99 without the card or whatever.  Random but don't bother buying ice cream here as they can't even handle it correctly so it melts by the time the get it put up so when you buy it it's iced up and no longer creamy as it should be.  Yes, that's an odd thing to mention but hey at least now you know.

Walgreens, stop with the card nonsense...seriously it's just ridiculous.

I'll go here if I have to for a prescription once every year or so but other than that it's just not worth coming here.

name: Meota Meow
text:
My insurance forces me to use Walgreens and I hate every time I go get anything for my dad since he is diabetic which means I frequently shop here to my dismay. No one should have to put up with nasty pharmacists or just staff who dont care? Called just today because we could only afford half of the insulin at the beginning of the month I call and I'm told that I didnt pick it up in a timely matter and that now the order is put back. Honestly I called for medicine not to be lectured rudely about something I cant control social security picks the day it arrives every month not me but before I could even explain she tells me I have to go get another copay dr visit to get more insulin then after talking a little more she says he has refills so which is it do I need to get my dr or does he have refills how much is it going to cost am I going to have to pay for a full prescription and she really just talked in a circle so I got off the phone

If you dont have to use them JUST DON'T there is  cvs across the street  just go there it cant be any worse then this wallgreens simply not possible

name: Brannon Herzing
text: Extremely rude lady working in the pharmacy. I did not get a name, because she was not wearing a name tag. They tell you a prescription is ready, but then make you wait till they fill it.

name: Kacey Lipscomb
text: Always friendly and helpful

name: Alexandra Hunter
text: I was just on hold for 25 min and they hung it up. Then I called back and I was on hold for 25 more min and they hung it up. I called back and it said there was more than 4 people ahead of my call. It’s always like this every time I call.

name: Ann Davis
text: Wait on prescriptions is too long.  Drive through very slow.

name: A L
text: I have had a total knee replacement. I wanted to fill my Percoset prescription. Pulled in drive thru, my friend driving put the prescription in box, the tech was just standing there watching, let the prescription fly out of the box on the ground. I couldn't get out and my friend has a bad hip so that was difficult. They said it would be about 25 minutes as usual.  We pulled off. Did another errand which took longer went back to Walgreens.....the same tech looks at us and says we can't fill the prescription because our system is down. Well why in the hell couldn't they call me and say they couldn't fill it? I was hurting and needed my meds. Does anybody have common sense any more? Had to get prescription and go to CVS wait another 20 minutes.  I never had trouble with RITE AID IN FULTONDALE. THEIR STAFF WAS VERY SMART. I AM GOING TO SEE IF MY INSURANCE IS ACCEPTED AT THAT LOCATION  WHICH IS NOW WALGREENS. SAME NAME BUT THE STAFF MAKES THE DIFFERENCE. THEY HAVE COMMON SENSE.

name: Charles McKinney
text: Pharmacy staff is friendlier than most. Store layout is nice.

name: Sully Peterson
text: Worst pharmacy staff I’ve ever had the displeasure of dealing with. I wish they’d hire more qualified and friendly workers.

name: LaNita Young
text: I am a customer at the Sumiton/Dora, Al Walgreens Drugs.  I have always been treated professionally and got very timely service at that store.  One day last week they were out of one of my meds so they called this Walgreens at Gardendale as I happened to be in that area; they had it so I went by to pick it up.  The whole staff in the pharmacy treated me horrible.  Beginning with totally ignoring me when I stood at the counter for several minutes with 5-6 people working in there and no one but me at the counter!  When some one finally did wait on me, my med was not ready; before all the ugliness was over they had kept me in there for over an hour while they waited on around 10-12 other customers not counting the drive thru!  Much more was said and went on towards me that was not professional nor was I treated fairly, however, I have already written a book and can not say it all here so I will write headquarters.  I did nothing nor said anything to them at first to deserve this treatment; but the more they pushed my buttons the more I got upset.  I still held myself back to what a lot of folks would have done.  This happened on the day crew July 5, 2017.  Thanks for letting me rant!

name: Lauren Michelle
text: Not very helpful and super slow.

name: Scott Plagmann
text: Conveniently located store in center of Gardendale. Always clean and safe and helpful employees.

name: Dixie Godette
text: Great place open holidays. 😃

name: Bethany McCloy
text: They never have enough staff working and they are very unfriendly & unprofessional.

name: Rob D.
text: Today was good, they were ready today!

name: J T
text: Nice location, seems like they have a high staff turnover.

name: Sue Caldwell
text: Excellent service.

name: Brittany Weaver
text: Worst pharmacy hands down!

name: Fred Barger
text: 8very slow

name: Jill Carter
text:
They are always very gracious and quite quick when you want to wait for your meds.
There are a lot of new faces now, but they are still kind people. I really do miss some of the older employees that really took the time to get to know you personally. But I would recommend this place to EVERYONE!
I just wish it was a 24 hour since there is not any other close

name: Rocky Redding
text: Always good.

name: Michael B
text: Fast and friendly service. I always look forward to passing by the Pharmacy area to wave and say hi to the staff. Dr. Tony, Dr. Autumn, Shannon, and Rachel are some of the best employees I have seen at a Walmart Pharmacy.

name: spacemoms daughter
text: Every time I go in this CVS, there is a squeaky toy that you are supposed to squeeze as to let an associate know that you're ready to check out. I am wildly disappointed that not once has a dog come to check me out. Always a human. A nice human, but they're no floofy dog. What gives, CVS. You'll get your 5 stars when I see floof.

name: Brianna Jones
text: They take forever to do anything. Be prepared for a long wait

name: Denice Chavis
text: Was there at CVS in Dothan Al. on park and main. It was a little after 8am today and I was picking up my husband's medicine that required (2) IM needles to administer.  I always have to ask for these everytime. These people know it's a vial of medicine that I have been getting for months and months now and yet they never say do you need needles with that? So like all the times before I ask for needles and was told by a nice fuzzy male red headed pharmacy tech we have no needles. I said yet you sold me medicine that requires needles and yet you have no needles to sell me. The pharmacist lady obviously overheard our conversation and chimed in that CVS and Walgreens have been contracted to give the Covid vaccine to all nursing home people so all of their needles will be going to that. She then informed me that I could go to and I quote "Mom and Pop" drug store and they would be able to help me with the 2 needles that I need. I said my prescription card is CVS caremark and you send me mail telling me if I shop anywhere else but you, that the prices will be higher because I'm not using you and yet you sell me medicine I can not use because you have no needles. She said covid vaccine is our top priority right now. I said wow I thought the customer would be your top priority. She said you obviously dont understand the importance of this. I informed her I do. I'm a healthcare worker but what I dont understand is I've been asking for these needles long before a vaccine came out. How do you sell me medicine but no means to administer it. Is that what you tell people with their insulin. I'm changing our pharmacy to another pharmacy (NON CVS and NON Walgreens). Preferably one that is more willing to help me and my healthcare needs.

name: Joshua Garzarek
text:
Drove all the way here to fill a prescription because it was the only pharmacy open at 7pm on Saturday when the pharmacist wouldn't fill any prescription unless it was from the emergency room. I do not understand it she said I would have to come back tomorrow at 10am
if that is the case list it online so we dont waste our time driving an hour there to be turned down.

name: laura stratton
text: Store manager just sneezed into the air, wiped her nose with back of hand, and used inside of shirt collar to wipe her nose. All while getting my mom’s prescriptions wrong up. Argued with me when I told her to stop touching her bags.

name: Littlestorm
text: They are overwhelmed a lot of the time but it's like every other business. They won't allow them to hire enough help to service customers the way they should be serviced. I try to be understanding about that. 99% of the time they are nice but you get a hateful person every once in awhile.  In my opinion they do a GREAT job.

name: Cheryl Christian
text: Always Friendly!

name: sherline hudson
text: I used this CVS location on 12-12-17.  I went to use the photo lab for some prints and had no idea where to start.  The guy working was very helpful..polite and genuine.  I asked him his name and he told me Mario.  I want CVS to know that he is an exceptional employee and that i very much appreciated his assistance.

name: Zirkia Gilmore
text: There the slowest pharmacy ever my baby meds were called in and I had to wait two days they kept saying they were filling them now and never were same as with my monthly medicine they never have anything ready on time it makes no sense then it take them 30 minutes just to get one car taken care of in the drive thru so the line like it wrap the building twice it’s just sad

name: Chris Martin
text: Love them - the only problem that I have had is telling me that nothing has been called in when it has.

name: Te'Ke Teqwonda
text: It's a lady that works at the pharmacy who always seems to have an attitude every time I come there to pick up my prescriptions she rolls her eyes like she hates her job, she's never in a good mood, she never says thank you, she never says you welcome after I tell her thank you, she never says have a good day, she's just plain rude. I recently just picked up a prescription Thursday August 24th around 3:30p and that same rude lady was there she told me the total for my medicine, I gave her my money for my medicine and while she was giving me my change she handed it to me so quickly that I dropped some of my change on the ground and she didn't apologize for it or anything she just watched me as I picked up my change like whatever and went on about her business.

name: Haley Haire
text: Store manager Sarah is the worst person to deal with. Worst customer service I have ever experienced!

name: Hope Snapp
text: Prescriptions are never ready when they say they will be. They have lost 2 of my prescriptions and I had to get the dr to rewrite them. Very poor customer service. If my insurance did not require me to use CVS, I would never set foot in there.

name: Jackie Gibson
text: My go to for quick easy stuff.

name: Jean Dumesnil
text: Their pharmacy never answers the phone.

name: Jessie King
text: The pharmacy is ok but the young man with a beard and mustache is a horrible person.

name: Jean Fulton
text: The pharmacy is TERRIBLE!!!! Very poor customer service and scripts are never ready on time.

name: mybrochoc mybrochoc
text:
(Translated by Google) I laky

(Original)
I laky

name: Christina T
text: I love the pharmacy staff here. They are friendly, professional, and have always been great about filling prescriptions fast.

name: I.O.U
text: i used to go there they were awsome to bad i moved

name: Monika Patil
text: very nice staff

name: Jack Gilbert
text: Well since Mandi left and is over at the Oxford Walmart in the Pharmacy I hadn't been in.

name: Joyce Roberson
text: Great

name: Gary Rager
text: can't get no one to answer phone. signed up for rx notification and they never text me. gonna switch away from walgreens

name: Greg Morgan
text: VERY slow drive-through one lane only.

name: sonja spicker
text: Had my prescription filled and could not believe what I seen.The young lady at the pharmacy wear a mask under her chin not cover her mouth and nose .Possibly infecting customers and medications . Anyone works in a medical field including pharmacy need to wear a mask ,no wonder our covid 19 positive number going up in walker county Alabama!!!!

name: Shanna Atkins
text: Once again this pharmacy is absolutely horrible. They really should fire every one of the pharmacy staff at this location and start over. Sad part is it isn't the whole store just the pharmacy at this particular location. You would think corporate would have intervened by now with all the poor reviews but I guess not because nothing has improved over the years. I literally dread getting my prescriptions refilled every month because of the staff but my insurance doesn't  give much choice in terms of pharmacies.

name: David Gray
text: I had bought a finger brace last Sunday but it was the wrong style I went back today to get a refund or exchange it and the manager on duty was great very friendly I just wanted to let y’all know some other stores could learn from the employees I delt with at your store today

name: Pamela Pugh
text: I have 3 special needs family adults including my bedridden brother, 78 old father and 66 dementia uncle that lives with me. We have been with Walgreens for over 29 years. The pharmacist Jessica always questions all meds and gives me a really hard time when picking up 8 meds per adult. I don’t want to change because the tech Jessica has helped me so much by being understanding and very kind. Please Walgreens send employees to compassionate school as they are so rude and mean!!!!

name: Matthew Jackson
text: The staff here lacks common sense and lack of customer service! Very very rude folks my grandpa came to get his meds and left feeling like he was ran over and talked down to cause he had questions about his medication he was there to pick up! How do you talk down to a 90 year old man????

name: Amy Abel
text: Very rude lady in Pharmacy!!! This is poor customer service. Just asked a simple question and she was very short and condescending with her non hepful answer.

name: Amanda Spears
text: I am a beautiful person who is the best of luck with the same time.

name: Nathaniel Morrow
text: I have been going there for several months and my experiences get worse Everytime. The staff is rude except one I know of. This time though they LOST MY PRESCRIPTION!!!! After they said they called my name and didn't, I walked by and the lady said your prescription is ready. I get in line and they can't find it! After looking for 20 mins they found it in the fridge with other meds. My med is supposed to be kept at 77 degrees not 32 degrees. I am going to call corporate!!!

name: Carol Frazee
text: Every time I go to get medicine there is a problem.  I  live 18 miles away, it takes 2-3 trips to Jasper walgreen. Thats alot  of extra gas and time I don't have.

name: Jeremy Grace
text: They are horrible very slow dont answer the phone dont help people get anything and they dont do anything at all.

name: Wes Lamon (Wes L)
text: The drive through pharmacy takes a really long time. Two cars back and 25 minutes!

name: Michelle Smith
text: Friendly, knowledgeable staff. The only bad thing is they are slow and have a high turnover rate

name: Liam P
text: Good marvel legends

name: Breanna Austin
text: They were very rude when I called up there to ask about my prescription and when I asked to have it transferred somewhere else. Been trying to get my prescription since 2 o’clock today.

name: april Roberson
text: Pharmacy techs are very helpful and sweet but the pharmacist are sometimes rude and extremely slow filling prescriptions.

name: Shane Gilliland
text: People at the jasper store are so rude! And it takes you forever to find someone to help you.

name: Paula thrasher
text: The pharmacy staff tends to be rude and they make BIG MISTAKES w/my meds!

name: Bruce Creel
text: I like Walgreens.  This location seems to be under staffed   Most employees are friendly, but a few seem unhappy with their job.

name: Phillip Boyd
text: People here are slow and rude.  Priky attitude.

name: Jason Latham
text: Kind of expensive but good selection of stuff

name: anna craig
text: I’ve been going to this pharmacy for three months now and would just like to say thank you to all the pharmacist and technicians that help. Everyone is always very nice and pleasant. Thank you all for your great customer service.

name: Mac Thomas
text: Better count your pills, they have shorted me before!

name: Keisha Gregory
text: Always great customer service. Keep up the awesome work.

name: Greg Cartee
text: Absolutely do not use this pharmacy. They do not answer their phones, so I hope you never need to call them with an important question. Also, some of their supervisors don't do anything about the problem either. Last, they are careless on top of not doing their job in that they didn't even enter my full name for my prescription, so that caused problems with notifications for my prescription and who knows if it will cause any problems with insurance. Luckily I caught it soon and had them fix it, so hopefully it won't cause any problems with my insurance. Regardless, I was on the phone waiting for them to pick up the phone for over 15 minutes to avoid a wasted trip to the harmacy, and no such luck.

name: David Diehl
text: Always a good experience. Phone wait time is typical of most pharmacies. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. No complaints here!

name: Packrat Garage
text: In store is good service, if you are using a phone - good luck. Wait times are in the never answers range with employees picking up the phone, and placing it back on hold without ever acknowledging your call.

name: Christina Martin
text:
I cannot ever seem to get anyone on the phone in the pharmacy. Every time I call I am placed on hold. No one ever picks up. Finally I just hang up.
I moved here not too long ago and was happy there was a CVS nearby. Now I think I'd rather move them all to another pharmacy.  This is ridiculous.

name: Amos Warnick
text: They are always on the ball.

name: Martha Robinson
text: I have had a prescription for over 3 years set on automatic refill for the last 4 months it’s been up 1 to 2 weeks past due on filling.If I don’t have this medicine I break out in large blisters after about 2 days.So past the first month I went in for 3 months and reminded them to reorder.This month I did the same and told it would be there on Friday May 23 2020.i was out on the 15th.So it’s been 2 since I reminded them to refill.When I spoke to the pharmacist it had not been ordered even though I went through drive 7 days ahead to asked them to remember to order.For 3 months.He found a refill at another cvs 15 miles away.Before I left store I asked the pharmacist to record because refill will be due June 15 2020 about 2 weeks he respond I will do if that makes you happy.What will make me happy is not have to come monthly to remind you and still not my medication 1 to 2 weeks.To not have large water blisters.Or to drive 15 miles to pick up from another store.Basically to be treated as a loyal customer for the past 15 years.And every once in a while answer the phone or hire someone to answer phones and order medications.

name: Donald palazzolo
text: The best place to shop for everyday essentials in columbiana. I almost always find something I can use on clearance, the store is clean, well stocked and organized, unlike other stores in town. And between sales ,and extra bucks I always feel like I'm getting a awesome deal.

name: Villette Rochford
text:
I read reviews.  I refuse to deal with a pharmacy that cares so little they don't answer the phone.  I was going to transfer all my medicine but now have been on hold too long.

Well.  I spoke to a manager after trying again...phone was disconnected.  I even asked him to walk back there very nicely....he couldn't and the phone went dead.

Why would I transfer all my medicine to a pharmacy that can't bother to at least take a call.
S
Columbiana CVS.  you are not going to get my money now.  It's a small town...so what's up?

I have a chance to edit.  The pharmacy obviously has issues as does management and I NEVER do this kind of stuff.  I was told many people have complaints...by that manager.  Hmmmmm

name: Heidi Beiersdoerfer
text: Would be nice if they would ever answer the phone!!!

name: Danielle Clark
text: I have been on hold for over 30 min trying to speak with a pharmacist. I have even hung up and tried calling again and cannot get anybody on the line. This is by far the worst pharmacy.

name: Heather McCullough
text: They never have meds ready and usually mess them up. It is dangerous getting prescriptions filled at this pharmacy.

name: don w
text: Terrible pharmacy!! You call to make sure they have your prescription and they say yes then when you arrive they don't have it in stock and it will be a week to get it. This has happened to me twice now and this is not a medication you can do without for a week. It's also a special medication that no one carries in stock. If you need a pharmacy to depend on this is not a good choice and I will never fill anything else here again.

name: Chelsi M Lomas
text: Pharmacy rarely has medications that I need filled, the store department staff are helpful and friendly, clean and organized.

name: Michael Vanhook
text: My wife and I really appreciate this store. They are always so very helpful and really take care of customers, on the floor and in the pharmacy.

name: Kevin Jones
text: Friendly workers.

name: John Glenn
text: Don't fill your prescriptions at this CVS, my wife dropped off the 2 prescriptions they said one was out of stock and would let her know when it was, went back 3 days later because they had not called and they lost BOTH prescriptions and lied saying they don't keep the prescription if it's not in stock.And this is not the first issue we have had with them.Horrible CVS, then make you feel like your a liar and an addict for wanting your prescription..Never using them again

name: Tammy Goggins
text: Like my CVS.

name: debra howard
text: Not having much luck getting items in the ad lately, I know, covid; but I can go to other CVS's and get them.

name: Ken S

text: Your service at 9917-A Spanish Fort is very poor. I've come to pick up my medicines there and there was only 1 person in the shop helping drive through all the time. I ended up leaving without my medicines. Will go somewhere else for my refill.

name: Larissa Goodrich
text: Terribly disappointed that the cashier decided to call into question my direct request for being rude- indeed, to the point that other people stopped to gawk in order to see my response.  Customer service begins with ensuring everyone, including people with disabilities, are comfortable. They failed miserably today. Vacuums make children with sensory issues uncomfortable. I expected to be checked out without excuses and additional wait time when we made the choice to stop shopping. Instead, we had to wait until the vacuuming ended. No, I was not rude. I was matter of fact. I don’t like excuses. There is a difference and instruction should follow from leadership on these points. Annoyed and disappointed is an understatement.

name: mary shank
text: The cashier at night always has a sunny disposition. He’s always been friendly and proactive. We also get our prescription medicines here and i love shopping for my cosmetics in this store too.

name: Vanessa
text: Waaaay too expensive. With Walgreens across the street it will surprise me if anyone will pay these high prices. $12.99 for beef jerky? I left and went across the street and it was $5.99 for the same size at Walgreens. This is nice, new and stocked .. but I can't pay these prices. Publix is even cheaper!

name: Wow To Funny
text: Over priced! DIsenfranchised!! Very clean...

text: I love this store.  It's neat and clean.  Clerks have always have a  smile and are helpful.  Pharmacy is fast and I've never had a problem getting prescriptions filled.

text: I’ve never felt so uncomfortable in my life. I was there yesterday purchasing toiletries and one of the employees followed me the entire time and stood in every aisle I visited pretending to straighten up already straightened items. I am an upstanding citizen who has never committed a crime, but I felt very targeted. Never coming back here and filing a complaint to corporate.

name: Ron Simon
text: Waited for CVS to open at 8:00 am to get prescriptions filled for pain & nausea for kidney stone (just came from ER).  Irritated Pharmacist said he was the only one available and wanted me to wait until 9:15 when other employees come in because he had prescriptions to fill from overnight even though I was the only customer in the store AND all the while I’m in dire pain.  I went across the street to Walgreens and only had to wait 15 minutes.  Poor customer service and NO empathy.

name: Melanie Busse
text: Pharmacist decides that she isn't comfortable filling my doctors prescriptions, because she thinks I don't need them? Since when does a tech school graduate make decisions about a doctor's care? I will not spend my hard earned money in a CVS anywhere. Ironically, the doctor recalled these into Walgreens across the street and had no issues with getting my medicines filled.

name: Amanda Reed
text: I've always had a great experience with CVS here in Spanish Fort. Everyone is so nice every time I go in.

text: Had a decent cosmetic area yet had no nyx when I went in which was out of my town so was here for only 2 days and I do my own makeup business and ran out of NYx ,higher price than other areas but was not a bad spot

name: Jane Doe
text: Great Store and Pharmacy!

name: Shelby May
text:
Just left this store after Carol, the cashier, refused to help me. Went to check out through self checkout because there was nobody in the front. Was surprised to be carded for buying NyQuil. My neighbor has the delta variant and is having a hard time sleeping with the body aches. So, though I have no symptoms, I am masked. The register is dinging and saying that someone will come assist me pretty loudly. Carol walks right past me, tells an unmasked girl that she will help her at the register. I politely say, “excuse me, I just need you to verify my age. Could you help me really quick.” She stares straight at me and then completely ignores me. She begins carrying on a conversation with this girl, they are new best friends. The girl’s mom worked at CVS when she was in high school. So five minutes later, the manager comes to help me because the alarm was going off for so long!

Bottom line, CVS is a health service company and Carol is not representative of their mission or values. It’s pretty disappointing that someone with such little compassion and regard works at this type of establishment; the type of establishment people hope to count on when they are feeling their worst. You can not count on Carol.

name: Stevie Johnson
text:
I had a horrible experience at this one on 5/5
I went in for my 2nd covid shot and got spoken to by a pharmacist with a harsh tone and a bad attitude.He acted like he didn’t want me there.Even when I explained to him while keeping my temper in check while I was there,that I had a appointment,he still had a smart mouth tone to his voice.It’s amazing that I can start out in a good mood and someone who’s in the profession that deals with the public wants to treat me this way.I’m gonna pray for him.He really needs it.

name: Russell Meyers
text:
Typical Montgomery "professionalism".
Scheduled an MMR vaccine online yesterday. Got there few minutes ahead. They tell me they are doing vaccines in the drive-through. (?!)
What if a person has no vehicle? Not my case but true for some.
Go to drive-through. They ask for ID, fine. Then a bunch of other questions. They say they cannot find my appointment in the system. Then tell me to schedule another appointment online for this morning. Not happy but I did. (Note they did not ask if I had time this morning.)
I call to confirm an hour ahead. Getting through their phone system, the recording tells me no appointment is necessary for a vaccine. Hmm.
Pharmacist gets on the line, tells me that their MMR is out of stock. Something they could have told me yesterday.
Drama, poor work ethic, worked harder to NOT do something than they would if they had just done it.
Purely unprofessional.

name: Ice

If I ever have a problem with a staff member being rude, have no qualms about asking that person what is the problem, but I've also worked with the public and know that the public can be extremely demanding and unreasonable.

If they would’ve answered the phone, it would’ve been ready by now. This is terrible service and the old white guy in the white coat is ridiculous. He apparently doesn’t know how to answer the phone.... must think his paycheck is to much to answer a phone. I wish Riteaid was still open, they were 1,000 time better, faster, and friendlier.

text: Absolutely the worst pharmacy and the worst staff in the United States.

name: Beth Haney
text:
Store 4858 Near Troy, Al
Stopped in to check on filling a prescription and use the restrooms. We were on a 5 hour road trip, had stopped for several restroom stops and this restroom was worse than any run down nasty gas station bathroom we had seen. The trash was overflowing, empty toilet paper rolls under the dispenser, no soap to wash your hands. The outside of the toilet had layers of dust and fluids streaming down. We asked an employee about getting some soap and informed them that the room needed some attention. She acted like that wasn’t her job. The men’s room was worse. It smelled of urine because the toilet and floor was stained with urine. While we waited for the girl to track down the soap we went to the pharmacy counter and had to ask for hand sanitizer because there wasnt any out on the counter. He said he was aware of the condition of the restroom and commented, “yeah, we’ve told them.”  I don’t know who “we or them” are but someone’s not doing their job. If the shift employees are not going to clean them they need to hire a janitorial service. For a place you go to care for your health, the sight of this place made me feel sick.

(Which would make no sense) and he said he would call me back that day to get the medicine because it was in stock. My doctors office called me and said they sent it to the only pharmacy that had in stock. Not only did they lie to me but my mom also. Plus I'm leaving out of the country and that kind of medicine is nothing to mess with 2 weeks before I leave!! I will not be getting anything else filled here.

text: The last 3 times I have came to pick up my prescriptions I waited in line for over 45 minutes to an hour! Extremely understaffed and in organized! It is ridiculous, it doesn’t matter if you go inside or drive up you will wait!! The automatic refill system doesn’t work either. If I don’t call directly my prescription is not being refilled as the automatic system is supposed to do. I will be looking for a new pharmacy!

name: Jennifer Mordecai
text: All of the staff are very friendly and helpful. Always have a great experience at this location. The best one in our city!

name: Gigi
text: I give 2 stars because the staff is so kind and overworked. It doesn't matter when I go- day, night, weekend, weekday, morning, afternoon, near closing- I rarely get out before 45 minutes. I have had to wait as long as 2 hours (so I leave and come back). The phone rings off the hook. People sit in the drive through, the waiting area, in line. I pick this stuff up for a relative. I'm trying to get him to change his pharmacy. As I type this I've sat here over an hour...

name: Steven Salter
text: CVS in Dothan has been an example of corporate chain outlets that have poor communication between its locations, doctor’s offices and customers. The amount of error I have experienced At this CVS and is inexcusable. The staff at the CVS on 84/Brannon Stand are never customer focused and always (literally) playing catch up with long lines of customers. I have been a CVS customer for more than 8 years, and today I am finally reaching out to locally owned pharmacies.

name: Karen Bowden
text: I just waited 20 minutes at the drive-thru for a simple antibiotic. It was called in by my physician 6 hours before I picked up. I was notified of this by CVS via text and was told it was ready. I would gladly have gone in but was wedged in between 2 cars. This is not good business. If you don’t have enough employees to handle things, hire more.

name: Heather Corder
text: I wish there was an option for no stars for this place! We went to the pharmacy on the way home from my son's doctor's appt around 12:30pm and they said they would get his prescription ready so we went back at 4:15pm and the prescription was STILL not ready it is now 6:05pm and we just now got home which is 5 minutes from our house. NEVER GO TO THIS PHARMACY UNLESS YOU PLAN ON WAITING FOR AT LEAST AN HOUR!!! We will not be going back to this pharmacy ever again!!!

name: Trey Maker
text: Since I've been in the drive thru for 25 minutes, I have plenty of time to write a review. Guess this speaks for itself. CVS, hire some help in your pharmacy!!!

name: Amy Gillaspie
text: These poor employees have to listen to that robot call over the intercom non stop. They have way too much work and obviously no access to get simple medications filled. CVS should be ashamed of how they equip their staff. I can normally get my usual pharmacy to fill my prescriptions within 24-48 hours and they didn’t have my NEEDED medications for days. I went there thinking they might be quicker and was terribly wrong. NOT THE FAULT OF THE STAFF THEY WERE AWESOME. The system kept giving them false information.

name: DV8

I have shopped at this pharmacy for 5 years and its been great....until a few months ago. It has taken hours to days to have my rx filled. Amoxil called in at 1030am. Went to get it at 4pm and it was not done. Took them 38 minutes per my son. Has happened several orher times. Changed from lisinopril to norvasc and took 3, again i say 3 days to have it filled.
UNACCEPTABLE

Ugh, it took 40 mins to get a prescription that was supposedly “ready”!!!! I can say that the pharmist Keith was super quick and nice. He’s the only reason for the 3 stars.

name: Nikki Steele
text: Love this store! It is one of the smaller stores, as they only get one truck per two weeks but they have a super helpful staff. I coupon here all the time and never have an issue getting my sale items. They always resolve my issues and are willing to help when possible.

name: Patty Griffith
text:
After several managers had come and gone from the CVS on Chalkville Mountain Road and Grayson Valley Parkway there have been no improvements. I would frequently go in the store, which is right near my home and I would find a bell that said “ring for service”.  No one would come when I would ring the bell. I had to go hunting for someone to purchase my items.  There would be nobody at the front and nobody in sight; I would holler “hello, hello” and nobody would respond.  I finally found someone and asked who was the manager and was told the manager was Jimmy Jackson.  Every employee in there that has been fired and then rehired or hired in the first place has been rude, obnoxious and very unhelpful in every way. The shelves are always I stocked. When I go in to get my cat litter there is never any on the shelf; and I’ll ask if they’ll go back in the back, after they huff and puff, they will and come back and say “truck day is tomorrow.” When they say truck day is tomorrow it’s always on a different day.
As I went in there four days later, the shelves  were the same and they still did not have my cat litter. I politely asked the gentleman behind the counter if they had any in the back. The young lady behind the counter next to him said “she’s always like this” to another customer who was standing next to me. I have never been so humiliated and embarrassed the employees name was Cam. I will not be back.
If I could give this store a zero I gladly would.

name: Michele Smith
text:
The pharmacist is the most hateful lady I have ever talked to. I understand  your tired but  i just  ask a real simple question.  I will never fo to this store again
Not to mention  they are very nasty (dirty) and never restock.
Over CVS.

name: R “Kelz” Kelz
text:
Over the past month or so the pharmacy at this location that use to be great A+ about getting your prescriptions out on time as promised and I would even get an alert on my phone when they were ready to pick up but lately it’s the total opposite.
What has happened?
Prescriptions are promised to be ready at a certain time and when you go to pick up those prescriptions at that promised time they still aren’t ready so you have to wait in line behind other customers with promised unfilled orders. What’s the point of telling a customer to wait 5 hours and it’ll be ready at 7:00 when you get there at 7:00 it’s not. If things don’t change soon I’ll be going somewhere else with my prescriptions. Customer service is always #1 and this CVS pharmacy isn’t providing that.

name: Mick McMeme
text: This is a CVS in decline, the refrigeration units are failing, there's a fair amount of disorder and they are understaffed.

They are ridiculously slow, WILL NOT answer the phone, and if you don't get there at least 1 hour before they close, they will not fill your medicine. which presents a HUGE problem when you work 8 am - 6:30 pm, and cannot get there and they WONT ANSWER THE PHONE EVER!!!! and then to be rude about it on top of it all!

text: I went in yesterday to get my passport picture taken. I was told to leave my number so they could give me a call when it was ready because there were a few orders ahead of me, so I did. I decided to wait around town because I thought surely it wouldn’t take over two hours, I was wrong. I never even got a call. I went back today to tell them I wanted to pick up my picture, because surely it was done and printed. When she asked for my name, she couldn’t find my picture? I told her I took it yesterday and was told I’d get a call when it was ready and didn’t think it would take 24hrs. She had to find my picture herself on the camera and print it out because the other woman did not do it. No wonder I didn’t recieve a call... It wasn’t even being printed.

24/ 7. Hours.

text: Worst pharmacy I’ve ever been to. After waiting over an hour on a prescription with my sick child I was then told they were out of the specific medication I needed. I asked them when I gave them the prescription and they said it would be ready shortly. Then when I questioned why they didn’t tell me when I brought it in that they were out I was threatened by the manager of the store. I would never go back there again. I will drive out of my way before going back there.

name: Chris Cobb
text: The customer service at this location has ALWAYS been awesome. The name of cashier isn't on the receipt, that I saw, but he always is very curteous and very helpful. Everything and everyone has an off day but I've never been disappointed here.

text: THEY WON'T EVEN ANSWER THE PHONE!

name: Eric Pilkinton
text:
Pharmacy doesn't pick up the phone. Customer service is lacking. Won't be using this location again.

.... A week later I tried going through the drive-thru and after 15 minutes one car has not moved from the window. Another 5 minutes and I decide to leave after watching three other cars pull off. Absolutely horrible. Wouldn't even answer their phone when I tried to call to find out what was going on. Changing Pharmacy. Done with this place.

name: Andrew Marut
text: This place is the absolute worst pharmacy I have ever been to. They want you as the patient to do their job, when they should be taking care of sick people, not making more issues. Pick up the phone and call the doctor if things are not in order, don’t call the sick patient and expect them to call. YOU ARE THE PHARMACIST, YOU DO YOUR JOB 😡

name: Alyssa Bush
text: Ive only used this pharmacy since I moved to Northport and honestly I've never had a problem with them. I see a lot of negative reviews for this walgreens but maybe theyve had a change of staff since most of those were posted. As for the cashiers and other staff members, they're also great! They've never failed to impress me.

name: Amanda
text: Had a bad experience with a passport photo. They took forever taking the photo due to the camera dying and not having enough memory. The staff kept having to take my young child's photo because of the camera and took about 6 picture before it got right.  Took about 45 minutes. Submitted the photo with our application but it was denied due to the size of the head being too large. So we had to retake the photo at walgreens again and PRAY we get our passport in time for a very expensive trip. If we do not we will have to expedite new paperwork and this will all be due to walgreens not resizing the photo correctly. We asked for a refund which they would not give. The staff was as helpful as the could be on the first visit and I do not blame them for the equipment failure. But i believe due to their error we should have been offered a new photo and refund.

name: Voodoo Actual
text: I waited about 25 minutes to drop off a prescription. That's right - just to drop it off. When I finally got to the counter I was told they couldn't take any more prescriptions since they were so busy. I let the young lady know that I was just dropping it off for later when suddenly a sweaty behemoth of a pharmacist appeared. He informed me that he was to busy and he wouldn't fill it later either. I was further told that I should go somewhere else. No problem. This was my first and last experience with Walgreens - never spent a dime and never will. They should be required to pay me for my time though.

name: Julie Woosley
text: Most of the workers are nice, but there is always a long line at the pharmacy. Waited about 30 minutes tonight to pick up some medicine.

name: Sarah Cheshire
text: Considering how your pharmacy made millions monopolizing all the AL blue cross plans this year, one would think you would be able to invest more in customer service. I've spent 2 hours on hold today and each time I call a different assistant answers and can't seem to track down my prescription. Have called my doc multiple times to confirm that it is there. Am now on hold for the third time today an my doctors office is about to close and I'm starting to experience side effects from not being able to get my meds. This is not the first time this has happened. Shame on Walgreens for taking state ACA $ but not using it to provide decent care.

name: Mastershy 771
text: It took 4 hours to get my meds filled! Go to Jann's Pharmacy! They are great!

name: Paul Sturdivant
text: Pharmacy always very busy and today is the busiest I have ever seen it. This raises a question, is their service that bad or maybe their prices are that good  ?  You decide !!

name: JERRY LOUIE
text: Longest wait ever in pharmacy drive thru. Was dropping off Mother inlaw prescription. About 48 minutes.

text: Probably the worst pharmacy in Tuscaloosa. The pharmacist on staff seems to always be rude. Just not worth the trouble

text: Used pharmacy service..was quick

text: Went to pickup a Western, at the signing point, the signing pinpad malfunctioned and waited 30 minutes for it to come up.  Employees were polite, but equipment issues will keep me from EVER using Walgreens for Western Union again.

name: Parker Files
text:
EMBARASSING for a pharmacy to be this lackadaisical about keeping things from being expired!! I won't be coming back.

Got some pain meds for my kidney stone. Figured what the heck Ill get a pepsi. NBD right? Wrong. Flat as a blade.
Returned it.
Got a coke. Even worse.
Returned it.
Went around the store and I cant find ANY cokes that arent expired and pepsis that are only good to like november and January in a few rare cases. Are their inventory people in a coma? Did they die? Get your meds here but dont shop here.

name: Krystal Cameron
text: Workers are very helpful and seem to enjoy and take pride with their jobs!

text: The store itself is great but the pharmacy is terrible!

name: Jennifer Brown
text:
CONSIDER A DIFFERENT PHARMACY

So I'm currently on 3 calls with the same CVS to verify a prescription. The longest hold time is currently over 36 minutes. I'm going to leave it going until close to see if anyone ever answers.

Even walmart is better than this. Step your game up. I'll post a picture shortly.

UPDATE:
So after holding 1 hour 2 minutes (the middle call). Someone answered. Of course, the prescription wasn't ready "because a printer is down." This is standard practice for CVS in Center Point, which is why I was calling in advance. The guy on the line was so used to the lie it wasn't even sincere.

Asked when the prescription would be filled. He didn't know. Of course. Asked if I could have my prescription transferred to a different location. The guy said that I can, I just need to give my name and DOB.

1 hour hold times for calls if you need to speak to someone, and wait time for prescriptions are 20 to 45 minutes even if the prescription was sent 2 hours ago.

This isn't the first time, but it is my last using any CVS. Maybe they own Walgreens or have shares in Wal-mart or somewhere I can get better service.

He did not want to listen to me explain how this was the 2nd time an online special order had been sent there by corporate and all I had to do was pick it up. He was so persistent that I was wrong and he was right. Finally he found my order, but didn't apologize for misunderstanding, but said, "Corporate did this, not us." Okay, what does that matter to me? I showed him the confirmation email that it had been paid for but he still did not believe me and got a manager. Finally the manager showed him that it was sent here, paid for, for me to pick up. Might as well paid shipping to my house for that customer service, or lack there of!

name: Jubilee Dueck
text: This place doesn't even deserve a one-star. One of the technicians here stole half of my prescriptions. Now, I'm from out of town and this was my first and last time using this Walgreens. I went on a Thursday evening, and dropped off my prescriptions, then I went out to dinner. Afterwards I came back to Walgreens, there was a brunette at the register who was rude. I thought, she must be tired because she didn't look too good. I paid for my medication and walked out of the pharmacy. I went back to my place and noticed half the prescription was missing! I thought that's strange half my medication is missing and I just left the pharmacy that's never happened before, so I assumed it was probably a mistake.  When I finally got in contact with the pharmacy, I explained what happened and a woman responded saying she needed to check their records. After a few seconds she comes back on the line to tell me their counts for the prescriptions were accurate and she couldn't do anything about it. I said, I will come up there with the prescription bottles to discuss this! Then she proceeds to tell me she's the Pharmacy's Manager. At this point, I was getting upset! I told her this pharmacy charged me FULL price for a months supply of prescriptions then only gave me half of it. I told her, I had to pay out of pocket for this and I want to be reimbursed.  She continued to say there's nothing she could do.  Well, that's just too bad, because for a "Manager" not to even attempt to investigate  problems when a customer is genuinely upset and telling the truth about a bad experience just baffles me. Why isn't this manager more concerned that a technician took someone elses medicine from the pharmacy's safe and then falsifed records to get away with it?! She's kept saying there's nothing she could do. Really?! Why don't you fire the employee, so this doesn't happen again. Stealing medicine is illegal, but it's ok I know EXACTLY what to do and I will be making a police report about that employee and this Pharmacy.

name: Fred Shiels
text: I gave one star because they didn’t have an option for Zero!!!  These people at the Carter Hill store are the most RUDE, unprofessional “employees” I have ever encountered anywhere. I fail to see how any of them keep a job. Today will most definitely be my last visit to this Walgreens. I guess I should say shame on me... cause I gave them a second chance too. There won’t be a third.

text: I get great service here. The employees are always friendly and helpful.

name: Charge Barge
text: My experience sucked.  They apparently lost my first prescription on a controlled substance.  The pharmacist thought I was lying at first, assuming I was out for drugs.  Then realized that I got a notification from them that my prescription was delayed for the prescription prior to stopping by to pick it up.  They then apologized without giving me my medications.  It was out of their hands, so, I figured, no big deal.  I sent in the second one without a problem.  Today, I returned and I found out they're waiting for a prior authorization for the second medication.  The first one in the morning called my doctor's office and told them to disregard the first prior auth, and then the second pharmacist (Brittni H.) in the afternoon was still waiting for the prior auth that the first one was supposed to send.  Now, prior authorizations take a while to process, so they sadly just wasted a whole day of lack of processing, much to the chagrin of both me and my physician's staff (since we were both given the runaround).  I should really sue the pants off the pharmacists involved in these shenanigans here.
