text: We had to change to CVS when my husband’s insurance changed. This pharmacy is awful in all areas-customer service, answering the phone & questions, and actually having medications and filling prescriptions. We had to go several days with out a very necessary medication. They kept promising they were “working on it”. It is not an unusual Medicine and definitely not one we could go without. We ended up having to go back to our old pharmacy and pay out of pocket price for a 7 day supply. It has been 4 days and we still don’t have his medicine from CVS. I will be finding another pharmacy ASAP.

name: Jase Boswell
text: The pharmacy never has it's stuff together. I have literally been waiting a week for my prescription and they're telling me they're two weeks behind that they'll put me in line. This is just ridiculous I will definitely be changing pharmacies.

name: Laura Bazemore
text: They keep u on hold for so long I’ve been on hold for 55 minutes and when I get thru they are so rude and short with you. In the pharmacy they don’t make eye contact just very unprofessional.

name: Kristen Miller
text: One star is being generous. CVS promises my medications will be ready and then never has them filled on time. The drive thru is always closed, there are long lines, and they are under staffed and rude. One clerk is always particularly rude, and seems to not want to do her job of filling my medication that was promised 6 hours ago. Wish I could take my business elsewhere but my insurance prefers CVS, believe me as soon as I can I will. No one would ever choose to use this pharmacy as their preferred!!

name: Shayna German-Carter
text: I went into the store to purchase an item and had a question. The store manager, Scott, was very rude and disrespectful to the point where he walked away from me while I was asking him my question. I went to the counter to finish asking him and his reply to me was, "I'm the store manager and I have been here 5 years and I do what I want." I informed him that I would take my money and business elsewhere and I'd be calling corporate he stated, "Good, I don't care."

name: TIMOTHY ROACH
text: Don't answer phone. Has annoying music. And, they didn't have prescriptions ready when they say they would have them ready. Customer service sucks. If it was the fact that our insurance (work) want accept any other pharmacy, I would be saying see ya.

name: Sara Freeman
text: The pharmacist was very rude. Then when i tried to call in my refill the left me on hold..

name: Sabrena Brannon
text: I have maintenance drugs I take and the staff in the pharmacy are always so friendly and nice.

name: Paul Peacock III
text: Taking longer and longer to fill prescriptions. Gonna change to Walgreens and see what happens. Waited 20 minutes on the phone to see if my prescription was filled since they could not fill it yesterday. I finally hung up.

name: Scott Bussey
text: Awful and slow. They also lost my wife's prescription.

name: Trip Memorex
text:
Condescending and disrespectful. Incompetent pharmacy staff. The customer is treated as cattle only to be milked of his or her money. The only help they offer is saying " yes insurance pays or no your insurance doesn't pay."
Forget consultations, no time for that.

name: Brayden Morris
text: They took 7 hrs to get me my meds.

name: Serratic Seraphis
text: -Some- of the pharmacy staff are quite unprofessional in their conduct. Store has a grubby feel to it.

name: Kurt Welte
text: Good family pharmacy store

name: alabama angel
text: They never have medication in stock. They will not give you a partial. My dad had to wait for his inhaler because it was filled for three and they only one in stock. I worked in pharmacy 21 years no one went with out their inhaler!

name: Bretta Alless
text: Love it!!!

name: Sam Nichols
text: Not good!!!!!!!

name: jerome hightower
text: Loved it

name: Izzy Goulet
text: Ms. Jessamyn is the BEST pharmacist I have ever had. She's helped me on numerous occasions lower the cost of my prescriptions by dealing with my insurance *insert eyeroll*. She knows my name and is incredibly friendly. She makes going to pharmacy like going to a friend's house!

name: Mark D
text: Very friendly, Employee nice, Very clean store

name: Peach Ciroc
text: My son was Racially Profiled by Donna 1/12/19 when I spoke to her she didn’t deny it . That didn’t sit well so I will be taking action..So CVS This is a shame we are in 2019 and we as African Americans can’t walk in a store without being judge 😡!!! To judge without firsthand knowledge and understanding (or precise knowing) is not discernment but Prejudice!!! CVS RACIALLY PROFILES!!!⁉️

name: Michael “Britt” Powell
text: They are closed most of the time. Ive tried to go in at 8:30 on a weeknight and 7:30pm on a Sunday. They're never open.

name: Chiquita Henderson
text: Short staffed, but very nice people. Whenever, I have to travel an hour away for my Dr. Appt and have a prescription to be filled they will make sure it is filled in a timely manner. Thanks for your efficient service! :-)

name: cocababy59 Alma Delia Marcial Nava
text: This is the cvs where Kimberly Arrington disappeared from almost 21 years ago on 10/30/1998. It's a shame this cvs didn't have servaliance or nothing like that I wonder what happened to her if she made it inside or if any employees remember seeing the then 16 year old girl.

name: Bonnie Turner
text: Excellent service and the store was well stocked and very clean.

name: jason kitchens
text: Very nice staff. They are helpful and are always Busy, no slackers here.

name: Debra Norton
text: Poor customer service and understaffed, I have been a customer for 12 years. I transferred my prescriptions to another company last week. People wake up..... CVS is not the only store in town. Upper management needs to fix this problem before you loose another long time customer.

name: Jessica Brazell
text: Their workers have very bad attitudes toward customers

name: Carl Bechtol
text: Neighborhood drug store.

name: héctor romero
text:
(Translated by Google) Excellent service in Pharmacy, the staff is very professional and friendly. I congratulate and highly recommend them. Vaccination is perfect and safe. They are the best.

(Original)
Excelente servicio en Farmacia, el personal es muy profesional y amable. Los felicito y recomiendo totalmente. La vacunación es perfecta y con total seguridad. Son las mejores.

name: Shawn Hunt
text: This CVS although it was super hot on the inside of the store was great about how they handled both of my Vaccine shots. The staff did a great job and had someone up front to book and set the appointments and even help new people book appointments as well. Good job to CVS on how they have handled Covid as well. I barely had to wait before getting the shot.

name: Troy Leslie
text: My wife and I had an amazing experience at the CVS. Wendy and Mackenzie went above and beyond providing good quality Care.

name: Nicole Davis
text: Pharmacy is unprofessional! They take forever to answer the phone and they do not have good customer service skills.

name: Jay Jordan
text: I don’t know about their actual pharmacy, but if I need something quickly while I’m on this side of town, this is my go to.

name: Steve Smith
text: Will not answer the telephone; changing pharmacies…

name: Jessica Tinsley
text: I’m not one to leave reviews often but I’m doing this to bring it to the attention of the staff here. I dropped off my prescription at 7:15 and she was so sweet and said they would be able to get to it before closing so I told her I would wait over on the side. She very sweetly made sure i was signed up to be notified via text. 30 minutes later I got a call they needed my Insurance Info. I went back to the window and they said they actually didnt and I asked her how long it would be and she said 15 to 20 minutes because they are 3 hours behind. I told her I would wait since I had already been waiting 30 minutes. She apologized and said OK and then 35 minutes later I was still waiting. I ended up leaving because I had my two-year-old with me who needed to get in the bed and will have to make a special trip back bar. I am now home and still haven’t been notified it’s ready which means it’s now been 40 minutes (on top of the 30 before they called me for insurance) since she told me 15-20. I feel that if someone is waiting in your parking lot, there would be some more urgency or a suggestion that i should plan to come back. There was no one else in the drive-thru and the parking lot was empty, so I am certain I was one of the only ones waiting on a prescription. This is just super poor customer service.

name: Vikki Nolen
text: CVS is the worst. I rated 1star because there was not a 0 star option. They provide no customer service they make errors in filling prescriptions and say theyll fix it but they wont instead they will stall until you prescription runs out and refuse to fill your rx for diabetic and/or heart medications. I cant see how they stay in business. If my insurance provided any other option i would gladly use it.

name: Claressa Fells
text:
I went to get a prescription filled yesterday waited 15 minutes while the entire pharmacy staff entertained a I'm assuming regular customer who cursed every other word. After standing in the pick up line  only one in line unacknowleege for 15 minutes I was told my prescription wasn't quite ready although it had been called in 3hrs prior. Showed up this morning at 8 so did 3 other customers who read online that the pharmacy opened at 8 to be told by the RIDEST young lady  that Google has it wrong and we should check better. This entire location is horrible
I will be taking my business elsewhere.

name: Jackson Harrison
text: Excellent/consistent customer service!! Keep up the great work!!

name: Tina Taylor
text: FYI:  The FB reviews are 3 out of 5.  Jaime, the pharmacist, is the RUDEST, most UNPROFESSIONAL person I've ever met.  I have filed a formal complaint with CVS corporate.  Last month, she had the nerve to tell me how incompetent and stupid the Walmart pharmacy was and yelled at their staff.  Not to mention, she was rude to me, as well.  Today, she was EXTREMELY rude to me again.  Enough is enough.  After being a CVS customer since the late 80s or early 90s, all my prescriptions, including my son's and parent's prescriptions, are now transferred to Walmart.  I will never visit CVS again.  Great job, Jaime.  What a mean and rude person you are!!!  Hopefully, someone will start checking your reviews, watching store videos, and monitoring your phone calls.  You shouldn't even have your job.  You're a disgrace!

name: Anthony Pineda
text: So I went to the Gadsden location today. I went to buy cookies. After browsing aisles I went to checkout. After buying my cookies I decided to buy a Hot wheels car. After I paid I went to get the car. After grabbing the car I realized that the cashier followed me. I think she thinks that I was going to shoplift. I don't know if the cashiers are required to follow customer to prevent stealing. (Happened on 1/28/2021)

name: JD G
text: Have been satisfied for most part. Do wish that help would be available in beauty department. Have left with out what I went for when I could not locate it myself. The pharmacy has taken some hard hits in the reviews here. Never experienced poor service and was very grateful for the service of administering flu shots in store.

name: S Wyatt
text: Fast, friendly service and prices are competitive.  Lots of items from home health to snacks and beauty supplies. Fantastic selection of skin care products for all types but I especially appreciate the array of options for sensitive skin and diabetic skin products. Service with a smile and never a problem returning an item that isn't amenable to my needs as long as I have the receipt.

name: fred b
text: If I could give zero stars I would! This pharmacy lacks in basic customer service, very rude employees in the pharmacy. When I wanted to transfer to another pharmacy and the new pharmacy called them, they told the new pharmacy we had nothing to transfer and no refills. Very next week I got notified by Walgreens that my refills were ready. When I called today to let them know I was transferring to Publix pharmacy the girl was argumentative and hung up on me. We will never grace the door of another Walgreens and we will tell everyone we know! Terrible experiences there! Also they discourage use of the GoodRX card for those that are uninsured!

name: Laura Franklin
text: Slowest pharmacy I’ve ever been to. Not just once, but EVERY TIME. Pharmacist are more interested in talking to each other, laughing it up. PITIFUL SERVICE!!!! Changed mine and my husbands to CVS. They are fast and friendly. Strictly business there.

name: Rachel Baugh
text: Highest prices in town, refuse to take GoodRX card for those without insurance,  very rude pharmacy workers. Will never go to another Walgreens!

name: Donyell “Dboy” Owens
text: No might favorite places

name: Jacquelan Bullock
text: Was having issues picking up funds and they didn't even care too help me. Went right too winn dixie amd picked up my funds with no issues. I will never step foot in this walgreens again.

name: Tabatha Vaughn
text: Pharmacy is usually very quick, with the exception of flu season when everyone is trying to get prescriptions filled. Staff is friendly and facility is always clean. They also usually have good sales on everyday items.

name: RENEE RIPP-CLONTS
text: I have been here numerous times the least time was 2 hrs for prescription pick up. My neighbor has to get a a better or quicker pharmacy. This place sucks.

name: Jess Evans
text: this is not a "fill while you wait" pharmacy. you drop it off, you come back later, simple. or else you will be disappointed. end of subject-period. PS pharmacy hours are not the same as store hours

name: Allen Rhodes
text: Linda the pharmacist has helped my daughter more than her pediatrician. Over the weekend we dealt with a sick child and eventually ended up in the ER . However Linda helped me every step of the way with my daughter taking time to explain things and she just showed a genuine concern for my daughter .I can't recommend her enough .

name: Becca Norwood
text: I never had a problem except at the 5:00 rush when people are all trying to get home from work so it's real busy, or on the holiday weekends... We just drop off & go to Walmart. I just had to transfer over to CVS because in Piedmont there is no Walgreens. I still shop here when I can get to Gadsden for a day trip. Great store! Good sales! Nice folks.👍💫

name: Doris Lowery
text: We have always been treated nicely at the store, but we will no longer be shopping there if the policy that we heard has been implemented, that men or women can use each others bathroom, we will not be buying or coming into your store.

name: Barbara Phillips
text: Call you when your medicine is ready have good sales workers are very helpful and friendly nice atmosphere very very clean things are exactly where they tell you where to find them everything is just so in order.

name: Wendy Uhlman
text: The employees are sometimes very nice and friendly....It's heck to get out of there parking lot on to Meighan Blvd...

name: Kevin Wells
text: I've been using them since Justinwas the pharmacist and the staff is very courteous and never judgemental.

name: Malika Wiley
text: Every time I come here there is only 2 people working in the pharmacy and the drive thru is ridiculous no one should be allowed to drop off and wait in the drive thru line 1hr in a drive thru that's crazy......only at Walgreens.. Go to McDonald's I bet you can't hold up there drive thru..smh

name: Brodys mx !
text: Very very rude and don't care about you. Stay away.

name: J Rogers
text: The pharmacy said that it would take about an hour that would have been at 1130 here it is 1335 an I'm still waiting for them to fill my medicine THIS is the least time I will ever give them my business.

name: Carol Payne
text: Friendly and helpful

name: Eleanor Thompson
text: It was hot in there; The doors open with a large fan blowing hot air.  Cashier was nice

name: isabella cowles
text: Very helpful and fast service

name: Timothy Owens
text: Just a cookie cutter store. General chaos inside. Have to search whole store for what you need. Aisles usually so filled with stock waiting to be shelved. Most aisles want even allow buggy all the way down.

name: Nikki Cook
text: Store workers are helpful.

name: Melissa Rinehart
text: I have consistently tried to use this location being we have 5 Dollar Generals in our town, but today was the last time. I was rushing bc I had to pick my daughter up from school so I thought I could run in real fast and grab the one item I needed..ha! That's a joke!! As usual, only one cashier while the line was at least 12 people long!!! And when the cashier called for the manager to come open the other register, she didn't answer him the countless times he called! This place is a disgrace. Always a long line and never more than one cashier. It's quicker to run in Wal-Mart which says alot!!!

name: Gia Peck
text: So I follow the directions to this location and it took me to Greenville Elementary School.........

name: Kayla George King
text: Needs to be cleaned from the front to the back...top ro the bottom...

name: Dianne Jordan
text: It is a store you can go to when you just have  1 or 2 things to get.

name: Sharica Johnson
text: Fast service

name: Tyler Small
text: Okay

name: Delois Smith
text: Friendly

name: Chris Newbern
text: Wonderful people working there, they always give me the best prices on my prescriptions

name: Adam Allsup
text: Called the pharmacy today to check on a prescription, as I usually do when they’ve been dropped off by doctors  over a week ago and wanted to know if they’d be open on Monday. The person started off nice and said yes, so I ask if my medication could be ready by 8am as that’s the usual time they open. “Literally do this EVERY MONTH” he tells me no, I said that’s how I usually do this he says “it’s not up for debate SIR” (Apparently, the pharmacy doesn’t open till 10 on holidays) (that may have been nice information to have been given, rather than being told “it’s not up for debate SIR!” I was absolutely stunned, as I had been extremely nice the whole time. He went on to lecture me so I just hung up on him. This will be the LAST time you speak to me like I’m a child. I will be sharing this story with all of my Cherokee county seniors and friends.

name: Jon Greenwood
text: Great location! Very disappointed that BCBS Alabama doesn't cover CVS anymore! ;(

name: stacy steele
text: Great place.

name: American Auctioneers
text: We love our local CVS. They know us by name and the staff are always friendly and helpful!!

name: Tom Mclemore
text: Always clean and organized. Everytime I have asked questions from the pharmacist, they have always answered my questions or come from behind the counter to help with questions about product. CVS card also offers huge savings.

name: Kenny Smith Sr
text: Nice people, long waits sometimes, but get things right and they answer all your questions.

name: Glenn Huggins
text: We’ve used Johnsons Pharmacy in Cedar Bluff since we moved here 9 years ago, but my company uses CVS Caremark for medicines so the prices are cheaper here.   Just kinda funny getting charged 25 cents a piece for needles when we got them free at Johnsons.

name: Kevin Gowens
text: Close to home and convenient too my disabled family

name: Amanda King
text: Very clean,  best place for vitamins ! :)

name: Thori Brewer
text: Always helpful and friendly!

name: Britney Bailey
text: Very friendly staff and clean store.

name: ReXrig G R
text: Love Shopping Here

name: Mason Reed
text: Never went to the pharmacy but I have been several times just to pick up a few things. I love the store layout and friendliness of the cashiers. A great place to go to pick up over the counter meds, college supplies, or any other small items. Definitely saved me with them being open 24 hours when everywhere else is closed at night.

name: Leigh
text: Went to have a prescription filled a couple of weeks ago. Was told it was going to be about an hour or an hour and a half. Since it was days before qualifying exams for my masters program, I decided to try and wait it out instead driving to my house back, then back to cvs, and then back to my house, because I had my computer and could study. About an hour goes by, and all I hear from the other side of the cash registers is gossipy talk, complaining and conversations of “when did you get here?” “Oh, so we both get off at seven,” etc. I ended up getting sick of hearing it and bought a couple gaterades and asked the girl who had just clocked in and who was checking me out how much longer it would be. A girl, who had not helped me the first time but had just overheard the initial conversation, chimed in before she could inquire with them and said “an hour to an hour and a half at least”. I went home, living less than two miles from the cvs and right after I kicked off my shoes and got set up at my desk I received a message my prescription was ready. Less than 15 minutes later. Unprofessional and unhelpful due to the pettiness and disregard of customer service from pharmacy staff. Highly recommend going to the CVS on Glenn Avenue instead of this one. I’ve never had a problem with them, and pharmacy staff member Lee is my favorite. Always so kind, even when backed up with “17  prescription orders” to fill before my own, unlike south college.

name: Riley Hovis
text: The best service around. As a student I appreciate every bit of cash I can save here and there. I came in and was paying over $100 for my prescriptions and that did not sit right with their team of pharmacy staff. So, they took an extra couple of minutes of their shift to go over why I was paying so much and got by total down to $40. Now that is customer service!

name: Edward Dubuisson
text: The pharmacist , a wowan named Alex, just went above, and Beyond, by Not Quiting untill she could help me. I have been waiting 2 days on Walgreens, and CVS in Opelika.  Alex , at CVS on college street got it done in 5 minutes.  Great Job Alex, Thanks.

name: Harrison
text: Always am greeted when I arrive. Have prompt service and find the things I need.

name: Anya M
text: A cashier at the front completely invaded my space and spent a lot of time trying to open my grocery bag (even though I was at self checkout), then he ended up licking his fingers to open it. During the COVID pandemic especially, this made me feel extremely unsafe and disrespected.

name: Jan Carlock
text: Do not recommend the pharmacy.  They will ignore you when standing in line and go to other people just walking up.

name: Carolina Palencia Gándara
text: I had many troubles with a prepaid money card, I almost lost 300$, but the store manager was very patient and helped me for days until he got to refund me. I very much appreciate his help and kindness with my situation!

name: Garrett Jacobsen
text:
Great for quick grocery shopping. Friendly staff and quick checkout times. One of the self checkout machines tends to freeze up, though, so be careful.

Note: the pharmacy no longer accepts Tricare Standard insurance funded prescriptions.

name: Edel Lopez
text: Convenient, in my way out of the University, perfect to buy milk, cereal, even gifts from the University. Always with good deals and good wine! The young girls working here always have an smile for the clients and very helpful!

name: Matt M
text: Great store with friendly staff! They have many items to buy with convenience. Glad I have them nearby! Highly recommend!

name: Ciji Sabo
text: The cashier was so rude.  She refused to accept my coupons because she was not familiar with the store's coupon policy regarding coupon overages. (However, I should have not been in such a hurry and presented her with a copy of the policy in an effort to rectify the situation, thus the 3 star instead of 2 star rating.)  She seemed frustrated that I chose not to purchase my items when she wouldn't honor the coupons.  Store is clean and very nice, but the customer service was awful!

name: Abbye Rhodes
text: The guy who works at the pharmacy was an absolute jerk to me today. When people come in looking to fill a prescription, they are likely not feeling great, and to be met with rudeness is not fun. When I asked if he could do something simple for me he responded with, "I can, but I am not going to." I have honestly never felt more disrespected. A friend of mine had a similar experience with this employee. His name is Anton and I suggest that if you go to this CVS you avoid him at all cost.

name: Krystian Stern
text: cashier on friday night was really rude and sarcastic to me and i left feeling annoyed

name: Eli L
text: It’s a well run store, and the pharmacy staff are so nice! I get all my meds here and I haven’t been disappointed.

name: John Brenner
text: Inexcusably incompetent and rude.  Their point of sale software clearly has major issues and results in massive lines and multiple attempts needed to complete a transaction -- and this has been a problem for DAYS.  Their left register has this problem; when I asked the cashier to use another register, she lied and said that it wouldn't be open to use.  Sure enough, the manager came to the front and activated the register, and in a very snarky tone told me I "didn't need to be upset" when all I did was point out that their store had an ongoing technical issue.  I will be notifying corporate since clearly not even store management has an interest in being professional.  I was also not given a receipt; I've worked in retail and I know that the only conceivable reason a receipt wouldn't be given is so that the employee names wouldn't be disclosed, so whoever worked on the night of April 4, 2018 around 9:10 PM should be held accountable.

name: Kristina Harper-collins
text: Very convenient. I really like that it is open 24 hours.

name: Randy Farber
text: It's best attribute is convenience.  However, on two separate occasions, I have been bait and switched on posted sale prices, and had to go through a hassle to have the item removed and put back because they wouldn't honor the sale price posted on the shelf.

name: Matthew Bays
text: Nice store clerk everyone is always super nice!

name: wells jadee
text: Shopping here!

name: Walker Ranger
text: poor customer service

name: Yolanda Collins
text: There are certain beauty products that I buy here. I find Walgreens a bit pricey. This store is never crowded and always nice and clean.

name: Candy Bein
text: The pharmacy staff is terrible! Today, I finally had enough of the cashier, Penny, and spoke with a manager. Penny has been rude for the last 4 months. If you don't like your job, you shouldn't be there. You wouldn't have a job without customers. From now on, I will refuse service from Penny whenever she is there. I am almost tempted to change pharmacies completely. If it wasn't for the preauthorization on my husband's much needed heart medication, I would have already changed. I am sure even Wal-Mart Pharmacy treats their customers with more respect. I may even contact corporate if this pattern continues with Penny. The service is so bad that I remembered her name specifically to avoid her in the future.

name: Sam
text:
Today Mary the cashier told me to step back on the big blue dot in the floor at the checkout. I didn’t realize I was 1 yes I said 1 small step outside of the big blue dot. So she scolds me.
If they are going to be so corrective towards customers then tell the manager to pull her mask up off her chin and wear it properly.
The manager was walking around with her mask on her chin.

name: Fran Gaudsmith
text: Rude, condescending pharmacy staff. I am visiting; if I lived here this would be my last choice for a pharmacy.

name: Patsy Mickle
text: Always fast and courteous service. It’s a pleasure to shop here

name: Maurice Korshak
text: This is the best pharmacy and store.  They are always super friendly and polite.  They go the extra mile to make sure we were happy and have a clean well stocked store.

name: Shane Pitts
text: Cashier Connie very rude I just left went to CVS to buy my emergen c she had it on table by register but told you to step back when went to get it was to close if she feels that way maybe should not work around public won’t be back

name: sava gvero
text:
This Walgreen is the absolute best..
Especially the people in the pharmacy.
So professional and helpful !

name: Cory Smithson
text: Always a great experience fast. Helpful. And nice employees. Rona Goodwin is a great associate and has excellent knowledge of the store.

name: Abby Myrex

name: Joe and Angela Eustice
text: I had a few coupons and they matched what I bought . Anyhow the manger was a very unprofessional and said " Walgreens is getting strict on the coupon policy...  I'm not an extreme couponier I just wanted to use the coupons I clipped out of Sunday paper ... I left the store with nothing. And the sales rep Omg you can tell her and the manager didn't get along .  The worst Walgreens I ever been in .

name: Tommy Gunn

text: Just have to give these folks a thumbs up. Everyone there is super nice. What I like about this place is they are fast on filling your prescriptions. Can’t praise these folks enough!!

It’s across the street from east Alabama medical center which makes it busier but this pharmacy team is great. Grace is the best. She’s always so helpful and if I were you I would always ask for her help if you need something specific. Thank you CVS on perperrel parkway!!! Thank you GRACE

text: The staff in the pharmacy is horrible. The guy smacking his gum while telling me they don’t have the med I was prescribed And offers no help trying to help me find another pharmacy. I have to use this pharmacy or I WOULD NOT!! CVS should be ashamed!!!

name: Brandon Teer
text:
One of the most professional and friendly businesses I’ve ever visited!

Danielle, the pharmacist, treated me with dignity and respect while saving more than 250+ dollars on my medication I’ve been paying way too much for from other pharmacies!

The store manger greeted me with more respect as I cashed out some Christmas gifts at the front register while going over and beyond with genuine kindness!

I had my prescription filled and my Christmas purchases paid for in less than 25 minutes!

Merry Christmas, CVS! 🎁

name: Elliott Wood
text: Initial staff was friendly and not a problem. He was willing to forward my question to the pharmacist and I understand her explaination of why she could not do what I was asking about, however there was no reason for her to immediately address me like I had just killed her dog. She was extremely rude without provocation. I won't be back at this pharmacy in the future.

name: Virginia Crawford
text: First time getting a prescription filled took my entire lunch hour, so I decided to drop my next prescription off and pick up after work. I dropped it off at 12 and was asked when I wanted to pick it up. I told her 4. I gave them an extra hour and arrived at 5 in the drive thru. I was told it wasn’t ready and to leave the drive thru line, drive around the building and get at the end of the line. If you can’t count 20 pills and put in a bottle within 5 hours you should close your doors. I will not be back, nor will I recommend anyone do business with your establishment.

name: Kjaye 27
text: People working at the pharmacy are completely unprofessional. Initial pharmacist I spoke with was unnecessarily rude with aggressive comments not needed or wanted. The other techs/pharmacists in the back were speaking rudely about other patients the entire time. Last time I will be picking up from here.

name: Brennan
text: After being discharged from the hospital my husband and I went to the drive through pharmacy to get my prescriptions filled. They informed us it would be an hour wait so we left. He dropped me off at home so I could rest and returned to pick up my prescriptions only to be told they didn’t even fill them yet because they won’t take my BCBS insurance. My husband drove back from Auburn for something they could have told us over the phone. He took my prescriptions to Walgreens where it only took them fifteen minutes to fill and my insurance was accepted. Not only are the workers at this location rude, but also incompetent. Will not be returning.

name: Herbert Alexander
text: I starting calling the pharmacy today at 5:30 today to speak to a technician about a prescription. My wife and I each called at least four times and no one ever took our calls. We were placed on auto hold each time for approximately 5 minutes each. Each time the call either ended due to what I think was an automatic timeout or we were disconnected.  The mangement needs to correct this subpar service.

name: Rylan Delap
text: Staff are negligent, rude and incompetent.  They are actively unhelpful and even understaffed.  This is not only the pharmacy but the store itself.  Ridiculous

name: Kris (With Kris)
text: Great service and friendly staff.

name: Edward Pava
text: What a horrible service at the pharmacy,  this people hate their job, they are miserable and rude. Not coming back to this place, CVS corporation should keep an eye at this location.

name: Unity Is The Key
text: Beware black beauty queens!!!  CVS stores do not honor black skin in beauty products in Opelika, Alabama!! Just sad!!!

name: Lura Gregory Reuber
text: Well i have mixed emotions about this place.On the one hand,the staff is very curious and informative but on the other hand they get scripts confused and it takes forever to transfer.They need to change sign out front because it is not a fast transfer.Their auto call messages are also unclear and not up to date.

name: Twyla Cooper
text: I love this place

name: Monica Thomas
text: Omg!!!! So slow

name: Dama Darby
text: Adam's Drug in Millbrook is just wanted Millbrook needed. They are family owned. Have lots of locations in the area. Sylvia and Josh are so understanding of my condition(s.) I'm a big mess and struggle everyday. They try to keep refills promptly and No judgment. Life can be hard when your body won't work with you so having them understand is a big plus. They remember everyone's names. Other staff is so sweet I just can't remember all their names. Life is hard enough and them helping is a blessing. The only thing missing is a drive thru.

name: Charles Watts
text: I have been using  this pharmacy for five years now. Ninety nine percent of the time, this place is always on the mark, especially with their customer service and I appreciate that. One or two grumpy folks, but they don't seem to stay around long. The bottom line is, I have found these people try very hard and they don't seem to tolerate the prevailing mind set of the major chains that is, "Don't you realize that we are doing you a favor by selling you your medications." The best overall that I have found.

name: Anita Hunter
text: Love this place. It truly is your neighborhood pharmacy. When you walk in the door you are greeted with your name.

name: Angela Lehmann
text: I'm new to them but, I transferred my medications from another, larger pharmacy and so far, have been thrilled I did.

name: Kim Bell
text: Always friendly and very helpful....

name: Rebecca Rolling
text: Some staff are friendly but others could use a refresher course in politeness and courtesy. ..prices are higher than other pharmacies and they close to early. ..

name: mark azar
text: Been using Adams for 2 years and went in to pick up meds today that the doctor called in a week ago, not ready, lady pharmacist stated that she was behind on called in orders.....clerk asked me if i wanted to wait and have it filled and i said how long, pharmacist says 30 minutes, not a sole in the store, i said its 2 ampules of medicine and there isnt a customer in sight, and she let me know real fast how many prescriptions were ahead of mine.......from a week ago!!!!. They never have been friendly, act like your just another number, changing pharmacy's now.

name: Jereme Love
text: Terrible service. I felt like I was an inconvenience to them any time I visited.

name: Scott Crouch
text: Love this place! Friendly,  they know us by name!

name: Melissa Crouch
text: Best Pharmacy in town - nice store,  friendly!

name: Danica Satariano
text: Very helpful and courteous staff

name: Amy Wyatt
text: Fast and friendly service

name: Chuck Phillips
text: Great personal attention

name: Tim
text: Small out if the way pharmacy and gift store with some health care and beauty aid products. Limited selection

name: Michael Nessler
text: Always has what I need

name: Danny Elkins
text: Do not ever go here for OTC meds.  Zyrtec was four times more expensive here than at the Dollar General across the street for the same brand and amount.

name: Lauren Leath
text: I do not like CVS bc I have to wait 30 mins for prescriptions this is crazy I will never do anything with all I’m sorry

name: Darrell Moats
text: Its not my first choice but I have done business here several times. I dont like the fact that you need a card to get their discounts

name: JSU Fan 80
text: Great Service...

name: swampdaddy dan
text: The people are very nice but the pharmacy is slower than molasses. First at the window and it still takes the lady two hours to fill one scrip while I'm waiting.

name: John Wade Woodward
text: Pharmacy folks are rude, condescending and made a simple process very maddening because THEY didn't enter data correctly. I have heard this place is bad. Well CVS corporate needs to FIX this location. I have never had so many issues with other CVS locations. So, Walgreens right across the street is now my pharmacy. Do better! Its not that hard. Im a very easy person so for someone to work me up like this is very rare.

name: Randy Cain
text: This place is terrible,  if the computers are work the people are slow and never have your stuff ready. Rude and disrespectful.  I have to use it because insurance and it's always bad. Every month its something. Computers are down as much as the work.. corporate needs to do something about this store in jasper. I have been to others and they are so much better. If I could give 0 stars I would

name: Destiny LaSha
text: One of the pharmaceutical technicians texted my prescription information to someone that was not myself, which is a major HIPPA violation!! Not only did she text someone about my prescription, she did it on her own time, with her personal phone number. I called and made a complaint, CVS said that they would call me back, which they did not. When I tried to get my prescription transferred to Walgreens, CVS put the Walgreens employee on hold for 25 mins and hung up on them, twice. Would not recommend using this pharmacy, who knows when someone is giving out your information.

name: Stephanie Todd
text: Price suddenly went up on a routine prescription and now calling to find out why but of course no one answers the phone! Literally been waiting for 40 min now and don't expect them to pick up anytime soon!!

name: Kathy Dawson
text: Looked very  clean and friendly service.

name: Dhurata Dobbins
text: Pharmacy staff was amazing! Helped me out with my son’s prescription and made it very easy to obtain his meds in less than 30 min. I was a bit skeptical due to prior reviews, but what I witnessed was nothing short of great customer service. I would definitely recommend this store

name: D Day o' reckoning
text: Most of these people who work in the pharmacy are some of the rudest humans I have ever encountered. I have been an RN for 27 years and if I talked to people like these do I would expect to be in an administrators office the next day. I worked in a prison and the guards were much nicer to the inmates than these people are to their own customers. These people SHOULD NOT WORK WITH THE PUBLIC. I'm moving my prescription.

name: Rebecca Campbell
text: I love that they have a drive thru so I don't have to take all of my kids in the store just to grab a prescription.

name: Whit Defoor
text:
If I could give it a 1/2 star I would. Absolutely unprofessional staff except for maybe 1 person and that’s the only reason for the half point. I’ve been forced to use this pharmacy for a little over a year and  every single time I have had to pick up my monthly prescription (same thing every single month) they tell me a time for pick up and it’s never ready. I usually have to call and wait on hold for 15-20 mins just for them to tell me they haven’t gotten started on it even though it was supposed to have been READY an hour before. Not only that but I no longer have insurance through my job and I pay out of pocket, but for some reason they still make me run around every month explaining to them how I pay out of pocket and have no insurance to verify so they will actually get my medicine together. And like I said I get the same thing every single month.  I pay the same way every single month. This is the worst pharmacy in the history of pharmacies. I’ve used a cvs in warrior AL before and they are amazing so it isn’t the company or brand CVS. They just picked the wrong person to run the Jasper CVS.  And last complaint. I have made numerous complaints about how the pharmacy is treating the patients and I always get the same thing. “We are so sorry we will have the pharmacy manager call you to discuss your issues”. Never heard from anyone and issues still aren’t fixed. Worst run pharmacy if you value your time and money and don’t enjoy having to run around and do the pharmacies job just to pick up your monthly prescription.

So excuse my rant, but,  I’ve had it with this place after a year and a half of trouble. It’s sad when your moving and one of your moving “perks” is getting to use a better pharmacy. Please! someone go to work there and fix this place for the sake of all the people that need their medicine to survive.... because if it’s up to this place... they won’t.

name: sherry rushing
text: It's always a headache to get medicine here. My insurance will not allow us to go to a better pharmacy. Always awful !

name: B. Alys Russell
text:
Update: so after well over 30 minutes, and an f up on their end , I've determined that Amber, the girl I was waiting for, who is also in training, is extremely confident .This is generally a great thing EXCEPT when making mistakes . Her superior should be paying more attention to her at this point to be sure things are not just being done, but being done correctly .

VERY SLOW . My prescriptions have been sent in twice in the past 30 hours. I get here and am still told "20 minutes". They just called my name and the girl is in the back running her mouth. It's been 5 minutes now. The back area is extremely messy ,I don't see how they find anything .Most CVS get things done in a timely manner with 2 workers . There are currently 4 people on the back and they've just told one girl , also the one I'm waiting on , she should let patients know when there's a 3 hour wait, instead of just saying "15-20mins"...I'm still waiting...i wonder if this is one of the stores being closed down ... won't be coming back .

name: Stephanie Vintson
text: I would give this pharmacy a Zero!! I have a complaint in with the corporate office. I have never in 45 years been talked to so ugly by an employee let alone a pharmacist. I. Would not recommend them to no one.

name: Patti Leone
text:
I have had nothing but trouble at this cvs in jasper. They are
Rude and unprofessional. I am going to try and switch to Dora cvs. Checking reviews first. Update: we have switched to Glover Pharmacy and they are the nicest people and no problems with my scripts. They are located in Urgent Care in Jasper on 78 Hwy.

name: Katie Fischer
text: Normally CVS pharmacies are very on top of things, but this one is rough. I wish I didn't have to rely on them. I'd change pharmacies immediately if I could.

name: Lindsey Tyree
text: Terribly unaccommodating. Rude staff. I was in person trying to transfer a script from another state and the girl just says get the app. Then it's call your doctors office. Then it's get the app again. She didn't know the solution herself but wasn't willing to help either. When I didn't walk away I guess she realized she would actually have to help me. BTW there was an issue with the script that I couldn't have fixed myself. I call a few days later to see if my pills are ready but the rx# changed during the transfer so I couldn't check if it was ready on the automated system. When I talked to a tech over the phone again it was just get the app. When I told her the app wasn't helping me do what I needed and I was tired of hearing about their stupid app she pretended she couldn't hear me by saying hello twice and hanging up on me. I use CVS in VA because of their great customer service and they always go out of their way to fix issues. This one in Jasper is a shame to a good company and I have been so disappointed.

name: Keith Trobaugh
text: Very rude staff. I waited four hours and then they say we don't have your Med. I was like wow really.. I only come here if I absolutely half to. The pharmacist in charge needs replaced. He judges you on what you getting filled. I hate the place ... There is laws that protect the privacy of customer's  they don't think it applies to them obviously

name: Julie Brasher
text: Employees are extremely rude for no reason. My nurse had to call them about a concern and she said they were rude to her as well. COMPLETELY UNCALLED FOR

name: Ethan ellenburg
text: Horrible experience every time I go in to pick up my medicine. I have been made to go to the back of the line when my medicine was ready to be picked up and watched the same instance with other customers who were allowed to come to the front of the line and to top it off I just waited 2 hours and 30 minutes for them to fill my one prescription. I normally keep my mouth shut but I am done let's see if yall will fix something for once or right it off as just another random person because the pharmacy set up they have is garbage.

name: John Doe
text: Will not answer the phone most of the time and if they do you are put on hold in mid sentence never to be taken off. Call back you say? Same thing a second time. Complete trash. If you want better business treat your customers better.

name: katie smith
text: Worst pharmacy I have ever used. My insurance makes me use them.

name: Tammy Franklin
text: The wait time when you are on hold is awful im not sure if there is not enough people working there or what but i waited on hold dor a hour and when they answeres the lady was very rude

name: Alex Wilson
text: Terrible place to deal with.

name: Michael Hemric
text:
Wish i could give a ZERO,
This store is horribly slow and the pharmaceutical staff is terrible they have time to stand around and talk while more than once they messed up my prescription & filled it wrong and dropped off for it not to be done 4 hours later still had to wait an hour i drove 45 minutes one way to use this pharmacy because it was the closest one to me and they are higher than everyone else on top of the poor service 5 people cant do 1 persons job at any kind of an effective rate however the general store staff was way more polite if your going for medication don’t bother

name: Nicholas Sourvelis (Srvelis)
text: The least understanding or accommodating pharmacy in Jasper. Rude customer service and all most never have your prescription ready. Expected me to wag my twins inside and refused to accommodate us at the drive thru.

name: andrea sims
text: Worst cvs ever need to fire these slow people and hire folks that want a job. The only reason their getting one star is to write the review.

name: Candi Fletcher
text: I have not used very many CVS Pharmacies in the past. This on in Jasper is horrible. I have had so many issues here I can not even describe them all. When dropping off medication at the drive through there is only one girl that is newer that has a good personality. She is sweet. The others are VERY RUDE. They will tell me it should be ready in an hour and then I don't get a call or a text. I call the next day and I always get how "busy they were"....then don't tell me an hour....I've moved all my prescriptions to Winn Dixie!

name: Jeremy Capps
text: Gave the girl in the drive thru my prescription, and after I waited the 30 minutes that I was told to wait they didnt even fill the prescription that I dropped off. I had to wait again.

name: Amanda Teske
text: Been on hold for 20 minutes without speaking to a rep.... still waiting

name: Carl Skelton
text: Drive thru pharmacy is great. Usually a lack of employees to help in the rest of the store. Love the rewards card. I'll keep going back!!

name: Cathy Smith
text: JUNKIE JASON IN JASPER.... DO NOT GO THERE, THEY LIE LIE LIE TO ALL OF US.

name: Jeremy DeLay
text: Always helpful employees and very clean stocked facility

name: Holly Stephens
text: If you want to wait 12 hours on a prescription go here. They'll fix you right on up. Oh, and they'll be super rude to you too. Great place!!

name: Dalana Dawn Haynes
text: Convenient drive-thru; usually, accomodating, pleasant pharmacy staff.

name: Avis Hudson
text: Awesome employees very friendly and knowledgeable and I enjoy the discounts with cvs card

name: Adolf Hitler
text: This pharmacy is hit or miss on whether you prescription is ready or not.They are always very slow for the last 4 years i know of.If they say your prescription will be ready at 3pm,you better come at 5:30.And the auto-fill is totally useless.The Jasper,Alabama CVS (airport rd) is notoriously horrible.If it's just 1 prescription,it may be ok.Any more than 1 will throw them into a short circuit.I know from multiple experiences.

name: Sarah Black
text: I never write reviews, but I feel the need to warn people about this CVS. Seriously, don't go here unless you absolutely have no other choice or have copious amounts of time to kill.

name: Paula thrasher
text: Staff worked like old machinery, went there because Walgreens did not have my med. never made eye contact did not smile

name: Marsha Lynn
text: Very slow at the drive thru pharmacy window. Wait time is too long. Drop off prescriptions and when told to come back later, prescriptions are still not ready. Need improvement on the wait time and customer service as well at the pharmacy window.

name: Vincent Wilhite
text: very long wait  some people there are very rude the line inside isn't very long

name: Hug Savage
text: Slow pharacmy very slow

name: xavier noceda
text: Awesome

name: Ron Martin
text: terrible

name: T “Lady T” CL
text: Good clearance items. Store closing soon everything 70% off.

name: Anne Fuqua
text: Pharmacy staff are great and wait is minimal.  Beats other local chains hands down any day:-)

name: Blaine Hurt
text: First review? Well then. I had to make a trip to Trinity Medical and was asked to pick up some Alka Seltzer and cough drops for some visitors. The associate working the register asked for my birthday which I hesitated because I was caught off guard (Alka Seltzer, really?). Long story short, the associate got loud and snappy.  I wasn't asked to show my ID, I offered to show my ID.  If I was asked to do that in the first place, none of this would have happened.  The fact that the associate got loud with me in the midst of all the other customers did it for me.  There was no reason for it, I'm done with this store.  I've got a story to tell though, so I got that going for me.

name: Angela Reneé
text: Love it

name: Jennifer Newton
text: Good go to when you need something. They have some of just about everything, and they are just about everywhere now.

name: Nathan Oliver
text: Good selection on merchandise and very helpful employees.

name: Gray Taite
text: Love to shop at  dollar general

name: Ash xD
text: Best dollar general in the county!!

name: tony adams
text: Always fast in an out ....in a good way

name: Amy Tudor
text: Nice

name: Joe H.
text: Dollar General on Hwy 178 in Fulton Alabama is a great place to shop. Great employees, and a clean store.

name: Denise Deas
text: I can go in get what I want or need and get out. The employees are extremely nice too.

name: Pretty Black Gal
text: Nice, clean, and good service

name: Joseph White
text: Love it

name: Carrie Champion
text: Good

name: Kennedee Harris
text: My experience at this CVS was simply horrible. Let me explain. There have been multiple occasions when the pharmacy staff told me I have 0 refills, and I hear verbatim from my doctor that I should have a prescription for one- year- supply. Please keep in mind the phone consultation I had with my doctor regarding the difficulty receiving my medication cost $$- so it bothers me that they refuse to refill my prescriptions when I have refills. It is a shame they do not train ALL pharmacy staff to have the competence to troubleshoot any insurance plan issue that arises. These staff members have an ethical responsibility as healthcare professionals to help- that they lack.

name: J Kindred
text:
I drive nearly 5 miles out of my way to shop at this particular CVS. There's one near my house, about 4 miles away. But the personal, hospitable, kind, compassionate & knowledgeable staff that I encounter at this store is more than worth the extra time. One's relationship with their pharmacist is a very close & personal experience. I've sadly found that many pharmacists seem to have little or no respect for those who are essentially their patients.
What earns this location the rare 5 star rating is that the golden qualities of the pharmacist & their pharmacy staff is found in every employee with whom I've had interaction. Honestly, Corporate should utilize this store as an example of the standard they need to see in every one of their pharmacies/ stores.

name: Jesse Pope
text: Not surprised to see they have below a 3 star rating already. Just moved to the area used CVS my whole life 8 different branches across 5 cities and this place by far was the worst pharmacy experience iv ever had. Employees are rude and reluctant to offer any kind of help. I have used the same medication for years I just needed a refill. None of my insurance or Dr. Information has changed but somehow they claim it has. After calling my Dr. (Phone consultation $20) reassured me the problem was on their end and he didn't want me to be without my meds so he sent in another refill. When I arrived they said I would have to pay full price wich I could barely afford it . Not wanting to argue with someone who could clearly care less I agreed and they said it would take about 15 min. I arrive one hour later to find they forgot to fill arguably my most important perscription of them all. To make matters worse I'm flying out of town the next day with alot less money and without my medication.  Awful group I recommend going litarally anywhere else but here.

name: Stephen Hummel
text: Will not answer the phone and half the time I stop by to use the pay near me they have it's down.  One lady told me they didnt even have payment services but the next day they did

name: Mrs. “Wildfleur” N
text: I thought they were super sweet and friendly. My husband went a different time and said the same. Usually I think most Cvs stores are rude but not this one.

name: Domonique “Dom” Fields
text: I'm glad I don't just go off of the reviews. I have been going to this pharmacy for a few years and never have I ever experienced what I've seen noted on some of these reviews. The staff are kind, friendly, knowledgeable, and always willing to help when they aren't crazy busy because most of the time they are! Please don't just read the reviews and decide based solely on them whether or not you'll use their pharmacy. Go and form your own opinion. I love them and that's my story!

name: Freeman I
text: Terrible experience at this CVS. Throughout the day I was on hold for hours... Unacceptable. Some woman (sounded like a white female) picked up with a bad attitude, short temperature, and just rude. She yelled out on the phone for me to stop yelling at her and then ended our conversation. I just wanted to make sure she heard me! Called Pharmacy manager and she said "well she thought you were yelling at her." So that is a excuse to end the call. What about her short patience/lack of customer service. I had been on hold for hours, what if I had an urgent need? I moved to Alabama to experience this kind of behavior? One star for the pharmacy is a compliment. I can't wait to fill out the survey for this chain! I do not feel safe getting my medicine from this location.   Everyone I spoke to today had a bad attitude!

name: Mark Hickinbotham
text: Friendly and knowledgeable pharmacy staff.

name: Monica Montasseri
text: Went for passport photos. Tristan was very helpful and friendly. The process was fast and efficient. Thanks, Tristan.

name: Tarah Shenay
text: They are fine until you change insurance companies. Apparently they all have trouble reading or don’t have the time to. I called to tell them my insurance changed and I was told to bring the card when I get the prescription. A couple of days later I had my fiancé pick up my prescription with my new insurance card but they said I needed a prescription card so he left with out my prescription. I call and read off what they needed on the same card my fiancé gave to them earlier. So make sure if something has changed to call before you go and insist that you read it to them instead of coming in or you will be aggravated and writing a post much similar to this one.

name: Jared Toone
text: Good location, really convenient. Also they have good deals on vitamins and other products.

name: JayJay Wong
text: Called the pharmacy to ask about typoid vaccine shot. Pharmacist said there's no shot, only pill and sworn by it. According to CDC website, there are two different vaccinations: oral has live typhoid vaccine and shot has inactivated typhoid vaccine. To have a pharmacist (actual pharmacist and not their helper) who is wrong and unwilling to admit or even know that he’s wrong, is horrific. To think they suppose to know more about medicine after the schooling they went through and passed… Beware!

name: Olivia G D
text: Pharmacist was rude and inconsiderate you could probably get better customer service at the pound.

text: Pharmacy staff knowledgeable how about all things.

I’ve had several prescriptions messed up( the pharmacy always blames the Doctors office) the pharmacy has even filed a scrip with the wrong insurance carrier which as been a pain to deal with for quite a while. It just seems to be a mess there.. changing pharmacies..

name: Champ Ion
text: Nicely maintained store but the bathroom dispenser for towels needs to be fixed LOL

name: Joelle Tucker
text: The store is newer and very clean, well stocked.  Don't expect to get in and out quickly. The pharmacy staff leaves much to be desired.  Waited in line in the drive thru just to have them tell me I must come inside and  wait in line all over again just because I was using a "GoodRx" discount prescription card.  Rx staff needs to work on telephone skills as well and maybe just a  basic desire to help customers would be a step up

name: eva seidel
text: Closing early and not letting customers know during a pandemic should be a crime. Update your store hours in a pandemic or stay open.

name: Delores Pearson
text: Terrible service at Pharmacy especially if you’re African American. I have never been ignored by the cashiers when checking out at the front of store. Pharmacy area has a race issue at this location that needs to be addressed. Went to pick up my medication and was ignored for 10 minutes before I questioned if someone was going to assist me.  Will never go to this location again.

name: Carla Wood
text: The people in the pharmacy are exceptional -- I'll never forget their kindness to me following two hospitalizations. They are always ready to assist with answers regarding complicated medications, and they've caught prescriptions before that were prescribed to me, but which would interact badly with other medications I must take.

name: MaryWesley Few
text: Awful experience and workers, go to Crestline

name: Brian W. Kittrell
text: I am always treated as a valued customer. They make a point of calling me by name, which means a great deal. The store is usually very well stocked on sale items and if I’m ever having trouble finding an item they are more than willing to take me to the item.

name: 70Wyatt
text: The pharmacy is now a training site for Samford University pharmacy students going on about a year or so.  Therefore, the services will not be 5 stars with students, so I have learned to cope with the college students and ignore certain things because of this....

name: Matilda Easterbrook
text: I've gotten prescriptions filled here a few times and it's never been a pleasant experience. I always seem to have to wait for someone to be available, even with no line and multiple people working. The pharmacists also tend to have an attitude.

text:
I called last week and asked for my prescription to be refilled, I went to pick it up today after driving forty five minutes that they hadn’t bothered to fill it the person was working at the drive through did even bother to apologize
Now I have drive back tomorrow to get my prescription as the pharmacist was at lunch
How convenient

text: I was waiting on my insurance to start, a week or so in between, and I needed an emergency dose of insulin, they basically told me that's tough, I can't help you. This is life or death for me. Not good.

text: Absolutely the worst customer service ever. From management down. The pharmacy is unreliable, doesnt follow through, and is unprofessional. Even the Regional manager has poor follow up skills. Shame. The staff changed and thats when the level of service changed. Go to the Roebuck location!

text: Always great service

name: Kristal Sullivan
text: Always have what I be looking for. They have great deals.

name: Eric Taylor
text: This is my local Walgreens. I usually visit several times per week for small shopping trips. The staff is friendly and helpful. The store is always clean and well stocked. Despite the neighborhood, I usually feel safe here at any hour, even with my kids. Like any chain drug store, the prices can be a good bit higher than a grocery store. However, if you stick to the current deals, use your rewards card, and load coupons, you can save a great deal.

name: Daniel Conniff
text: I stop in here every week or so and the staff is always very friendly. I had to speak to a manager recently and a very nice young lady named Penny sure was kind and super helpful. I recommend this location highly.

text: I was in this Walgreens which is my neighborhood Walgreens and a customer asked the cashier Amy can they come in without a mask and she said yes in front of everyone which is disturbing being that we are in an epidemic so I kindly asked her isn’t that against Walgreens policy which the sign clearly posted at her cash register which I pointed out said entry without a mask is prohibited, and that didn’t sit well with her moral of my issue is I won’t be buying anything from any establishment where the employees don’t even take this corona virus serious. Sadly she could be putting lots of people in harms way by simply not following the rules. Walgreens needs to retrain the employees ASAP

name: J C
text: The pharmacy manager, Tiffany, is wonderful! She is so nice and goes out of her way to help. It took me a while to get to know everyone at this store..I had been a Rite Aid customer... but the pharmacy staff is polite and helpful. The store employees are pleasant and welcoming.

name: Aynon9 Seclude
text: This is the one that’s closest to me so it’s the most convenient. However, it’s this one cashier that works there and she is very unprofessional. She always seems to get attitudes when people ask her any type of questions or if you have to put something back. I don’t think she should be able to work there acting like this especially if this is what she applied to do ! Her name is Brittney and I hope the manager does something about this.

name: Emily Busby
text: The two pharmacist are usually very helpful and nice and the cashiers are too but they give me trouble just about every month concerning my prescription. I take one prescription a month which is a schedule three or four narcotic I believe. I go to my doctor and he writes my new prescription every 28 days. I take two a day which equals 56. I drive almost two hours to this doctor and live in a rural area that never has this medicine so I always stop at this Walgreens and every time they tell me they can’t fill it until the next day or I have to wait two days even tho my doctor schedules my next appointment on the exact day my medicine runs out. For example I got my prescription filled there last month on 2/5/20. Went yesterday after my appointment to fill my script for this month which ran out yesterday. Waited in traffic and in line for over 20 minutes only for the cashier to tell me she can’t fill it until tommorow. I didn’t even waste my time explaining to her that I couldn’t turn around and drive two more hours again the next day or that my medicine ran out yesterday so technically I could have gotten it filled two days early as per the narcotic laws. I’m not sure if she dosent pay attention to the quantity and counts thirty days or she just dosent care to actually read the directions on the prescription. This is also a medicine that if I don’t take it causes extreme withdrawals so I ended up having to drive 30 plus miles out of my way and wait two to three days for another pharmacy to fill it. Got home and called and asked them via the phone if I was eligible to get it filled yesterday and the lady said yes. Needless to say these people don’t understand that some of these medicines are people’s lifeline and they don’t understand the danger and inconvenience of having to drive all around the country and risk your health all because they can’t take twenty seconds to read a prescription look up last day it was filled and count 28 days. Drove 30 miles to another pharmacy keep in mind another WALGREENS pharmacy and they told me I could have gotten it filled Sunday. Done with Taylor road. They also charge me(no insurance same medicine and same amount every month never changes) anywhere from 180$-300$ went to another Walgreens paid 112$ explain that.

name: Clayton Waring
text: Got snapped at by the clerk when my card didn’t go through. While I️ was moving the money to pay the rest of my balance, the clerk and the woman behind me in line started having a very rude and judge mental conversation about me not being able to afford makeup and then judging me for wearing makeup. Before this I️ was in the store for 15 minutes and was never asked if I️ needed help. If you are a service worker you can at least pretend to be nice or even have some manors.

text:
I, along with three other cars, just sat at the pharmacy drive--thru line waiting to be served for more than 10 to 12 minutes. I could not believe that they allowed one car to sit at the window so long, where in comparison to CVS, you would be asked to pull around so that others would be served while you were waiting on your prescription. The car in front of me was not given any consideration when they finally pulled up to the window at the        6 p.m. - closing time. I have never seen anything like this from a customer service standpoint -- and I have seen bad service.
Unfortunately my insurance has forced me to use Walgreens for my pharmacy needs but I am going to look for another location.

We now go to a different Walgreens further from us just to avoid having to deal with these incompetent pharmacists who seem to resent you (the customer) for asking them to perform the job they agreed to work.

name: Eastwood
text: Can’t say enough good things about Pill Box. They have the greatest staff. Every single one of them are incredible. Super friendly, funny and helpful. They become part of your family. Even if I moved I would drive the extra time to use them.

text: Rude, inattentive, zero customer service skills. Would give zero stars if I could.

text: In my opinion the best pharmacy hair ever. And the Pill box Pharmacy staff Are absolutely amazing.

name: Anthony Fuqua
text: Ricky and other phamacists and staff have always been helpful and courteous.I dont know how they do it but even when theyre busy they have my prescription ready within 30 minutes maximum.Believe its because they staff the store to where they have enough people to fill all the orders that come in.Have used this pharmacy since year 2000 or so.and I turned 40 this year.I will be there tomorrow.

name: Paul Wimberley
text:
My parents have been using Pill Box Pharmacy and now I know why. After a day of dealing with doctors, hospitals, and a sick father, it was off to the pharmacy. As we pulled up there was a line of cars at the drive-thru and many people inside. I thought this would be just another step of an arduous day. It turned out to be one of the best customer service experiences I have ever had.

The ladies behind the counter were working as fast as they could and all were doing it with smiles, professionalism, and compassion. They looked like a well-oiled machine as they went from preparing the prescriptions to checking out customers. The Pharmacist had a laser-like focus on a complex set of instructions from our doctors. She presented different options to help us save money and make it easier on us to administer the necessary medicine.

Another lady sat down with my Mom to explain the devices we would be using and patiently showed her how to use them multiple times. She advised us on ways to save money in the future since we will now have a new expense to incur every month.

I can't say enough good things about everyone who helped us at the Pill Box last night. I only wish there was one in my town so I could move all of my prescriptions to them.

name: Mary Wright
text: Great workers. Fast and very sweet

name: Howard Garnett
text:
GREAT FOLKS!
I have used this pharmacy for as long as they have been in Priceville, and they have always been friendly,and helpful,and able to answer any questions I have had. I rate them 5 out of 5 stars!

Unorganized. I was told by the assistant that the prescription I needed only had 38 in stock, however, I needed 90. Also , that I had to wait 30 minutes.
After waiting, I returned home with the wrong medicine.
They substituted the prescription with a Generic brand.
I called them the next day 3 times, but, was on hold 15 minutes and No One picked up the phone. Now I have to drive there to get the issue resolved.
Poor Customer Service.

name: Patrick Dreher
text:
Words are hard to come by to adequately describe how rude and unprofessional the pharmacy technician was to me this afternoon. I waited 20 minutes on the phone to ask if they had a prescription in stock (which every CVS I have ever called is happy to do), she cut me off, rattled off an excuse for why she couldn’t look it up and hung up on me mid-sentence. I called back 3 more times waiting 5 minutes each time trying to save a trip to the store and never got an answer.

The best part: I called 3 other CVS stores in the area, all of them answered right away and gladly looked up their inventory for me. The pharmacy technician is uninformed, unhelpful, and apathetic.

If you don’t believe me, just read the other reviews. Do yourself a favor and go to a different CVS.

I have to practically beg to have them continue to look in their system. When they do find it 10 minutes later, they continue to be rude. I have experienced rudeness in person, in drive thru, and over the phone. I avoid this CVS at all costs.

Being a severe allergy sufferer, this will pretty much make me sick. Thank you for endorsing an inferior product.

name: Heather Simonetti
text: Called in a refill for my son at 5pm. Was told the prescription would take 15 to 20 minutes. I arrived at the location at 6:30 prescription not ready. An hour later the prescription had still not been filled. Then when it was they did not have enough medication.

text: They open at 7. I had the worst stomach pains once over night from acid reflux, and was able to go there early in the morning and get some meds super fast. Helpful staff.

It's nice and clean inside, and anytime I have been thru the drive thru it has been a pleasant experience! I love that the have milkbones for my dog whenever she gets to tag along!

text: Friendly staff and a great selection of general products. Never had a problem here!

name: J T
text: Worst pharmacy service I've ever experienced. There's no reason getting a prescription filled should take an hour. I'd rather go anywhere than here.

name: Geneva Bedell
text: Have most items needed for health and beauty

name: Caitlin Carson
text: This Walgreens is always extremely busy. I’ve had to wait for 20 minutes in the drive through. They take at least 45 minutes to fill prescriptions. I scheduled my first Covid vaccination here and even that took 45 minutes. I came back today just now to get my 2nd vaccination and waited at the window for 5 minutes. Then someone told me it would be a while because 3 people were in front of me and the vials had to be taken out of the refrigerator to get to room temperature. They don’t seem to have enough staff. Either it’s that or they do not have a good workflow process. Do anything you can to avoid this location. They are very scattered and seem very unorganized. At least the girl was polite and told me it would be a while. That’s why they got 3 stars instead of 1. Time is valuable though and no one should have to wait for more than 10 minutes to get a shot. The actual shot doesn’t take that long. Because of this I left and don’t know when I will reschedule or if I will reschedule. But it won’t be at this location.

text: Technician yelled at me. they also said all of my prescriptions outload infront of others (HIPPA doesn't apply for these guys?). Manager would not give me the 3 minutes to talk to me after they asked what they could do for me?? If I could leave negative stars I would. Please do not go here if you want to be treated like a customer - I've been treated better at the Birmingham DMV

Then at the registers at front they have bad attitude like they don’t want no one at the store. They have to change or they will be loosing a lot of customers.

We switched to a Walgreens in another town and STILL get our prescriptions faster than this one so much closer to where we live. Definitely wouldn’t recommend to anyone.

We have had several prescriptions filled here and the majority of them have had an issue where we have had to return the next day to pick up our prescription.  We have notifications set up but we never receive a call or text that something is wrong.  The staff is always friendly and that is why they got two stars.

Cashier looked like she didn’t want to be there, didn’t even say a “hello how are?” NOTHING NOT ONE WORD the whole time when checking out not even the told or anything!! Every unprofessional!!

text: Seems like I am on here once a week at least to pick up something. Staff is always very nice and helpful. I never have a problem finding what I need.
