text: Love this location...great people and nicely kept store!

name: Misty Marks
text: I used to love this store but lately they need to train their cashiers on their own coupon policy. Telling me I can only use one coupon is ridiculous when it states 2 or 4 on the coupon. I will not be returning. Walgreens is already overpriced.

name: Mario Heard Sr.
text: Always great more helpful than Walmart love the text when medicine is ready and a phone call before you run out.

name: Melissa Seay
text:
They NEVER answer the phone when you call...EVER! Then you end up driving there to take care of something that could have been resolved over the phone. Service is so S L O W...

Updated:  If I could give less than one star, I would. I had a prescription filled for Flexeril, a muscle relaxer.  They gave me the wrong medication!  I received Singulair, an asthma medication instead.  I called and the tech that answered the phone was less than concerned and borderline indifferent! I am so mad right now!  I spent  almost $600 out of pocket for physical therapy because I thought the medication wasn't helping!

name: Katrina Conley
text: This is the worst place to get a prescription refilled. I called about 3pm and the girl told me it would be ready about 5:30pm. When I get there(after 9) they don't have it and they tell me its not covered under my insurance. I get the same script filled every month and its always something. I bet I'll get a call tomorrow with the voice message saying my prescription is ready. At least she should have called to let me know or something instead of me wasting my gas. Think I will go to CVS

name: Caroline Tygret
text: Prescription was filled by different Walgreens so they cancelled it to fill here. While I sit  there waiting finally someone asked who I was. I told them and they said, they didn't have the medicine to fill my prescription. So I had to call them to refill it again and go out of my way to pick up my prescription. Will be finding a new pharmacy. I have already told a few other people and they will no longer shop at Walgreens.

name: Carol Disney
text: I have my share of issues with them, but at the end they solve the problem and a smile. We must remember we are not the only person they see.

name: Misty Moore
text: Update since last time...I thought I would give this store another shot but then they refuaed to take even ONE coupon because it was already on sale....are you freaking kidding me?!?!?!

name: Ferletia Sheppard
text: I Like this Walgreens.

name: Stephanie Staton
text: This is the worst pharmacy in all of Huntsville drop a prescription off at 4pm was told it would be ready by 6 called around 6:30 was told it wasn't ready yet called at 8:30 and no one would answer called the store its self and the manager said it wasn't her problem this store needs to have its staff fired will never go here again and would not recommend this place to anyone under any circumstance this store needs to be investigated DO NOT GO TO THIS STORE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Monster Babe
text: Kind employees. Clean store.

name: John Berry
text: Friendly staff

name: Roses Murdoc
text: OUT OF STOCK

name: Azucena Martinez
text:
(Translated by Google) The service is pity, it takes an hour to pick up your recipe outside and it takes them to have it ready, they don't answer the phone they leave you on hold and never answer 💣💣😡😡😡

(Original)
El servicio es pesimo ,tardan una hora recoger tu receta afuera y tardan en tenerla lista , no contestan el telefono te dejan en espera y nunca contestan 💣💣😡😡😡

name: LaShae Smith
text: Really like this WalGreens! Scottie is always helpful!

name: Chante Thomas
text: Excellent customer service.

name: Mary Wright
text: I walked with my friend all the way there and should have had 2 minutes left when they should have closed at 6:00 they were already closed. My prescription was ready but noone would get it for me. It was counted and could have been gotten....She missed getting her medicine and was very disappointed.  She may change pharmacies.....

name: Robyn Mudd
text: Don't expect to be able to use your reward points here. Doesn't matter whether you put in your phone number or use the card, you're going to get "You have nothing to redeem". Tonight was the final straw for me. The MANAGER checked me out and of course said I had nothing to redeem yet my receipt said I had a beginning balance of 5000 which was $5 I could use. Called customer service when I got home and they said "You should have been able to use them because you actually have more than $5". This happens ALL.THE.TIME. Why should I be loyal to this company when they hardly ever follow through on their word/policy?

name: Mallory T
text:
Apparently this store may close a few minutes before they are scheduled to close. My husband and I, along with two other customers, were met with locked doors at 5 minutes until closing.

I understand that it’s not ideal to pop in last minute, but I guess Walgreens won’t be our go to anymore.

name: Jeffery Robison
text: Conveniently open for late night needs and many kinds, thanks for being there.

name: Mallory McAtee
text: I went to drop a percription  off gave the lady my insurance card she said they take it. It will be ready at 1 great go about my day. I come back at 2 to get my medicine to be told they do not take my insurance. No phone call or anything so I have to go somewhere else being sick and pregnant driving all around town because they could not pick up the phone or check it when I have the lady to begin with. I will never shop at Walgreens again!!

name: Vin Bryant
text: The regular part of the store is great. They have the best selection of candy in Decatur. An employee named Scottie is always helpful and nice. Too bad Scottie don't work in the pharmacy. The pharmacy rates at the bottom of all big named pharmacies in Decatur. They never have prescriptions ready when promised. If you drop a prescription off to be filled it will likely take two or three hours. The pharmacy staff are rude and treat people like you are there to serve them. I've tried all of the big name pharmacies in Decatur and they are the worst. Go to Walmart on 6th Ave sw for your big named pharmacy needs.

name: Chris Alexander
text: Terribly slow and poor customer service.

name: Debbie Hodge
text: Friendly service, good location

name: Jackie McGill
text: Such a much needed and welcome addition! I’ve lived downtown for 7 years and it is so convenient to walk a couple blocks for practically anything you need. The addition of produce and more grocery items is great, it’s clean, it obviously has more staff than the others nearby, and they’re all friendly and helpful!

name: Justin Bzdell
text: Very nice, clean, and  convenient store in Downtown Huntsville. Great for a quick trip to the store for most of anything you might need.

name: Lacey K
text: Love this is right out my front door & I don't have to drive anywhere! Very nice set up & friendly employees!

name: Phat Sunny
text: So, So happy to have DGX open in downtown!

name: Nicholas Nicholas
text: Modern and improved.

name: Leonard Thomas
text: Needed to get some photos printed ASAP for a business event. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. Kristen patiently walked me through the kiosk process and the photos turned out Great and right on time. I would definitely recommend this CVS for your printing needs.

name: Wilson Gregory
text: Great employees at the Pharmacy always nice to me when I go there and hurricane sally they was the only ones open to fill my heart medication A++

name: Nancy Brislin
text: Great staff.  They are always friendly and helpful.

name: Charissa Guyre
text: Kinda sad when everyone is looking for toilet paper and you see an employee walking through the store carrying the last package of toilet paper and saying, "since this is the last pkg I guess I need to buy it for my neighbor".  At least hide the fact of what you are doing and do not publicize.  As employees it is obvious that you have first pick of items that are much wanted by everyone and cannot be found anywhere, but no need to run it in the public's face!

name: Stacy Stevens
text: The ladies at the front were very kind and helpful! They made my day during this gloomy quarantine, and they helped create my mother's Day surprise!

name: Destiny Carl
text: Its 2:43 pm been trying to get in touch with the pharmacy since they opened. Not only did I wait for 30 + minutes I was hung up on only to call back to be told I'm 8th in line when clearly I was next WHEN THEY HUNG UP ON ME! And before I could even utter that out of my mouth I was put back on hold. I get it gets busy. I've worked in retail and food service. I know busy but that was just ridiculous. I just need my daughters prescription....

name: Cindy Dittman
text: Very helpful staff in both the store and pharmacy.  I often drive-through to pick up prescriptions. My dog likes the milk bones they give her!

name: Kristyn Savage
text: Such a great, personal experience at this CVS. Kerrie and her team always go above and beyond. I can’t speak highly enough about my experience here!

name: astro
text: GO TO WAFFLE HOUSE

name: Joyce Cain
text: Love the store but pharmacy was always out of meds

name: Erskin Hickman
text: Very overpriced.

name: Audra Woodruff
text: Excellent service, even better staff!!

name: Oleksander OT
text: Good

name: Gail Den Beste
text: Good

name: Greg Noeninckx
text: Impressive enough to share.

name: Sandra Wilkerson
text: The pharmacy staff at this location are great. The few times I've had to wait they were apologetic and kind. Highly recommend.

name: Mallary
text: I went in with a friend about 10 minutes before closing to print a few pictures, then an employee walked over and said we’re closing in 5 minutes(about 7 or 8 minutes before closing)  then proceeded to stand and stare at us until  we walked away from the kiosk. Then went to the door and told another customer the store was closed,(about 5 minutes before closing) and then locked the doors while we were still in the store. He was really rude and overall it was very poor customer service. Definitely won’t be frequenting this location.

name: Myra Mcallister
text: They make a lot of mistakes  , meds missing out of the box , never put the correct lids on the bottle.

name: Wanda McKee
text: Slow and would prefer using another pharmacy

name: Bobbie Sue Chandler
text: The lady up front makes the store

name: Tee West
text: Not my normal pharmacy, but on a Saturday when my pharmacy was closed the staff helped me out although there was a problem with my insurance they did all they could to get my prescriptions and at the cheapest price.  All the pharmacy staff treated me very kindly!!

name: donna “Dee Dee or donna jean” rothamer
text: Better than Walmart pharmacy to me at this moment....we'll see if there's consistency...I require consistency. ..just sayin, so I will have to update at a later time 🤔

name: Taylor Maynor
text: Rude staff that will hang up on you or just ignore your call. Tasked 3-4x longer than most pharmacies and are horribly priced.

name: Nancy Manning
text: Incompetent. We dropped off our prescription and waited 45 minutes. We went back and they had not even started the first one. You know the guy that left forgot to type it in. Wow

name: Keepn It reall
text: Super nice always do what they say . Fast service

name: Sherrie Manning
text: No business hours of open or close days of week pharmacy is open or close and are they open on any holiday I am looking for a respectable pharmacy that is open late

name: Lynn Long
text: Carli makes my visit fast and easy if I have any problems she fixes everything. Love love love my CVS Family.

name: Kelly Denton
text:
I give them 4 out of 5 stars.. I've been using their pharmacy for about 4 years now& the pharm tech always makes sure I get the right medicine and right amount.

One time, one of the pharmacy technicians called my cell # to make sure I had enough of my prescription bc the count wasn't coming out right for them; she was afraid they had messed up and gave me less.

CVS will always be my first choice..even though it takes up to 45-90 mins to get your meds filled; they txt you when your scripts are ready and have auto-fill as an option, as well. The staff at Scottsboro, AL are very friendly and informative.

name: Stephanie Hamilton
text: Horrible service. Waited on a prescription for 6 hours and they conveniently forgot to send it over to a pharmacy in the area who actually had the prescription in stock.

name: Josh Brooks
text: People are rude and not helpful at all. I'll stick with Big C

name: Erica/ Billy Blalock
text: Nice friendly staff!

name: gemini83
text: Rude cashier's

name: James Dodson
text: I just get my prescriptions here

name: candice smith
text: Pharmacy staff is extremely rude and slow

name: Mack Dingler
text: Terrible experience, got email that said I had three prescriptions ready for pickup, went to pickup only had two ready, didn't  know anything about the third, I still have the  email. One star is as low as you can give, poor management. This rating will never appear in their reviews.

name: Bobby Russell
text: Great service friendly people.

name: Shana Lynn
text: My fiancée attempted to pick up my meds after surgery, with my ID as well as his. The refused to let him because his DL is “expired,” even though he’s renewed online, and they could’ve easily verified that. Making someone who shouldn’t be out or up right after surgery, during a pandemic, just to “ cover their asses” is unacceptable. Don’t go here!! Will never step foot in the Walmart again!

name: Tam Hoob
text: Have really improve over the years and treat people really well by what i can see..

name: Carol Frazee
text: They are pathetic,  every time we go to pick up a prescription there's a problem. We live 30 miles round trip. My mother is 86 and it takes 2 or 3 trips to Jasper before they get it right. Not to mention lying to your face about a pickup, we're working on it 15 to 20 minutes later. (Mind you it might have been dropped off yesterday.) We are out of that, the doctor wrote it wrong, we're waiting to hear back. The excuses go on and on!

name: Donna Morgan Brown
text: They can't get it right!

name: Audrye Bumgardner
text: They treat everyone like they are a drug addict. It doesn't matter what a person takes they talk to you like your stupid.

name: Carrie Watson
text: Absolutely fed up with the pharmacy!!!! Staff is rude and half of the time u may as well go ahead and plan on having to stand and wait because there’s only one person at the registers!! I will most definitely be using another pharmacy...... should’ve changed a long time ago!!!!!!!

name: jerome hines
text: They are alright out things to often the can't seam to keep insulin had to go to different walmarts

name: Claudia Pecina
text: The worst service in a pharmacy i dont understand why they even pay these people

name: Katie Harris
text: Take forever get prescription.

name: Don Ora
text: Very friendly staff

name: Loki Chronicles
text: Great staff love this pharmacy

name: Brandon Busby
text: I LOVE WALMART

name: Curt Ryals
text: Walgreens pharmacy in general is horrible. Facility in Foley Al is twice as bad. Myself and wife have had to change do to the inability to provide a decent service. We’re sorry. Really busy. Come back tomorrow. We are having trouble with your ins. Same insurance the past 10 times I’ve been in. Automotive service says the Rx is ready. Drive to the window after an hour wait. We’re sorry, not sure what happened, can you come back in a couple hrs or maybe tomorrow. Same $&it every time. I would love to be contacted by someone at corporate. Horrible service and major attitude from the pharmacist at foley. It was all my fault in her eyes. Should be accustomed to it. I will now change my daughters Rx to a home town pharmacy.

name: Tammy Nance
text:
Great clean place with good service.
They carry all of grandpas favorite pipe tobacco.
Also has a Redbox.
Navigating the parking area can be tricky. Can be hazardous when busy.

name: Dwane Fresh
text: The only rd I use. Never had a bad experience there and have been going there for over 7 yrs!

name: Ellen Roberts
text: Drive thru was great

name: Richard Bailey
text: Doesn't enforce mask policy and closed drive through during pandemic.

name: becky kinder
text: Shelves are empty  because no one is coming to work!!  Stockroom filled with boxes to unload but no one comes to work...  Please.... Go to work so we can get back to normal....

name: Zach Rutledge
text: A good selection and clean, but expensive even with loyalty card discounts.

name: Jess Mason
text: I  love how they have a little bit of everything it makes shopping easier!

name: Kandi Winters
text: Script completed correctly and in time. Nice people.

name: kathy Farris
text: Excellent service with a smile here, with NO wait...thank you to Jennah for her compassion and understanding..

name: Melissa Grace
text: Went to drop off my mother's prescription and the lines were backed up down an aisle. There had to be 20 people just standing around the pharmacy area & suddenly two customers begin yelling, cussing & threatening each other. Several customers asked a Walgreens employ to call the police, & she decides to page just management. At this point I walked out & told my 74 yr old mother NEVER to go back there. The parking lot is dangerous too!

name: Ed Wheeler
text: We use the pharmacy and always have found them polite and knowledgeable. There phone notification is timely. When an item is not in stock they have always gotten it withing 24 hours.

name: jane .flippo
text: Sick baby’s prescription called in from doctor office at 9:30 am. Mom went to pick it up at 4; not ready. Pushed out of line by window clerk with no explanation. I returned at 7:30 pm, waited in line 18 minutes to find out is still not ready! Asked for insurance card, it’s on file for a regular prescription. Took 20 more minutes to be ready. Asked why, got a shoulder shrug! Asked someone else why, got an “I don’t know...” Store manager not in. Now brick baby has missed 3 doses of prescription and not one person can tell me why, apologize, or offer a Refund! Go to a Publix! Don’t waste your time here!

name: Roxanne Dugger
text: When I stayed in Spanish fort I loved going to Walgreens, but for whatever reason every time I try to get a prescription from the one in Foley I have to fight to get it done. For one thing they don't let me know when it's ready. My most recent prescription they tried to say my insurance would only cover but one pill. That's bull because first of all it's not even expensive without insurance, second, I have BCBS and my package is over 500 a month so it's not some rinky dink insurance. Just save yourself some trouble and go to island drug. I have never had an issue, and they treat me like I'm a friend not a number.

name: Brandy Knodel
text: I stood in line for almost 25 minutes when I got up to the counter the girl pulled out two of the three prescriptions and then instead of asking me to wait or even telling me anything she looked past me and called for the next customer. Not once saying anything until I asked her what I was supposed to do.  While I understand that they were indeed busy,  there is no reason for rudeness. Shame on Wendy!

name: Boxcar Willy
text: Great store - Always clean and staffed good - Pharmacy is the greatest!  Always on their game and always friendly and helpful! Best pharmicist on the coast!!! We love this store!

name: Andrew Novak
text:
Guaranteed the biggest groups of idiots you will find in one space

*UPDATE*
It has been 10 months and Walgreens has failed to fix or provide any feedback to any of their high number of 1 Star reviews (more 1 stars than any rating put together as of 3/13/19) glad to know how much they actually care about their business. Just go to publix trust me

name: Rhonda Puryear
text: Great place to find excellent deals.

name: Dorothy Brown
text: I would give this pharmacy zero stars if I could. They do not value your time at all. I went to pick up a prescription for my dad from the weekend & it wasn't ready. It was a partial prescription so it should have been ready. They knew I was waiting but they didn't care. Everyone else who was waiting came & gone. I sat there 30 minutes. This pharmacy is a joke.

name: Amy Hale
text: The pharmacy Staff at the window is always rude! There is no need in being rude to anyone especially someone who is sick. If you don’t like your job get another one preferably not in a customer service field.

name: NOOB_ FPV (NOOB_FPV)
text: Horrible place to fill prescriptions!  Rude and unprofessional. Ridiculous really that you can’t speak to a person who’s job is to serve without being short and disrespectful and have an attitude.  I understand a bad day but this isn’t the first time and by the remarks I see below combined with a very low rating, it’s easy to see why.

name: Bridget L
text: The pharmacist was very helpful and nice.

name: Anna Gonzalez
text: 4 months pregnant wearing a heart monitor, I called to see if my 4yo ADHD medication was in stock before I drove all the way there with my 2 other children. They told me they couldnt tell me over the phone they would have to see the prescription to answer that! Drove up there had to take my kids out and go in, my sick 2 yo in my arms asleep and ofcourse they didnt have it, I wasnt rude I asked why they couldn't of told me before they said because of the type of medication its an requirement I asked of it was a law and no its not a law its only a precautionary requirement, my son has multiple special needs not just ADHD and with a history at this pharmacy you would think a simple yes or no could of happened. Not coming back, it's sad I get better service and hospitality at Walmart.

name: d Busch
text: The pharmacists are patience and kind.

name: Denise Dixon
text: My son has asthma and was in need of his medication as soon as possible i went through and refilled his prescription at 12:30 and was told to come at 2 to pick up.. i get off work early to pick up his meds only to be told they " somehow got pushed back" and that it will be a few hours now. This is the most UNPROFESSIONAL AND UNORGANIZED PHARMACY i have ever did business with. I will no longer do business with this pharmacy!!! They should be SHUT DOWN how they run this pharmacy especially since it is someone's MEDICATION!!

name: Amanda W
text: Very rude staff. Perhaps they should find a new line of work, away from the public.

name: Aunyea Edwards
text: This store is horrible. They are the biggest group of idiots one will ever find. I talked to 3 different people whom all had the I.Q. of a doughnut. They couldn't tell me anything about my rx, customer service is nonexistent at this store. Then the dumbest one that answered the phone complained to me how she been answering calls all day, I told her good job you're at work that's what you're suppose to do. I swear this Walgreens was sent from hell to drive all their customers away.   If you need a rx, just drive somewhere else anywhere else. These people will have you on hold all to day just to not resolve your issue. I wish I could subtract these damn stars.

name: Hillary Baxter Hopper
text: I tried dropping off a fedex package and had, what I'm assuming was the manager(Brown curly hair), tell me over and over again that I was wrong and it was not Fedex. I left the store feeling very small and extremely disrespected. I knew I was in the right and having someone speak to me that was so insulting. I went straight my usual Fedex drop off who gladly took my package.

name: Sheri Dorgan
text:
FOLEY ALABAMA Between Happy & RUDE.........
I called Wal green's in Foley, Al. to ask how much my husband's prescription was. The pharmacist answered the phone and I ask the price of the medication. He replied in a condescending monotone “he is over the age of 18 and he can call himself” I said “excuse me” and he repeated himself.  I am calling corporate in Deerfield IL., first thing in the morning. It is bad enough to be sick, but to have a pious demoralizing pharmacist talk down to you when you are giving them your hard earned money is just not the norm……. He acted like he had done a few dowers himself.

name: Kimberly Hinman
text: Horrible customer service. Inflated prices and the store manager has absolutely no idea what she is doing. The pharmacy techs are rude and I waited in line for over 28 minutes. Go to Walmart instead!

name: The Band
text: we are lucky to have convenience of nation wide pharmacies in foley. i was feeling under the weather due to low thyroid. my provider in california filled it and we got it transfered. they sell lots of diabetes self testing supplies at this walgreens. its a mystery why all walgreens cvs stores arent cookie cutter identical

name: Bryan Byl
text: Pharmacy has the worst people they do not deserve a one that's too high. They are all rude runs out of medicine and does not bother to call.

name: Crittle Pie
text: Very friendly staff. Will help you with whatever your needs happen to be

name: Cathy Board
text: Great People!  Great Phamacy!  Andy Rocks!

name: Charnelle Thomas
text: Pharmacy has horrible customer service!! My sister and I got the same prescription and same insurance cards and mine was higher. I asked if they would transfer mine to Walmart they said they are not able to do that!! I have had it done a few times before! Ugh I will not recommend them to anyone!

name: Brenda Lemus
text: The clerks at the pharmacy are rude and mean I just wanted to ask one a question about my medication and she started having a damn attitude with me.If they not  gonna be nice they should not be working there.I recommend you not going there if you do not have time because they take a long time just to give a medicine!

name: Leslie Ammons Osterday
text: The pharmacist apparently thinks she is smarter than my doctor because “she doesn’t think it pairs with my other medication..” prescribed by the same doctor. S T U P I D

name: jenny Kay Stork
text: Always friendly and nice people.

name: Candice Qualls
text: Terrible service!  Manager not helpful at all!

name: Janis Burkeen
text: Terrible customer service at window...Think they were processing an order at the window..About a 25 minute wait.

name: Roman Harrell
text: Super slow pharmacy. Avoid this place unless you have 45 minutes to even drop off a prescription and then have to come back and wait another 45 minutes in-line to pick it up. They have two registers but only use one and they are not in a hurry at all.

name: Shelly Byrne
text: I went through the drive thru last night to pick up flu meds. The one the doctor recommended was going to cost me $60, but then the precious lady at the window told us we could get a coupon online that would make the medicine only $30 instead. By the time I had it pulled up on my phone, she had my prescription ready. Thank you so much! (Wish I had gotten the lady’s name!)

name: Andrew Rolfsen
text:
AVOID THIS LOCATION

Since covid hit this store has become more and more poorly managed. The customer service is abysmal at best. My last visit this week I pulled into the drive through and waited 48 minutes for the six cars ahead of me to be serviced. Forty....eight.....minutes. 6 customers serviced in FORTY EIGHT MINUTES. And you know what I was told? Despite getting a text at 1138 that morning saying my prescription was ready, they couldn't find it. So I waited 48 minutes to NOT GET MY FREAKING PRESCRIPTION. and no. You can't just leave the line. Its physically impossible to do so once trapped in. Thats it. Im done. I've had all my prescriptions transferred to Adam's across the street.

AVOID THIS LOCATION

name: Tony Roberts
text: This is the worst Walgreens I have ever been too!There service is very unorganized. The drive thru is slow and they never answer the phone!

name: sunny love
text: This Walgreens deserves zero stars. The pharmacy personnel is rude and unprofessional.  I have spent over a week trying to be reimbursed the money that they overcharged my debit card when they triple charged me for one prescription.  Even the Walgreens CSR I spoke with said she was filing a complaint because they were extremely rude to her.

name: Jamie Norris
text: Is there a way to leave negative stars? The pharmacy is absolutely the worst. The drive through is a single lane and once you’re in line, there is no getting out. For the third month in a row I have waited nearly 45 minutes to an hour to get my Rx and the inside is just as bad. We always seem to be a horrible inconvenience to them and my husband and I have decided that it’s just time to switch pharmacies all together.

name: Brianna Lamb
text: I came in to see family in Alabama and got sick and needed some meds filled while I was down here. I waited for over an hour, and even asked twice when my prescription would be ready. I was told, “it’s almost ready. Give us just a few more minutes.” The lady who rung me out acted like I was bothering her and distracting her from doing her inventory. She didn’t even have the decency to look up at me while checking out. If there was anyway to put negative stars, I would. When I’m on vacation, I hoped to be able to trust a pharmacy. That was not the case here.

name: Jessica Joyner
text: Dropped off a class II prescription yesterday and was told that they would check to see if the item was in stock once the pharmacist returned from lunch. Pharmacy technician even verified my phone number. 2 hours later, I came back to pick up the prescription and I could not go through the drive-thru due to 18-wheeler blocking it. Parked car and went into the store and waited in line only to be told they didn't have the medicine in stock. They didn't even have the common decency to call and let me know so I didn't waste 2 hours of my time. 😒

name: Heidi Smith
text: Yesterday ( saturday) all pharmacists called in...so no meds. Now been in line an hour on Sunday. Awful service. Rude employees

name: Ricky Pyles
text: Usually a nice visit. The pharmacy ppl can be a little rude. I've stood at the counter on several visits as they carry on personal conversations instead of tending to customers as they come up.

name: Molly Lowery
text: The pharmacy is horrible, as is usual for Walgreens. I waited 40 minutes to pick up my medicine only to be told they put it back on the shelf because it had been 12 days since the script was called in. No one called to make sure I would still get it or anything. Like most people, I stay busy and haven’t had time to go by - the line is always really long inside and at the drive thru. They’ve lost my business.

name: Eric Reda
text: Very friendly and engaged sales floor team (for the most part, and the leadership team is relatively swift at removing anyone not fit for a customer service position) and the store stays in stock, clean, and organized -  the GM hasn't changed in over a decade so he's clearly doing something right. As with any Walgreens, the pharmacy staff is my biggest complaint; that's depending on who you talk to of course. They're not ALL rude, unhelpful, and work at a snail's pace. Regardless, all it takes is that one "bad apple"  to ruin the customer's experience - hence the 4/5 rating.

name: Jen Cazer
text: The young girl at the pharmacy counter acted as if I discussed her when I tried to ask about a tetanus shot, not once but twice she made us feel as if we were bothering her on her day off, I've never been treated so rudely in a place of business.... & I used to love the place.

name: Latrisha Brown
text: Rude and unprofessional. Every time I call their system is down. Half of the time, they don’t answer the phone! I will be transferring to a different pharmacist.

name: D Nelson
text: Switched to this location recently, and I am pleased with my interactions with the pharmacy staff (prompt and polite while being efficient) and special thanks to Crissy/Crystal(?) in Photo department. She was extremely helpful, patient, and knowledgeable!

name: Stephanie Carroll
text: I got my wedding invitations here. They helped me alot! My invitations are exactly like I wanted them. I'm so thankful for them. Will definitely be using them again!! Beucana and a guy helped us  and they were so sweet and very patient with me so if you need pictures printed I suggest Walgreens there amazing!!!!

name: Rebecca Rolling
text: LOVE the original pharmacy staff under Pharmacist Barry Brewer...professional, friendly,helpful staff but when Rite Aid merged they brought the rude folks with them..Melissa Evans is a Gem!

name: Helen Taylor
text: Hayden was very helpful when I called to see if an item was in stock.

name: No Clue
text: It’s a fine Walgreens waits can be up to 40 minutes at max.

name: Jessica Lucas
text: I'd long written off ever getting my medications from a Walgreen's after years of getting terrible, slow, and rude service, but today was a wholly different experience. My prescriptions were ready by the time I arrived there coming from the doctor's office, everyone was friendly, and it was a great shopping trip despite my illness. Thanks!

name: Colby Johnson
text: The absolute slowest, most care free staff that I’ve ever seen. When you are in pain and need to pick up your prescription, run far away from here.

name: Vanessa Brown
text: They can be extremely slow at times. However, they are always very friendly as well as helpful. I've been looking for various items before, that they didn't carry, and they are happy to tell you were to go nearby to find it. I've also found some really cute and cheap tunics at this location.

name: Lyndsay Rohan
text: I injured my shoulder and pulled up to the drive thru at 9:58pm. The pharmacy closes at 10. The tech said there wasn’t enough time to fill my prescription, but ended up telling me to hold on. The pharmacist came to the window and told me he’d get me taken care of. I’m so thankful for him !!!

name: Lindsey Brown
text: Have gone here for years for mine and my family's prescriptions, as well as quick pick up items. I wanna say that have treated us right more often times than not. The times that they might have overstepped was when they were equally as frustrated as I was. TBH I love their rewards program and app even synced to it my step counter. Now I'm getting rewards points and not spending a dime :D. Just try to remember to avoid their busiest hours.

name: ED KILLGORE
text: Slow! Slow! Slow! I am a full-time RVer so in my travels I have occasion to use Walgreens in different areas. They need to tighten up and get with the program. Their pharmacies are poorly managed. What's the point in busily filling pill bottles if you don't wait on the customers who are waiting in line to pick up their prescriptions. I wish Rite Aid hadn't sold out to them. I will be taking my business to CVS.

name: Sandra Love
text: Repeated rudeness from young pharmacist. They think they are the only hardworking people around. The ladies on the floor are mostly nice but lm changing pharmacies as soon as possible

name: Back To My ROOTS
text:
The absolutely slowest drive through of any establishment that I have ever endured. To make mattrrs worse, single lane so once you are in line, you are trapped.

A few other: They take so long to contact your Dr. For refills. I dropped a script but was 3 days early. They told me what day to come back and when I showed...they had lost the script. I had to go back to my mother's Dr. to get a replacement. Even worse, they acted like I never even dropped off the first one.

name: Kristeena Anderson
text: Pharmacist is not friendly and they are extremely slow to get your precriptions.

name: TT
text: Used for Years great pharmacy

name: Gary Hill
text: Horrible beyond belief!! Don’t even deserve 1 star! Do not go here! Go to Millbrook, it’s a night and day difference. My script has been lost multiple times, once was given someone else’s medication. Waited for someone to  acknowledge me for 5 minutes once, but I did get to over hear the technician on a personal phone call talking to someone about smoking weed so that was entertaining while I waited. It’s unbelievable that these people are allowed to assist in someone’s wellbeing!

name: Brady Galloway
text: I can just walk right in and buy a Baby Ruth bar! There is also a Redbox here. The inside just like any other Walgreens, nice.

name: Shari Belcher
text: Horrible experience! I was placed on hold for nearly 10 minutes. The phone rang back 3 times and no one ever came to the phone. As a matter of fact when I said hello, someone sent me back to more music. I spoke to Shay the pharmacist and this is normal practice for them. I went to Publix instead!!! I can only think that people go to this location out of habit. However, I’d rather spend my money where I am respected as a customer.

name: Fay Elliott
text: Has everything I need that is free of dyes and perfume for my rare skin cancer. I would have given 5 stars but they need to hire more employees since CVS isn't on Express Script recommendation now and are getting longer lines meaning longer waiting times in the pharmacy.

name: Amber Nicole
text:
Love coming here for my RX and sweets needs 😊
Pharmacy usually does good at getting you in and out.

name: Sidney Watson
text: Love using them for my prescriptions. Drive thru is super convenient.

name: John Hines (Wareagle_81)
text: Great customer service. Always friendly and respectful. A little slow due to high cutomer traffic but thats to be expected when you the best in town. Great job s.mememorial walgreens. Of Prattville.

name: Cayman Goodwine
text: Extremely rude, lost multiple prescriptions of mine. Never been to a Walgreens this slow. Do not come here! I will not be back.

name: Jacob Quimby
text: I mostly go to Walgreens for their Walgreens exclusive Funko Pop toys, that my son and I collect, and this store doesnt even get half of the ones that come out. Walgreens doesnt usually sell them on the website, and the closest store that does have them is completely out of my way, and a chore for me to get to. Ive honestly never purchased anything else from this store, but the staff have always been friendly and the store is clean and well organized.

name: Pine Mountain Chalet 108
text: Horrible place for prescriptions!  Be prepared to spend your day,  night and next morning waiting in line and don't even attempt the drive through!

name: Rachel Moore
text: Love the store, but pharmacy not so much.

name: Ricardo Rodriquez
text: WOST possible place to get meds! I will NEVER to business at this location ever again. I went to publix to get some prescription eye drops within 2 minutes they told me they were unavailable to fill it. I decided to go to Walgreens. I dropped off the prescription she looked at it and said it would take 2 hours. I got an automated call half an hour later saying it would be delayed and THEY WOULD contact me once my prescription was ready. I waited an hour and a half and called them. Thats when they tell me they couldnt fill my prescription. I asked why did i have to wait 2 hrs in pain when publix told me they couldnt fill it within 3 minutes.

name: Doug Tate
text: I trust this Walgreen with all my precriptions . They send out text alerts to me when the medicine is ready and when the preccription is done.

name: Tony Johnson
text: Store is clean, well stocked and the employees are very helpful.  A+

name: Michael Smith
text: Very judge mental, unprofessional pharmacy. A family member brought a prescription into this suppose to be professional pharmacy and they REFUSED to fill her medication. For whatever reasons they believed the medication was prescribed for, it was none of their business. The pharmacist asked her personal questions regarding why she was prescribed the medicines. I think that this was appalling and disrespectful to this young lady. What kind of business is this to pick and choose what medications to fill for a patient? If you are a licensed professional who people rely on for medical advice/ or information, then you are clearly in the wrong profession if everything is based off of your personal feelings or opinion.

name: J. Cope
text: The young woman in the 𝐏𝐡𝐚𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐜𝐲 is very rude and frankly, I don’t think she knows what she’s doing. It is EXTREMELY OBVIOUS she doesn’t like her job! I won’t go back because of her.

name: Eric Jerkins
text: Great selection, slow service at times

name: Karen Cooper
text: Very unprofessional , so slow Every time. So bad the past 3 times I've been through the drive through I've had to just drive off. I waited and waited to be waited on.

name: Anne Sailors
text: The longest wait for prescription ever, every time I go!

name: Johnnie Gray
text: Quick and convenient nice people

name: Rick Woodall
text: Average service and the slowest pharmacy I've ever seen.  The only reason for the 2nd star is for the rest of the store.

name: Kenny Strength
text: Slow,slow, prescription called in hours ago still going to be too long to wait.

name: Jamie DeRiso
text: Unprofessional pharmacy and disrespectful.

name: Irv Drost
text: Long wait time

name: Carolyn Shippen
text: Slow in getting prescriptions

name: Lost Dragon
text: Long waits

name: Sonya Telfair
text: Walgreens is cool

name: Gourab Bhattacharya
text:
Extremely unprofessional and inefficient. They don't even know what they're doing when it comes to taking photos for passport or other official documents. Just another store that sells beer and potato chips.

The 15th St store is recommended for professional results.

name: Mai Notts
text:
Sign outside says that they stay open 24/7, but that's a lie.
Stopped by one night after I got off work to pick up some things, only to find that they were closed. Went in the following morning and asked an employee why and apparently they only stay open until midnight because the manager wants to "save money".
What good is a CVS store if its not open 24 hours??? I'll just go to the publix literally next door during regular daytime hours if that's the case.
I hope you idiots go out of business.

name: Tyler
text: Better than the 4260 CVS on University. Had a pharmacist call angry and hang up in regards to a prescription that wasn't picked up. Numerous calls and texts at all hours regarding prescriptions. Texts have come in at midnight before. They sound frustrated with the volume of students and prescriptions from UA. In addition, I was given a generic from Aurobindo Pharma which is a pharma being cited by the USFDA for quality violations. Aurobindo has recalled 80 lots of medicine, not mine particularly, but who wants to risk that? CVS should stop filling medications from that company, period.

name: scrap lyle
text: The exterior sign on the building says 24 hours. It is not 24 hours. False advertising and the sign should be removed.

name: Jamie Terry
text: Staff is friendly and Pharmacy wait time is usually short.

name: Chelle Adkins
text: This place is terrible its never less than a 30 min wait in drive thru they never get all our scripts when they are suppose to they text before its ready im def bout to switch

name: Judy Williams
text: I like CVS cause I can pay my rent there through a pay slip and it posts right away

name: M McDaniel
text:
I haven’t been treated with customer service when getting my prescriptions filled. I have a few complaints.
1. I was shorted on medication and another time I was given more.
2. My 1st inhaler prescription, when I got it home I seen on the sheet something to the effect of “demonstrate to first time users” which the pharmacist did not do. I actually had to google how to use it and watch you tube videos.
3. What topped the cake today was I recieved a text message 3 days ago from cvs saying my prescription was ready and I had 8 days to get it before it was returned. Today when I went to pick it up, they told me it was not ready. I asked how long it was going to take and told her I didn’t plan on coming back out today. She said I had to wait 45 minutes or come in and it may be shorter. I left and came back 15 min to ask for the corporate number and the manager’s name. The manager comes to the window with my prescription and says it’s ready. I explained to her my other two concerns above and how I feel mistreated (or not treated the same way how I see them treat other customers-I don’t want to throw the race card) but, she ultimately throws my meds down and walk away.

I’ve called the corporate number, hopefully I hear something back.

name: Billy Robertson
text: Always a 30-45 minute wait even when told 15 minutes.

name: Matthew A. Tidwell
text: The pharmacy staff is friendly, helpful, thorough, and quit and efficient. No complaints here.

name: Aaron Oskian
text: Friendly people

name: Linda R. Day
text: Nice staff, great pharmacy

name: Krystal Linville
text: Very helpful and kind.

name: LRD
text: Good service!

name: sherry dianne Burke
text: Transferred long list of meds from another pharmacy. Very kind &efficient.

name: Linda R. Day
text: Always ready to help in anyway possible.  Quick service, polite to customers.  Good hours.

name: Jenny HM
text: This Petersville Walmart and the Departments such as the Pharmacy, Return CSR managers and Electronics are antagonistic and Mr. Sampson the New Manager will smack you with a Policy Quote so fast its enough to make you cry, never want to shop there again and tell everyone not to try to return anything,nor expect Money Services to find positive solutions. And who wants to be treated as a criminal gor trying to return an item over 60 days later and the packaging is different so i simply let them keep the ID Tracker tags about 20$ for 2 and i had 2 packs. Thanks for nothing and feeling like i did something wrong. Yes i had the receipt. Yes the original package was intact. Yes I had to repeat myself 5 times and having long term leukemia-i was tired with no where to sit. I wont go back in that Walmart. Publix does a easygoing and kind job of Western Union-no hassle-and returns are so kind and easy going. I tell everyone how bad the looks, treatment and harassment at Walmart has become. Especially the one in Petersville anf the young, rude, General Manager, named C. SAMPSON who doesnt have any fairness nor any real decency in True Customer Service. To Social Media i go. Over and over and i dont mind driving the few extra miles to the Florence location or even Muscle Shoals-just to avoid being upset or treated like scum.

name: Judy Williams
text: They had my strips I needed to check my glucose

name: Judy Williams
text: There my main pharmacy nice people

name: Karen Farmer
text: Fantastic, caring people.

name: Nettie Williams
text: Now I understand why many are getting Covid vaccines Walmart Forestdale would be a reason..... Patience must be your virtue and a tolerance for poor service, lack of proper communication and all around Negative vibes. We cannot continue to use Covid as an excuse.

name: Stephanie R. Tinney
text: Though the wait is sometimes long and or busy, there is most surely a reason for it and that being the pharmacist.   What a nice store we have here in forestdale!

name: Ynetta Jones
text: This place is a POS. They aren’t in a hurry to do nothing. Everyone taking their poor time.

name: James Basenberg
text: Always slow and for the most part bad attitudes. And they refuse to answer the phone if you do call a order in the pharmacy. All these 5 star reviews are not truthful I’m pretty sure they work there.  The workers here in the pharmacy need to really find another occupation.

name: L. Cecile Jones
text: By far the worst Walgreens ever. Some of the people are rude and lack customer service skills. They make you wait in drive thru without acknowledging you. God forbid you have an emergency.

name: Stephanie R. Tinney
text: Always friendly atmosphere

name: Dr. Ward
text: Pharmacy employees do not exhibit proper customer service..the store manager, she was very helpful and I got results and very apologetic..she should not have to go above and beyond for the lack of  employees

name: Teresa Mendoza
text: Good service nice employees

name: justice manear
text: Would highly recommend going to another Walgreens they close at 7:00 now the pharmacy is slow and the checkout line can sometimes be fast but mainly slow. In the pharmacy closes an hour earlier too

name: Gina Jordan
text: Rude, rude and rude! My family came in to buy medicine, my daughter was sick and needed to use the restroom. They had to wait for it to be unlocked. Her husband came to the front of the store and asked them again to u lock the bathroom, that my daughter was about to throw up- the cashier rolled her eyes and started saying “I hope he come back up here like that” and “I ain’t cleaning nothing up”. Continued to be disrespectful to them, being immature. They didn’t know that I was listening. I then told them that was my family that they were talking about and that they needed to be quiet. The cashier smirked again and rolled her eyes. So disrespectful and the manager on duty was aware of the behavior and did nothing. It will be a cold day in hell (or Alabama) before I spend money at any Walgreens again.

name: Jon Bryant
text: Easy in and out for health and beauty needs

name: Radioman
text: If I could leave less than one star, I would. This is beyond a doubt the worst place to get a prescription filled. You will die waiting in line. They have three registers and only one open with a line stacked 15 to 20 people deep. The drive thru has two lanes but can only service one person at a time. Be prepared for Jesus to return while waiting; it is likely to take that long. when I got to the register, the 14 people behind me were so angry, I was afraid to turn my back! What moron (manager) puts one person on the counter on Friday at 5:00 when you know there's going to be a rush. Are they taking lessons from McDonald's? When I called to speak with the pharmacist about my concerns, the reply was "That's just how Walgreens does it". If I wanted that kind of attitude, I would still be married to my ex-wife. I am going to transfer all my records to Moore's Pharmacy in Adamsville and see how that goes.

name: Katherine Dickens
text: Young lady in Photo was wonderful...very patient with me for I've never used photo dept....I have had great service at this location

name: Carlisle Cindy
text: Always a great experience and wonderful sales 😍

name: Krissy Cinnamon
text: Always polite and friendly service at this location. They are usually very busy, but I always get friendly service and polite conversation. Thank you!

name: Tara Lewis
text: Transferred my prescriptions here on my own accord thinking "they're more friendly, homely, and part of the neighborhood." Biggest mistake ever. After speaking with one of their techs via telephone, she assured my meds would be ready for pick up that same evening as the dr had called one in and the other was a simple birth control. Go to pick them up and surprise, the most vital & crucial medicine of them all was not ready because they claimed the dr hadn't called it in. Even though I'd confirmed with the tech that morning that it was. The tech then proceeded to throw the prescription that was ready on the counter top instead of placing it in my hand when I reached out to get it from her. Poor customer service and trashy attitudes of the pharmacy techs working there. Won't be returning.

name: Ms Q
text: Apparently my prescriptions from Campbell's are now here..  If I wanted a chain pharmacy I would have used u. I have always heard of chains buying little family pharmacy and then shutting them down. Never had it happened to one I use till now. Thanks but no thanks.

name: Rachel L
text: I like going to Walgreens at least they actually have personality, smile, and care about their jobs and helping others (at least they act like it), it only took a day maybe two for me to get all my meds and info transferred over to Walgreens, I’m a happy customer😊

name: D ebra Hunter
text: Great service

name: fat mama's lunchbox
text: I luv going there fast service and the ppl are so helpful

name: 10speed 65
text: Pharmacy is the slowest and worst customer service imaginable. Too bad it's the closest to my house or I would avoid it like the bird flu 😒

name: Jodie Hendrixx
text: Slowest walgreens ever worst service when you drop off a prescription when you come back be prepared to wait everytime

name: PRIEST WARD
text: My prescriptions were transferred to Walgreens also but Walgreens wouldn't fill them. I went to Campbell's from Walgreens because the service was substandard. How I have no meds.

name: Krista Bice
text: I love the friendly atmosphere. The employees can always answer any questions I have. The only downside I've experienced is the time it takes to fill my prescriptions. I get texts when my medicine is ready but it's not always ready when I actually get there to pick it up. Sometimes when I wait in store, they say it will be 15 minutes, but when I go to pick it up, they say the same thing again.. overall recommend, though. Great prices and great staff.

name: Pamela nix
text: Helpful

name: Diana Shoel
text: Helpful and kind staff!!

name: Alana Henderson
text: Long wait

name: Dana Vandiver
text: This is the absolute worst pharmacy I’ve ever used! They do not care about their customers. Every time I went to pick my prescription they tell me it’s out of stock so I call back a week later and they still haven’t ordered it. Also the price of my prescriptions are never the same each time I pickup the price increases!

name: Stephanie Daniel
text: Stopped for snacks and a restroom break on our road trip. Very clean and super friendly staff! Thank you Walgreens

name: Lilbit of Southern Spirit
text: These people are very courteous, attentive, & friendly! 5 stars! My family's used this store since they opened. The drive threw wait time would decrease if customers would come prepared & some issues should be handled inside. Highly recommend this store 😊😊😊

name: Angela Keen
text: Great store with very helpful staff

name: Erica Hughes
text: The pharmacy staff here are fantastic!! I am in the process of switching to a new insurance plan and am currently uninsured. My heart medicine was $92 for a 3 month supply. They found a coupon to get the prescription for $30! Super compassionate and awesome customer service! Thank you!

name: Olivia Dyson
text: Terrible drive thru always backed up!!! 6 cars deep in drive thru been sitting here for 22 mins in drive even called the store while still sitting here and no answer. Pitiful drive hire more people or learn to equaly divid your atrention between drive and the customers inside.

name: deep south Diesel cowboy
text: I love the place, the best quality pictures at a great price, friendly employees, very well organized and clean, great pharmacy and staff. Highly recommend, and they support MGM Vikings!!!!!

name: Not Bothered
text: Very rude and very slow everytime I go! Id rather drive across town for better service.

name: Kimberly Hendrieth
text: I love the great Southern Hospitality that I receive at this location.  The staff is very courteous and helpful.

name: Judy Miller
text:
I love this store. From the front door to the back and back again, every person who works there is friendly and welcoming, helping find what you need, taking you to it, not just saying look on isle 4. I did a LOT of my cmas shopping right there. Great stocking stuffers, beautiful greeting cards, snacks - BROOKSIDE chocs!! : < }  I'm glad you came to Semmes.
Great store.
J Miller

name: Tangie Williams
text: Always enjoy my visit  here

name: Pam Corley
text: This is not a very nice wallgreens. I will be switching everythng over to the Semmes Pharmacy becasue ive only heard great things about them and wallgreens has gone down hill.

name: Melissa Sievering
text: The wait at the pharmacy is always dreadful. It’s only with this Walgreens as well. I’ve never had this issues else where. Not sure why there is always 4 cars in the drive thru and a line inside. ALWAYS!

name: Charles Harris
text: The only place that would help out when my son's med supplies didn't show up that helped out to make sure he had what he needed for his dieabetes

name: Candace Anderson
text: Great service, especially Amanda, Pharmacist!

name: Candace Anderson
text: Great

name: Angela Hurst
text: Takes forever to get prescriptions filled was told 20 minutes had to wait over 45 minutes car backed up at drive thru

name: Debra Colbert
text: A variety of goods and very clean place to visit.

name: Debra West
text: Wish I could have left 0 stars. Had surgery this morning and dropped off my prescription at 2 pm they told me it would be 5 before it was ready it's now 10 minutes until 6 and it's STILL not ready. Very rude customer service also. Last trip there for me!

name: Tonya Harvey
text: I hate this store, lines are too long, takes forever!!

name: Twizty X
text: Used this Pharmacy for many years had a few issues though none of them major

name: Rafael M
text: Ok

name: Lenn Kidd
text: Me and my family got into town on a Saturday evening. We went to the store to buy our food for the week.When we got to the front the manager told us we would have to check out ourselves and bag our groceries.Not just a few bucks but 250.00 worth will never go to Walmart grocery next year I will go to Publix where they have checkers.

name: Maria Rutledge
text: This is my one-stop shop for my birth control pills, which I usually neglect to pick up until the very last minute, which is why I love that they are open all day. Conveniently, there is a wall of lube alongside the pharmacy wall in case you need to refill your stock of that too. So thoughtful!

name: Jim Puckett
text: Friendly and helpful staff.

name: Ashley Leaman
text: They are always kind and very helpful! The pharmacist has made accommodations for me so that my insurance would cover my medicine in full!! Also, they are extremely quick when filling your prescriptions. I would recommend this pharmacy to everyone! Thanks!

name: Amber Dudley
text: Not very nice people. Lunch was more important than  handling my prescription that was called in an hour before and was supposed to be ready in 10 minutes. With as many pharmacies in this area customer service, you would think, would be more important. No line though, so that would be a plus if I didn't have to come back again.

name: Catlin Thomas
text: Very helpful and knowledgeable

name: Carrie Peeples
text: Pharmacy Mgr Ms. Staton went above & beyond to accommodate an out of town  traveler.  Very helpful & friendly!

name: Nancy Johnstone
text: Walmart in OB is terrible. It won’t exchange or refund on some purchases if not purchased at this store (however, it has deliveries, why not deliver some returned or exchanged to other Walmarts, really?). Computer for proceeding fishing licenses is DOWN for too many days. Awful.

name: Matthew Blevins
text: I went to this Walgreens to drop off a Fedex package and the cashier at the front of the store was friendly and helpful however the lady in the photo department in charge of receiving packages was rude and didn’t want to help. She told me “she didn’t have any space left to hold my package” and then ended up taking the package anyways after she sighed and reluctantly took it. I told her thanks for the help and she just mumbled “mhm” while not looking at me at all and just walked off. Not a very good employee.

name: Suresh Mathews
text: Driver’s beware: This is a review for the Drive-through pharmacy pick-up. Friendly staff at the window; fairly quick service. If paying by cash the change is returned in an envelope - all great. But, drivers beware of your car/SUV driver’s side tire scraping the sides of the concrete. It happened to me couple times, and the second time was scary loud that I thought my tire ripped. Fortunately, it was fine. The exit out of the drive through is narrow and curves left; and therefore the tire scraping the concrete. It appears that this happens to every driver that is unaware of the lurking danger. I called and made a complaint with the Manager but there have been en changes yet to the drive through. I’ve educated myself that i need to turn my wheel to the right as I exit out and then lean left into the turn. This way the driver’s side rear wheel gets more space and avoids scraping the concrete.

name: Eli Rowe
text: I got double charged for some OTC Walgreens brand Naproxen. It was $7.00 something per bottle and one bottle plus a pack of M&M’s and the total came to $16.00 something. Didn’t answer phone when I tried to call to fix issue.

name: Alan Manning
text: This pharmacy and its staff are completely incompetent. I called asking why they and several other Walgreens stores have absolutely no supplies of the medicine which I've easily been able to purchase from them in the past and can just as easily purchase from any other pharmacy, and they had not the slightest clue. They were also incredibly rude and not helpful AT ALL. It's not like Walgreens doesn't carry this medication either, as I've been able to purchase it at other Walgreens locations in the past, and it is a prescription medication.

name: Brandon Yates
text: We have used this pharmacy for several months. We have had a great experience each visit. They even gave our dog a treat. They are very friendly here.

name: Mia Tucker
text: The staff are polite and helpful!

name: Michael Lane
text: The pharmacy people are the worst! They say they are filling your script. NO you show up and the act like you ever dropped off! Had to wait another day for my meds. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!

name: Christie Musso Bruce
text: We have always used Walgreens for our prescriptions. We moved and started using this location about 6 months ago. I have never seen such rude people in the pharmacy in my life. None of them are friendly, never say thank you or nothing. They act like your bothering them when you pull up to get your medicine. It’s been an issue since we’ve moved here. We will be looking for another pharmacy.

name: McKenzie Middleton
text: Moved my prescription today due to this pharmacy's incompetence. My first run in with them was I had a Dr. back home and they refused to fill the prescription bc the dr was from out of town. But I took it to Walmart and they had no issues filling it. The 2nd run in was after i had surgery and the tech was extremely rude. I asked what the hold up was, thinking they may need to see my license or insurance and he responded "there isn't a hold up i told you it would be 15 minutes and it hasn't been." Then this last time they were going to charge me $194 for a monthly prescription,  I told them I couldn't afford that and had the dr call me in the same prescription to CVS, it was $0 and covered fully by my insurance. Will not go back.

name: Charlotte Collins
text: Pharmacy Staff is slow, rude and lazy. Seems like the most miserable place around to work. No one smiles or even remotely acts like they want to help you. I will be moving my rx needs to another pharmacy. Thank goodness the rest of the employees are very friendly and courteous. The pharmacy needs some serious attitude adjusting.

name: Diane Natale
text: It's a hit or miss. Some of the techs can get extremely rude and think that they are the pharmacists. Sometimes pharmacy can be very helpful. You just never know.

name: Sissy Smith
text: They RARELY, if EVER, even answer the phone at this location?! TWO WORDS: BAD. MANAGEMENT.

name: Eric Lawman
text: The store is great up until you get to the pharmacy. Every time I try to do anything with them either they don’t have the medication or the system is constantly down. So it’s either pay cash and get reimbursed later or wait for who knows how long for the system to come back up. I’ll shop here but I’m gonna find a new pharmacy to use.

name: Caleb Wilson
text: Every employee has always been helpful to me

name: Julia Thomason at Love the Mouse Travel

Pharmaceutical Techs are knowledge and always ready to answer any questions we have and they do a great job explaining the meds.
Come back around Mother's Day for the perfect little something!

name: Jonathan Perez
text: I was told by one the ladies in the pharmacy department my medication would be ready by a certain time. I showed up a little late just in case they had been backed up. I show up and my order hadn't even been put in the system. O get asked by the young lady who took my order. I describe to her the person. She goes in the back and asks on of them. They loudly start mocking me saying did I just pick a random description. I mentioned to her when she got back that it was not a random description. The other women started laughing at the fact that I overheard. No level of professionalism shown here by them.

name: Natalie Chambers
text: I will personally never step back into this Walgreens again. My fiance and I went in there tonight and noticed one of the workers kept watching us. I didn't think anything of it at first but, she followed us outside. We asked her was there a problem she said no. But, wrote down our tag number. I have never felt so disrespected at a store in my life. I've never had a problem at Walgreens before. As ststed before I will never step back into this Walgreens again.

name: Taylor Ivins
text: I have only ever used the drive thru. My experience there varies. At times, I feel valued and am cheerily greeted by an employee who seems to genuinely care and enjoy their job. Other times, I am not greeted at all for several minutes while the employee types away on their computer (more than one of the employees do this). It’s not hard to quickly pick up the drive thru line and say “Welcome, I’ll be with you in just a moment” and carry on. As a customer, it does not leave a good impression when you are neglected. Typically the wait time is incredibly long, even if my prescription is filled and ready to go. I will continue to use this Walgreens because my insurance switched its contract from CVS and it is the closest location to me. But I will advise my friends and family against going here. The employees here need reinforced training on customer interaction.

Best Walgreens ever The service here is Stellar... Pharm. Matt is Awesome

text: I checked my call log to verify the following times - I got to the pharmacy 40 minutes after a CVS employee stated on the phone that the prescription would be ready in about 45 minutes, in other words I was 5 minutes early, and am then told "we should have it ready by about 12:20"  which means I either have to wait for 43 more minutes or make a second trip. What was even more irritating is that the clerk had nothing to say at all, if she had simply stated "I'm sorry for the delay", even though it may have been a meaningless or hollow remark, I wouldn't have posted this negative review but to waste someone's time and make it clear that it means absolutely nothing to you is beyond rude.

name: Bryn Ealy
text: As a medical professional, I can say that I’ve never had another medical colleague speak to me so condescendingly over the phone. My patient was out of state on vacation and unfortunately was having severe pain in a tooth we had recently done a root canal on. I sent prescriptions for an antibiotic and pain medication for the patient. The patient called me after hours stating that the pharmacy wouldn’t allow her to have the narcotic and that I needed to call them myself to verify the prescription. When I spoke with the pharmacist on staff, she berated me for trying to transfer a controlled substance from another Walgreens. I questioned if her e-prescribe was comparable with my dental software, and she basically told me to kick rocks. The prescription ended up going through, but from the sounds of it, she was also very rude to my patient. For someone whose job is literally to help patients obtain medication in order to feel better, this pharmacist clearly had no interest.  Disappointed in the care given to someone clearly in pain and not drug-seeking. My patient is not the first person in the world to have ever had a toothache while away from their regular dentist. She won’t be the last.

She refused to reprint saying the picture is what it is.  I had to toss it in the garbage.

text: I always have great customer service. Yes I have to wait at the pharmacy but I already know that I will have to do this. It’s a busy place.

name: Toni Michelle
text: Terrible customer service. I was left waiting an hour past my pick up time for my card I ordered. All because the girl working there never printed it. And then couldn’t even find it once it was printed and it’s now 10pm might I note.. I’m extremely aggravated. The store is not busy so why am I still waiting such a long time for one little birthday card ?? She was not prompt. She was not apologetic. She is not an asset to that company at all. And it’s because of piss poor employees like herself that I will spend my money else where and tell everyone I know to do the same! Quality customer care really does go a long way. And they just don’t have any.

name: Kayleigh Bowers
text: On hold for 25 minutes, then hung up on. Called back, spoke to someone who transferred me somewhere else only to be hung up on again. Called back a third time, on hold for 10 minutes before someone picked up. They transferred me to someone else who transferred me to a never ending ringing phone which eventually hung up on me again. Absolutely useless customer service.

name: Effie Carrington
text: Wish there were less stars.  Don't know what to think of a store which will accept a call, tell caller there are 2 calls in advance of you, then one 1 call in advance of you, then keep you on hold for 25 minutes, 26 seconds, and HANG UP ON YOU.  Trying to find out about a prescription that I was to have available at noon today, it now being nearly 7:00 pm.

name: Christopher Williams
text:
Worst pharmacist and customer service I have ever dealt with. My wife had surgery and we dropped off 5 prescription slips at around  1645 We were told it would be ready at 1830.

We went to the store at 1830 we were told that they had not been filled any of the prescription and to have a seat, 30 min later they said there was an issue with one of medications and they would have to call the doctor in order to fill the pain medication. I provided them the doctor number which they didn't call, I left the store and got ahold of the doctor who inturn called the store. After talking with the store he then called back at 2032 and said that everything was straightened out and that they would fill the prescription. Went back to the store at at 2103 they had asked if we could come back in 15 min that they just got off the phone with the Doctor (which was a false statement they had gotten off the phone around 30 to 40 min prior). Finally got the pain prescription around 2133. The surgery was over at 1200 and was able to take first pain meds at 2140. Every interaction I had with them they acted as if did not care. When I asked questions they seems extremely bothered and annoyed that I would even inquire on what the issue was. I just hope that another consumer doesn't have to go through what we went through.

I would STRONGLY recommend not using this walgreens to get a prescription filled especially if you are counting on them for customer service (a caring attitude and a quick filling of a prescription). It is truly just the employees that work in the pharmacy.(I was not the only person that was struggling with getting medication, I witnessed two our families having issues as well).

To be fair the rest of the store clerks I worked with were extremely helpful and polite. I normally don't make comments but it was so bad I really hope nobody else has to go through this type of treatment.

name: Christina Clayton
text: Every single time I am in here it takes entirely too long. The staff either needs to be trained to be more productive in a faster time or they need more employees on hand. Either way, having to wait in line for over 20 minutes is absurd. Not to mention we already tried to come earlier in the day and left because the line was so backed up then too.

name: Lori Verga
text: Love this place! Every team member does exceptional work and truly cares about customers.

name: ZULK THE GREAT
text: Pharmacy is very very very slow!

name: A Colwell
text: Jacob in the pharmacy is great! I needed a prescription for my son and another pharmacy dropped the ball on it after having it for a week. Then I found out that they couldn't even get it. I called Walgreens to transfer the prescription and see if they could get the item for me. Jacob was very nice, helpful, and kept me informed. He got everything transferred quickly, was able to locate the item, and it even came in the next day.

name: Kristie Robb
text: Terrible customer service. Pharmacy is a joke (wasn’t waiting on a prescription). Just wanted some allergy meds & the line was half way across the store. They expect you to wait in that line just to get some simple Allegra D. They need more pharmacy help if that’s the way they sell regular allergy meds.

name: Deborah Watkins
text: Don’t fill when they tell you a time

name: Michael Mitchum
text: If you are getting your medicine filled here and need them to call and get your prescription transferred save yourself the trouble and don't. The employees seem to not care about the patients and only care about themselves. I spoke with Kelly and she is very condescending with me and made it seem like she was doing me a favor by trying to call to get my prescription instead of it being her job.

name: lorrie taylor
text: Switched to this pharmacy to keep from having to go to the one I normally go to in Eufaula, they are very helpful when you have questions, great customer service and open 24 hrs and they will let you know when busy times are so you don't have to wait, unlike Eufaula pharmacy you wait every time, I will do the drive to get the professional service

name: Angelica Leadabrand
text: I'm giving this Walgreen's location five stars because of the extremely helpful & courtous employees.  I go to this Walgreen's 1-3 times per week when I just need to "pick up a few things" & don't want to deal with the hassle of a big store.  I cannot recall a time when I have not been greeted by an employee as I enter the front door.  Employees always ask if I need assistance when they notice me looking around for something.  Not only will they walk with me to the item's location, but they will assist me to the cosmetics counter where they will ring up my items without me having to wait in line at the main register.  That being said, it is obvious that whoever manages this store puts customer satisfaction first & does an excellent job at instilling that belief in their employees.

name: Mrs Cricket
text:
I started at the drive thru and after waiting in line I find out there was an insurance problem. The gentleman working the drive thru didn't know what the details were so I went inside and stood in line to figure out the problem. After clearing things up with the insurance, I then had to wait for the prescription. They called out my name but then I had to wait in line again. Finally at checkout when they needed my id that it is naturally in the car. At this point I'm just done; I leave. 3 hours and no prescription. Yes I could have gotten my id and waiting again but I chose not to. They were under staffed and it was now peak time.

The prescription was dropped off and given a pickup time. It wasn't ready. I believe because of the insurance problem but I'm guessing because it was never said. A simple phone call could have helped this situation.

name: ryan 1981
text: It's hard to believe the positive reviews. They called our elderly family member who can't do for her self anymore. She can't talk like she used to so we have power of attorney. Walgreens has had no trouble in telling about her medicine for the past year now. Now all a sudden they refuse to talk to us about her medicine saying it violates her hippa privacy when they have been talking to us for over a year. They are just harassing us and throwing us around. This walgreens has bad customer service.

text: Got a call saying my prescription would be ready at 3:15. Got here at 3:40 and was told it was not ready. She told me it would be ready in 15 minutes , it's 4:30 and the person in front of me got there prescription before mine. I've been waiting 45 minutes for a prescription that would have been ready over an hour ago. I am highly unstatified with how poorly this pharamacy is ran. They have lost my business for sure.

Now I'm here right now months after the first incident and the lady Fri had said they couldn't give refills, I said that's fine fill it as it is and I'll call in a new one. Now 4 days later I get here and they never filled it, said they tried to contact me, never did. Tired of them, goodbye and good luck.

Like I was suppose to get off work and skip school so he didn't have to deal with the problem not only the pharmacy was facing to fill the RX but I was facing as well. He made me really upset. text: I called the pharmacy several times for 2 days, even stayed on the phone for 20 mins and nobody picked up. I was trying to see if my 2 month old had a refill so she wouldn't run out of meds. I decided to call the dr instead and found out she did have a refill. Go by there today (3 days later) so they can get it ready and we can pick it up on the way back home only to find out they have to order it so it will be 3 days until they get it. Had they answered the phone this wouldn't be an issue. Called another Walgreens to see if we can have it transferred they also didn't have it which is understandable, but atleast they answer their phone and offered to order it. Now we are trying to find a compounding pharmacy so they can mix her meds because she has to have them so she won't be in pain. Im definitely switching pharmacies. I had saw friends post about driving up there while witing on someone to pick the line up and still be on the phone waiting when they got there. I honestly thought they were exaggerating.
