name: Olcay Ciftci
text: Shopping at Walgreens is like playing a gamble. You find a good deal and clip the coupon. Then, you see the item is available at the nearest store. You order it and wait for pick up, but then you get an email which shows the item is not available at the store. You want to purchase the same item from another Walgreens store or online, but you realize the system assumes you used the coupon and doesn't offer the same coupon. I had this issue several times. Once, one of my orders was canceled because of the same reason, but I saw the product at the shelf in the same day. Walgreens's online system has a lot of problems. Waste of time!

name: Nathan Floyd
text: TOTALLY Agree about just kids working there and being jerks.  I came in at 11:55pm, not because I wanted to, but because I was having an allergic reaction to some medication and needed benadryl. I mistakenly thought they were open 24 hours. Some young blond manager jerk caught me coming in the door and said, "Just so you know, we close in 5 minutes. I mean, I guess you can come in if you need something but you need to leave quickly."  Then, he proceeded to follow me around the store about 15 feet away; not to help find what I needed, but to either act like I was going to steal or rush me out. He followed me all the way back to the register and sat there sighing until I could leave. I will literally never give that Walgreens another penny.

name: Isabel Aleman
text: Avoid this Walgreens!!! The employees were so rude when I asked a simple question about printing pictures. I first asked the woman working the register at the photo center and she was short with me and got the manager. The manager came back and was snarky from the start and when I asked my question again about printing photos she did not attempt to help me and was being rude without cause. We are never coming back to this Walgreens again.

name: Grace Nolen
text: This pharmacy at this Walgreens has the worst service I’ve ever experienced. Not only are they excruciatingly slow, but they have literally given me the wrong medicines that belonged to someone else. They have told me on several occasions that my medicine was not in yet, but when I say “my doctor said she sent it in” they respond with “oh yeah here it is”. Not sure how that makes sense. The staff is also rude. One time I was talking in the drive through and she just hung up the phone and walked away. So I proceeded to go inside and speak to the pharmacist. If I could describe this Walgreens with two words they would be careless and negligent.

name: Jennifer McDonald

text: The people in the pharmacy were super helpful and very nice. I am definitely filling all of my prescriptions there from now on. They did their best to save me money and even applied a discount card for me that I didn't have. They treat you like a person instead of just a number. I would highly recommend them to everyone.

name: N S
text: I have never seen a pharmacy tech treat a customer so poorly. The pharmacist did not bother to turn around and address the tech’s behavior and after “helping” me the tech turned around to another tech and made fun of me in clear line of site. There is no reason anyone working in the medical industry should treat a patient/customer with such poor manners and outright disrespect. I will never return to this location and will be working on changing my insurance so that I never have to return to another Walgreens store. (Publix, here I come!) As someone that has worked as a pharmacy tech and is currently in school to become a pharmacist myself I cannot imagine how this behavior could be seen as acceptable and believe that someone in charge should have addressed it as soon as it began. So disappointed in the entire interaction.

name: Carl Klimah
text:
READ BOTTOM LINE AT END if you don't want to read this paragraph.

I have had mixed experiences at this store. The STORE part is fine.

The PHARMACY is another story. I have had mixed experiences with them, from some pharmacists being competent and outstanding, to some being downright rude and dumb. I tutored/ taught organic chemistry when I was an undergrad and have had many arguments with them over medication. I have had them get my dosages wrong many times (telling me to take to much). On top of this many times they treated me like I was a criminal for trying to get medicines with no street value. Other times those medicines that did have street value, were handed over to me like candy. Some of the employees also were not aware of basic pharmacy policy, upon which I had to remind them of. Needless to say many of them can be rude when you question there blatant incompetence.

BOTTOM LINE: go during peak hours. Know what and how much to take. Then double check when you get home. Remain calm through the rudeness or plan on taking your business else where.

She took me to the location of the meds and handed me what I needed...$34! They were extremely busy, but she still took the time to help me make a financially wise decision instead of just selling me something.

text: I sent 34 pictures from my phone 2 hours ago.   So far only 5 have been uploaded.   I called the Ft Payne store and the girl working doesn't have a clue why this is happening.   I hope by using my phone now my photos won't be lost.   I have another order if the pictures I sent goes through .  I might have to go to another source.

name: Gabrielle Griffith
text: I was on a family vacation and had to refill a medication I forgot at home. After ringing up I was informed that a prescription had raised from a $0 co-pay to $100. This came as a big shock and my mind was wheeling with trying to figure out how to afford that each month. The staff at the pharmacy informed me to call my insurance and make sure something was not incorrect and were very patient while I did so. This was all happening at the end of their shift. The new co-pay was the correct amount and luckily my family was able to help cover the cost. Fast forward to a few days later and I received a phone call from Walgreens patient care. The pharmacy staff had contacted them on my behalf to enroll me in to a co-pay assistance program through the medication manufacture. The new total monthly cost would be $20! They also applied the discount to the original refill and I was able to give my family back the money I had borrowed to cover the medication. I am truly thankful to the staff at the Fort Payne, AL location for all the help and kindness they showed an out-of-towner. Walgreens will always have my business.

name: June Frost
text: 30+ Years of Satisfaction - that is what I've received from Kilgore Express Pharmacy in Gurley, Alabama. I am on first-name basis with most of the staff, especially Alphreda (aka Freda), who is one of the most compassionate and caring people I know. She even has made a wonderful home for some orphan cats that were hanging out around the pharmacy. The cats' home, food and water bowls are on the porch on the walk-up into the pharmacy. Be sure to pat them on the head as you go inside. The pharmacist and the entire staff are very knowledgeable and offer any assistance almost before you know you need it. They stock most medication that a chain-type pharmacy stocks - if they don't have it, they will have it the next day. Another reason I love this place is because unlike a chain-type pharmacy, they carry peripheral things that small-town country people like and need - not a bunch of make-up, groceries, toys, As Seen on TV items, and other stuff that just drains one's bank account. They do, however, have a very good selection of greeting cards, a small selection of local arts and crafts, a fair selection general purpose off-the-shelf  remedies, vitamins, pain relievers, and some surprise goodies. You just have to visit to see for yourself.

name: George McFadden
text: I insist employees are honoured that I stopped by the store to spend money. A simple smile is all it takes. Also, something isn't clicking right with automated prescription program. Store is clean and well lit. George

name: Lane Ramsay
text: The pharmacy employees treated us very poorly and were just rude no matter how nice you are to them.

name: Nimitz 17
text: Nice store and  pharmacy. I wish my  Insurance would cover CVS. The  Walgreens in Leeds is the only other closest option, and they have been  rude and unhelpful on more than one occasion. CVS will call you and give you a heads up if your Insurance will not cover your script. Walgreens in Leeds will not. I “unknowingly at the time” paid full price because I came in to early one month to Walgreens.A difference for paying $5 to $167. So I immediately went back to the drive-through to ask for a return. Leeds,Walgreens said I was to late. If it was CVS they would have called me to let me know as soon as they found out my insurance wouldn’t cover it.

name: James Moody
text: I go here all the time.  Mostly for diapers and other personal care products. It is a great store and very coupon/extra buck friendly! The employees are very nice and helpful.

name: Alex Crow
text: Pretty neat. Feels a bit small, though.

name: Ami Measel
text: I love the staff! Very friendly!

name: Noah Morgan
text: Pharmacy took care of me

name: Debra Tucker
text: Every time I go in the people are so nice!  The Manager is always welcoming and willing to help!  The Pharmacist is helpful answering any questions I have!

name: Hal Scoggins
text: They have good customer service with people that Will help you

name: Dominique Hudson
text: The clerk was so helpful and awesome! I wish I knew her name. Great and clean store

name: Regina Murray
text: There are a couple of clerks that aren't very helpful but Jennifer the Pharmacist is the reason I continue to go. She is always more than helpful, kind and pleasant.

name: Chrystal Campbell
text: When you call and Danielle in the pharmacy is rude and belittling every time you should change pharmacies. I would EXCEPT we have Caremark insurance and it is the closest CVS to my house. I am aware that I asked you to hold my diabetes medicine 2 weeks ago. I didn’t have the extra money and I had samples. This week when I called and asked you to fill it I didn’t need a run down of the inconvenience it was for you. You are open until 6. I gave you plenty of time. I can not believe you actually sighed and asked if I could wait.

name: Darren Bailey
text: Very helpful and always nice!

name: Candice Sager
text: The employees are very helpful!

name: Ginger Lewis
text: Very helpful young man stopped what he was busy doing to come help me look for an item I couldn't locate. Turns out they were sold out. But the friendliness and helpfulness made up for the out of stock item! 3 other Dollars Generals in the area were also sold out of the product.

name: Speedy Nichols
text: They towed my car and put the chain under my car and hooked to the Rader brace and pulled it and tore my radioter apart and when I ask them about it I was told that they didn't do it .i went to jail that night and my car never gave me any problems but when I tryed to drive home from the Wreaker Service I was on the side of road and now it's parked at the house broke down.they denied it all here the pic of what they done

name: Debbie Wiley
text: Very clean and tidy store.  Well stocked. Found everything I needed and more.  I will go back to this store instead of the one in Florence.

name: Nikkie Murphy (Nik)
text: It's a newer dollar store. Is smaller, and doesn't have as much, but it's still a good store. They keep it really clean in there

name: MySpace TV “made by Google Glympse” All-in-One
Deanna Potoski
text: Close to home..very friendly and helpful staff!

name: Beverly Armstead Sparks
text: This place has really good deals and you can get stuff at a discount sometimes and you can get half off clearance you can use digital coupons and on Saturday if you have $5 off coupons. The people that work at the Dollar Generals are really generally nice. They are open until 10 p.m. which is pretty convenient. And they are open at 8 a.m. . They have several locations which is great and all the products that I usually get at a bigger retail store.

name: Sondra. Waldrep

name: Bootsie Lewis
text: The new store was certainly very nice. The employees that helped me were the most friendly. This new store will be where I shop! Stop by and I think you will be surprised by all the floor space, not crowded like some others are!! Plus it is very close to me, easy to get to and which  & out.

name: Paul Fuller, Jr.
text: I visit this Dollar General many times in a week and all of there employees are very helpful, I live real close to another Dollar General and I will go out of my way to visit this one, the manager keeps the store stocked very well.

name: Mr. JM Bama
text: Owned & Operated by Wonderful People! I have been using this place for my whole family for years & we will continue to give them our business for many more years to come! Thank You Guys For All Your Support!

name: Scott Plagmann
text: Always have my rx in stock and ready for pickup

name: Janet B
text: Very friendly and helpful staff.  Love this pharmacy.  Walgreens and CVS could take some lessons from NJ Pharmacy.  Excellent customer service.

name: sharron malone
text: Have used North Jefferson Pharmacy for years. The best people work there .

name: Matt Lee
text: The best pharmacy I've ever been to really helpful in every way. Really makes you feel like family. Love the staff.

name: Melissa Dean
text: I drive 30 minutes to get my prescriptions filled and probably pass at least 10-15 other pharmacies in the process, but I wouldn't have it any other way! North Jefferson Pharmacy is exceptional in every way. Their willingness to help, the experience & knowledge of the staff....as well as the fact that they're just good kind-hearted people. Vicki is one of the best Pharmicist that I've ever dealt with! I would follow her to the end of the earth and back, just to get my perscriptions filled! 😉 (And no, I do not know Vickie or any of the staff of this pharmacy on any type of personal level - strictly Pharmacy / Customer)

name: Robin Hamer
text: They are friendly, kind and have some of the cutest tops ive ever seen!    Going today and im looking forwars to seeing thie clothes and them of course.    Lol.

name: Shannon Hill
text: Very caring friendly staff.They make you feel like family.I do believe they genuinely care about their customers

name: Destiny Fitch
text: Amazing customer service my number one pharmacy

name: Jennifer Conway
text: Friendly and prompt service

name: Mindy Tobin
text: Listen to them talk about a patient's personal business here.Shame on you guys

name: Jackie Renderos
text: The pharmacist/owner was INCREDIBLY rude. Doesn't even deserve one star. Impatient and terrible customer service.

name: Rebecca Richardson
text: CVS is a great place to fill prescriptions, they have competitive prices and the staff is friendly, helpful, efficient and professional. I like that CVS gives you extra-bucks coupons on your purchases. CVS also mails out discount coupons that can be used with the extra-bucks. I like to use my coupons on the large makeup selection of items they have.

name: Melissa Shepherd
text: Nothing in stock that I needed.

name: Richeryl Ware
text: I had a prescription filled for my daughter and they failed to mix it. I had to go back in the cold and rain and explain what happened, only to be met by a young lady with an attitude. She didn’t apologize or say one word. She just “fixed” the prescription. Well I get home and the young lady put the wrong size stopper in the medicine and it fell into the bottle. I called to speak with the Pharmacist who was very non chalant and insincere. I don’t understand how these people could be so careless and unprofessional and working with something as important as medication. Very disappointed.

name: Kaitlyn Bagwell
text: Little pricey on items but pharmacy is great! Super nice staff

name: Pam Creed
text:
They are too busy to keep up !  Staff changes constantly and they tell you different things. They can just be down right Rude sometimes.
Just too much confusion from too many customers.

name: Chris Adams
text:
This is just another typical CVS and there's nothing particularly good about it.  Customer service isn't great and at the front they won't help you unless you ask for something specific.

These type of stores all have the same thing in common and that is pricing everything in the store as if the whole world has their goofy card.  That way when you try to check out with no card you get hit with a ridiculous total.  So, I just don't even go anymore.  Would have rather had a  restaurant or something else built here in this spot.

name: eddie morton
text: Your 4 for $10 Coke drinks is misleading. Look at it however you choose but the drinks cost me $12 not the $10 as advertised.  So I get a $2 reward bucks toward my next purchase. If I never shop at CVS again, where is my savings?  Probably will not shop at your establishment again.

name: Jewel Moore
text: Quick and thorough!

name: M Smith
text: Great staff and awesome store!

name: Sandra Lyle
text: Good prices and customer service

name: Robert Broome
text:
Although some of the staff are professionals, for the most part this has got to be poorest excuse for a pharmacy it has been my misfortune to stumble across.

In 11 months i have not been able to pick up my prescriptions in a single visit.  Not once.  I have received an excuse every single time ranging from the pharmacy tech left the insulin out of the refrigerator and it is ruined to being told it is ready only to find out it has to be ordered.

Tonight I asked to speak to the pharmacist due to their latest screw up only to get hung up on.   Then the little phone jockey calls back and just holds the phone line open without saying anything.

They get one star ONLY because I can’t give a negative raiting.

I will not be back .. my insurance money and copay can be spent somewhere else.

name: Charles McKinney
text: Your average CVS. Most items are priced slightly higher than what you could either find in another retail location, a grocery store, or online. More importantly, the pharmacy staff appears to be completely overwhelmed most of the time.

name: Sherrie Latham
text: friendly  staff.

name: Destiny Fitch
text: Good friendly service

name: David Hunnicutt
text: It’s so hard to check out here. They never have but one or two employees working (only one working today). There were only two customers ahead of me and it took 15 minutes just to check out with one simple item (not a prescription) at 10 am on a Saturday. It’s always this way. The self checkout wasn’t working properly either. I live less than 1/2 mile away from this store and typically just drive somewhere else much farther away if time is a factor because this place is always such a slow and painful ordeal.

name: Andrew Copeland
text: The cashier guy with the red hair is THE nicest, most pleasant human I've ever come in contact with. Pay this man.

name: K M
text:
Not sure why the reviews are low here but this was my 1st time visiting this location & was very impressed. I came in for cosmetics because the store in Athens where I live acted like it was an issue when I returned some products with my receipt! I noticed right off the bat that all their Covergirl cosmetics were nice & neat. At home they were all out of order & just not stocked properly. The reason I know these were placed correctly was because they were out of a shade I wanted so I thumbed through the other rows. Not only was the store nice & clean, Timothy was very nice & greeted me as I walked in & asked if I needed any help. This store needs to show the CVS in Athens how to treat their customers & how to keep their merchandise stocked right! Good job 👍

Kim

name: Angelica -Angel- Elizabeth
text: I called to check if an item was in-stock bc it said it was online. The cashier (i assume) made sure it was intead of just saying no without checking, like most retail agents (even at other CVS locations) do. It made my day! She knows who she is. I just want to say keep up the outstanding customer service! Thanks

name: Brian Harrison
text: The vaccination process at this CVS today was a well oiled machine.

name: Sugarwick
text: people here are SO NICE!!! even a customer helped me look for something!!! I recommend this place 1000000% ☺️

name: Jane Doe
text: You'd think since they're near a nice place to live they would also keep that professional manner. Had the pharmacist tell me to pick up a prescription and she purposely told me to pick it up after closing time. What the hell?

name: Debbie S.
text: We were required by insurance to switch to CVS only for prescriptions. After always having pleasant experiences at Walgreens, I was appalled at the lack of courteous and friendly workers in the pharmacy with the exception of Devonte who is always willing to help.  The pharmacist is horribly rude. I called in a prescription and he informed me he was busy but would try to get it done.  The following evening I went to check and he had never done it nor had he left a note for the pharmacist who was working to do it.  This was after calling over a dozen times and no one would answer the pharmacy phone.  FINALLY this guy answered and then didn't even bother.  All of my other prescriptions have taken way too long to fill.  My new thyroid medicine was called in by my doctor on a Friday morning.  I received a text (if you don't sign up for text you'll never get any communication out of them) saying it would be Monday evening before I could get it.  Again...after calling literally all day to try to find out what was going on, I got through and was told they didn't have enough to fill my order.  There was no offer to let me get a partial prescription until they received the rest.  Heaven forbid this pharmacist have to fill it twice in order to get a customer the meds they need.  By far the worst customer service I have ever witnessed. I'm amazed this is allowed. Shame on you CVS for not having more staff and for not getting a pharmacist with compassion and an ounce of kindness.

name: patton fussell
text:
I wouldn’t return here if you paid me $1 million dollars. The pharmacist, MILES HARDING is horribly rude. He refused to fill a prescription for my fiancé because her prescription was from Cleveland, Tn. Keep in mind the CVS down the street filled her other prescriptions, but they were out of stock for this particular medicine. She has extreme anxiety and it is crucial for her medical regiment. Furthermore, it’s not even a class two substance. It was simply your standard anti anxiety medicine.

I called MILES HARDING and he told me that, “I’m a pharmacist in Alabama and can fill whatever prescriptions I want.” We just moved to Huntsville this month, so she has not found a primary physician, therefore had to drive to Cleveland today. The prescription was written today, but because of the time difference, the doctor was closed. Shouldn’t have made a bit of difference. He didn’t ask questions, he simply refused for absolutely no reason. SAVE YOURSELF a HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE and STAY AWAY.

WALGREENS filled it and were nice as could be.

name: Amanda Young
text: I have had to block the number for this particular CVS because they literally call every freaking day to ask if I want to refill my prescription. This is after I asked them multiple times to take me off the automatic call list to inform me that my prescription needs to be refilled. So they took me off that list and now the pharmacist/tech calls everyday. It’s ridiculous! How about you just let your customers call and refill their own prescription when they have run out?? The people who work there are really nice but the constant calling makes me want to switch pharmacies.

name: Heather Webster
text: Best deals and really nice staff in the pharmacy and in the front! Very obviously understaffed, but mad props to the staff for still always being so positive, even under stress!

name: Shayla Smitten
text: Just unprofessional. Personal opinion though.

name: Julia Cade
text: Went to the pharmacy today, looking for a particular sinus medicine that was recommended by a friend. The two people there, were unhelpful and unpleasant. Maybe, I just didn't look the part. I was very disappointed and went immediately to CVS inside of Target. They were wonderful there.

name: Nick
text: I have no opinion of the general store, however; if you are looking for a new pharmacy- RUN AWAY! This is by far the worst pharmacy I have ever used. 1-4 weeks on any prescription order, constant “mixups” where they call/text saying they have your medicine ready and then you get there and they’re like “oh we don’t have anything on this computer screen I just clicked on for 20 minutes, sorry it must’ve been a mixup” Constant incompetence and disappointment.

name: Deborah Hunsucker
text: Their new hours are horrible. Went this morning before work closed. Stopped by after work closed. Really what do you do when people need medicine. It would be nice if you would post the proper hours on the website and drive thru.

name: George Winters
text: Pharmacists and technicians have always been friendly, helpful and responsive. Very good pharmacy.

name: Hannah Balsmeyer
text: The pharmacy staff is always amazing!

name: Angela Walker
text: Normally very good service. They always seem to be busy, but I usually drop my scripts off and pick up later.

name: Matthew “Matt S”
text: Great place to run into and get medicine if you need it

name: George Howard
text: Excellent service and a very well stocked, and clean store.

name: Marcus Worthington
text: Wouldn't go back

name: Ashley H
text: Takes too long to get a prescription. Never going here again.

name: Kimberly Ferguson
text: Worst Pharmacist! I will never go back! She was unprofessional and rude. I reported her on Twitter.

name: Kevin Pulliam
text: Convenient location

name: Simeon
text: Had a prescription for some iron supplements, took 4 hours to get prescription....

name: George Howard
text: I used this pharmacy for 4 years and they were the very best I have ever experienced in my life. The people there really knew my wife and I and truly cared about being a part of our health care plan. I can't count the times someone there went above and beyond without being asked to ease our burden, or make sure we were better informed. If we hadn't moved to Alaska I would drive 100 miles to keep using this Rite-Aid location.

name: Jonathan Ouzts
text: Pharmacy staff very helpful & insightful! Highly recommended....

name: Kevin Colin
text: I loved shopping here and its my go to every time. The manager was a great help and I was able to find things easily. Loved the deals I get from my CVS card and altough something cost more than I would have liked its a convenience store so can't really complain about that. Overall my favorite place to shop when it comes to daily use things and I love the variety of things they sell.

name: Caterpillar C
text: amazing place to go! the manager Lisa was a great help!

name: Javier Z
text: wonderful service and very well kept up! def would go again

name: Xavier Le
text: It was super over priced for the cheapest of things. After I went to Walmart and it was so much cheaper there I don't think ill be going again.

name: George William
text: Horrible customer service. I found deodorant marked down on the shelf. The product name matched, the SKU number matched. The cashier said it was full price. I said it was marked down. She said it was probably a misplaced item. Goodbye CVS, hello Walgreens. I expect to see this store vacant soon.

name: Hannah Hudson
text: Saw a product online, and the website said it was available in this store. I went in the store and they said they didn't carry it, they refused to look up the item in their system. I worked at CVS, and I know you're capable of looking up an item, and the database will at the very least tell you what stores it's in stock at. Either the cashiers are either horribly undertrained or don't care enough to put in a little bit of effort. And the manager was conveniently unavailable

name: Robert Evans
text: I would shop here more if they didn't make you feel like you had to have one of their product discount cards to get any good deals.  I just want to be able to come in get their best price and leave. I don't want to have to keep up with a card just so they can track my purchases. I now just visit Walgreens just up the street.

name: glenn bond
text: 25 minutes on hold

name: Nee nee
text: Nice

name: Crystal Dawn
text: Wonderfull

name: Buddy Smith
text: Very interesting and friendly Drug store with a great snack bar. Enjoy a good home cooked breakfast of your choice.  Hamburger is a must have.

name: Monica Brown
text: Always Always Great food. Outstanding customer service from front to back. Everyone is always so friendly.

name: Tim Blankenship
text: Very friendly and helpful staff

name: Katie Horton
text:
BCBS picked David Drug for me. You get 2 choices in Columbiana, CVS and Davis Drug. I used CVS and never had problems. They would call for my refills, if needed and the wait for prescriptions was maybe 15-20 mins with a walk in RX.
Every. Single. Time. I bring a RX to wait for at Davis Drug, the wait is always an hour or more!! I understand being busy but if you have that much business, getter employees to work. It’s ridiculous to need medication and having to wait that long. Babies crying because they don’t feel good. I really wish I could use CVS again.

name: Mary Rape
text: Rude employees rude people an very expensive place

name: Sasha Johns
text: Locals serving locals. This is a hometown place that offers so much to not just their community but also visitors. Go get a Davis special at the snack bar.

name: Rebecca Turner
text: The food is amazing! I love their burgers and the food is cooked to order! This is not the place if you are looking for quick! We spend about an hour in there and about 30 minutes of it is waiting on our food. They are a small business so there are only ever two people in the deli but like I said the food is worth it!

name: Susan Hutton
text: Great neighborhood and community pharmacy. Always have what you need in stock. Tons of extras. Alot of things you don't see anywhere else. Very adequately staffed which are friendly and helpful.  Awesome is the best way to describe the EATS and DRINKS from their snack bark.

name: Dorothy Welch-Brasher
text: The ladies at the food counter are so sweet and nice. The food is great and the fresh squeezed lemonade is to die for and I'm not an lemonade drinker.

name: Ray Fisher
text: Friendly people and a knowledgeable and helpful Pharmacy Staff.  They are in general competitive with their pharmacy prices.  Their over the counter stuff is usually a little higher than the big box stores but they do not have the buying power of a Walmart or Sams.  You have to expect a little extra cost for the convenience of a local store near by and at least you do not have the gasoline cost for driving to the big box store.  I have used them primarily for several years.

name: Dave Corn
text: Great drug store, best prices, gifts, sandwiches/soda fountain

name: R Heffner
text: Terrell Owens

name: Jennifer “jeni” Cox
text: Very friendly and great food!

name: Jason Vandiver
text: Great Burger!

name: Janet Hollomon
text: Best drugstore in Columbiana.

name: A B
text: I never use the pharmacy here. I stop in to avoid the grocery store when I need an item here and there. Always clean, well stocked and the front cashier is on point.

name: tim jeter
text: Always has pleasant experience

name: Morgan Sanders
text: Was waiting behind a car before 7, and they were taking their sweet time. Guess they decided to close the pharmacy drive thru after that car even though I’d been waiting. This pharmacy can’t even keep medications in stock to fill scripts. Maybe I should find a new pharmacy..

name: Brian Dothan
text:
Great pharmacy. They have excellent customer service and are problem solvers.

Been a loyal customer for 9 years

name: Shirley Coker
text: They always have what I need when I go shopping there. Thank You too the friendly staff

name: DV8
text: When a pharmacy can't fill scripts . pathetic .

name: Tiffany Rowell
text: The lady behind the counter rolled her eyes at me the whole time I was there. I was a new customer and only needed amoxicillin. She was rude, crass and completely unprofessional. I will never go to a Walgreens again.

name: Brandon Cook
text: I typically only use the pharmacy. Most of the staff in the pharmacy are very helpful and courteous but sometimes the turn around times on getting my prescriptions filled are a little unreasonable. The convenient location to where I live and certainly the polite employees most of all keep me coming back.

name: Trisha Hardy
text: Most of the pharmacy staff is fine. One guy that works there is so rude. Every time I have to speak to him he seems like I’m wasting his time. He does not act as though he cares to help. I’ve had to deal with him numerous times and he’s ALWAYS incredibly rude.

name: Rory “Cassandra” Moore
text: This is my Walgreens. :)  I shop here for everything as I love to coupon shop and get the best deal for my buck. The only thing I do not recommend is their pharmacy. It takes too long to get your prescription. I used them for 5 years and recently switched to another pharmacy for prescriptions because when I drop off and come back 4 or 5 hours later I shouldn't have to wait again to pick up. But I use their photo processing and shop there at least 2 days a week for bargains.

name: Christine Oglesby (Gadgetgirl)
text: This is my favorite Walgreens. Things are easy to find and everyone is so nice.

name: Kati Miller
text: I couldn't find what I was looking for and had to search for assistance which would have been fine if I hadn't come across two employees who avoided eye contact and walked by me even after trying to stop them. I found two more employees who were stocking end caps and asked for help after they had finished speaking to each other about what sounded like a personal matter and one told me that they had no idea where said item was and suggested I ask the manager. She points to the person she was talking to and said that he was the manager and walked away. I approached this "manager" who was kneeling down by a shelf. He did not stop working to answer my question nor did he even look at me and advised me to ask the pharmacy what I needed. I glanced around for a second and after not seeing the pharmacy sign I asked him where it was and he responded by pointing a finger in the general direction of its location and said it was "over there in the corner." He didn't even look up from the shelf. Will never go back thanks to the poor service and lack of interest I received.

name: james johnson
text: Helpful courtious quick in and out.

name: hadarosa
text: Most of the pharmacy staff is super nice except for one guy who treated my mother in a  condescending way (she was only asking about an over-the-counter medication)

name: The Hammerdown
text: I just simply love Walgreens!

name: Kelly Maguire
text: Very friendly staff !

name: Rodney Hamm
text: Dropped off RX today at 3:30pm was told it would be ready at 4:pm  at 6:25 I am still waiting!

name: John Long
text: Clean Store Alert!!!!

name: Whitney Adkins
text: On Tuesday, June 8, 2021, I personally witnessed the dark headed lady employee accuse an innocent customer of stealing, she then demanded that he empty his pockets, which he cooperated and did so willingly..only for her to be proven wrong and see that he actually had absolutely no store merchandise of any kind on him. She barely muttered a "sorry" under her breath and proceeded to be uncivil and downright rude to any and all other customers who happened to be unfortunate enough to cross her past. People like this shouldn't be allowed to work with the public.

name: Esther Soares (Ess)
text: This store was the only place on Easter I found Easter baskets on Easter, I know last minute kinda person. Love the pieces and the customer service..thanks dollar general

name: Linda Elliott
text: My favorite place to shop. I love dollar general. Just wish they'd get more help. They need to get bigger bags of cat and dog food.  I have to go to Walmart to get the dog and cat food  because the small bags doesn't last but just  3 days. Other than that dollar general is my kind of store. 5 stars

name: Kimberly Holcomb
text: Great workers!! Easy to locate

text: Meridianville Alabama CVS has the best pharmacy workers I have ever met and worked with. I love each and every one of them. I will always use them until they retire or move to different pharmacy. I suggest using this pharmacy because they will go ABOVE AND BEYOND for all your needs. Mary Gardner

Well I arrive at 8:08 and no one is available to help me now I’m going home with out this medication that was very much needed for the safety of my health !! Lady who ever you are I pray you never have to go through What I’m going through tonight and tomorrow .........

name: Keith W
text: If you care anything about your health, finances and sanity you will find another pharmacy. Please do not give Walgreens your business. I have had so many bad experiences with this particular location. For example:  a stolen debit card, incorrect quantities of prescriptions (supposed to receive 60 pills in a bottle, but only 45 were in there.) They charged my insurance company for triple the quantity of another prescription. Dishonesty, rudeness, and incompetence pretty much sums up Walgreen's Pharmacies. From what I hear every location in the Montgomery area is like this. Run!!

text: I placed an order online for curbside pickup for only TWO items. I have been waiting and currently still waiting on my order. I will never place an order online again. I only did this for two items that were gifts to a child for their birthday. They are extremely slow at this location.

name: Bee Bee
text: Normally this location is average for pharmacy waits and competency but they keep changing the hours. It used to be a 24 hr pharmacy, then it changed to 7am-11pm, covid hit and it went to 9am-9pm, about 2 weeks ago it was 7am-11pm again, and now it's back to 9am-9pm... I wish they would go back to 24 hr but I'd settle on 7-11 as I prefer early morning or late evening pick ups as I live 30 minutes away and don't like dealing with loads of traffic to get to town...

They never seemed to be adequately staffed for the volume at this location. Them being 24 hrs is the only advantage. I'll be filling my prescriptions elsewhere from now on.

text: I didn't go in with my daughter for this transaction but the staff must be efficient and on point. My very particular daughter went in to make a return and was immediately back to the car with no qualms which is rare for her.  The parking lot was buzzing at the time.

name: Brick Pappi
text: Dropped off prescription at 6 pm and I left without my prescription at 11:10 pm. These people at Walgreens Pharmacy on brown springs road are the most ignorant people ever. Why are the standards so low for pharmacist , techs , and other positions within the pharmacy ? They feel completely comfortable being disrespectful to customers because management doesn’t hold employees accountable at Walgreens.  If I could give negative stars I would give a negative -20. WALGREENS IS AND WILL ALWAYS WILL BE THE PHARMACY THAT EMPLOYS THE MOST IGNORANT OF PEOPLE. THIS REVIEW IS ONLY THE FIRST STEP.

name: Maya Smith (MayaPapaya)
text: This location overall is probably at a B- rating. It's mainly because of the pharmacy. They are extremely slow and don't have medications in stock. They also aren't helpful when it comes to verifying the prescriptions with your doctor's offices or insurances. They send you to do the foot work. I went just last night to fill a prescription for my 11 yr old who had surgery that day. He had to have his elbow reset and a pin put in it. I was told it would take 20 mins tops to get his pain medication. I spent over an hour there with him in pain along with my other 2 children who are 6 yrs old. Came to the pharmacy at a quarter to 10p, left there at 5 mins to 11p! The few times I have to get medications from there, I always have to deal with an issue, whether it be insurance issues, the medications aren't there, they need the doctor to verify, they can't see or find something in the system, etc. Just always something! SMH, if they worked on the pharmacy, it'd be an A+ store.

name: Madison Monte
text: I had an excellent experience here. It was timely and well executed. The pharmacist was simply kind and answered my questions accurately.

name: Sonya Briggs
text: ZERO STARS...Terrible pharmacy experience and this is the last time I use this Walgreens pharmacy. Lady was so very rude. My meds were emailed to pharmacy by 11 am and it is 7:30 pm and I still do not have them.

name: Cindy Green
text: Drive through service nearly non existent.

name: Stephen Pierce
text: The employees are very helpful. However, I now use Adam's Drugs! Much better. 😀

name: Amanda Cook
text: TERRIBLE service at the pharmacy. We tried to use their location because our child had an issue after regular hours on a Sunday and our regular pharmacy was closed. There was a blonde at the drive thru window with a tattoo on her arm who had a TERRIBLE attitude. She tried to make us go inside to present our prescription (after waiting in the drive-thru for 20 minutes) and we explained to her that we were dropping off, she said it would be 2 hours wait for a simple common antibiotic (no mixing - just pills). We left the prescription and told them we'd just have to come back the next day, it was late and the kids needed to get to bed. I understand they were busy, but when we arrived back the next day they had NO RECORD of our child in the system, they had lost the physical prescription I handed to her the night before, and they pretended like we were the crazy ones and nothing was wrong. We had to call the Drs office and get them to send the Rx to our regular pharmacy. Thank goodness our child had an antibiotic shot at the Drs office that was already working or I really would have been put out. If I could give zero stars, I would.

name: Jasper Riax
text: I've waited 45 minutes for one prescription I filled 3 hours ago. They've told me to pull around TWICE because the pharmacist has to "check it" this is the worst pharmacy I've ever been to.

name: Michelle S
text:
Give me a break
Call - Is my RX ready for pickup
Walgreens- yes
Get to drive thru
27 minutes later.....
Can I help you....

If this is your standard. Close your drive thru. Your service is abysmal.

name: Katie Grimes Rotton
text: It would be nice if there an actual phone number that would make it easier to call instead of looking through several sites to get a real (LOCAL) phone number with a real person.  Just remember, every time a business uses automatic phone menus and online applications, someone loses their job, money for school, their insurance (health and life), and probably their house.

name: UnbiasedReport
text: No reason why I should be up so late, but I am to do this review. Customer service in the pharmacy is non existent. At 11:10 PM I turned in my prescription, was not met with kindness, and treated even worse when I told the pharmacist that I did not have health insurance. She told me it would be about 15 to 20 minutes before my prescription was ready. I asked her where did I need to go or did I need to just come back? She said well you can't sit here. You can drive over there and wait. I did so and in turn while I was waiting fell asleep. I just happened to wake up and looked at my clock and it read Midnight. I was literally across from the window. I proceeded to call and find out what was the hold up with my prescription because I did not receive a text message alert stating that it was ready. The automated system told me that I had a prescription ready.  upset at this point I went to the window and I told the lady that no one told me my prescription was ready. In turn she told me that the girl tried to wave me down. I was directly across from the window asleep in the car or as far as she could have assumed was dead from just sitting there. She had no concern at all. They have my number on file and did not use it. Nor was I sent a text message letting me know that my prescription was ready. She the pharmacist then asked if I wanted instructions instead of volunteering the instructions. I did not answer from being so upset that my time was wasted. I will not be going back. I will let others know that this Pharmacy is at the corner of rude and rude.

name: Kids' Videos
text: Good products but their prices are very high. You can get the same over the counter products cheaper at walmart or Amazon. They are always crowded and extremely slow at filling the prescriptions.

name: Christina Buntyn
text: I called to ask a question of the pharmacy staff, and I waited 28 minutes before they answered my call. I have also been in the store before and seen first hand that they ignored the ringing phones. I will be using a independent pharmacy from now on!

name: [C]
text: Went into Walgreens around 9:00 ISH to pick up some aloe vera. Went through the line and it was no problem. I came back because I had forgot something, and I noticed the cashier asked this white female for a donation (She did donate, I think), and when she left I went through the line... And she didn't ask me; she wasn't saying anything, but she said a lot with that action #100 Get your workers together George (Or is it Georgie)

name: Codey Cherry
text: Convenient place for prescription refills and house hold items.

name: Vegans Rock
text:
We ARE now beginning the process of seeking a more formal resolutions.....however-- THIS Atlanta Hwy, Montgomery AL pharmacy staff INCLUDING THE PHARMACY MANAGER- JOE S. have single-handedly created the worst customer service experience of our lifetime.  We honestly advise no one with additional options to patronize with this store if your goal is to seek even a mediocre level of professionalism.
- from dispensing the incorrect patient's medications
- EXTREMELY rude staff pharmacist and pharmacist managers
- omitting the correct medications
- charging customers for the incorrect medications

TRY AN ALTERNATE PUBLIX PHARMACY  (or Rite-Aide deliver)

if all else fells, become a chemist and mix your own drug therapy because NO ONE should PAY a retail store to be treated with hostility

name: Erica Sanders
text: Worst service ever in the pharmacy I changed my location and I'm willing to drive across town to get my prescription just to avoid this place hate I had to give it one star. Customer service is not a priority at this location

text: Our visit tonight was spotless. 15 minute wait for meds.

text: Mike the Pharmacist is kind and informative. I would go no where else!

name: Del Chick
text: Pharmacy is too busy, lousy customer service!!!     Store MGR Frank, however is excellent.

name: Tawny Wyatt
text: This place is very good at consistency... they are very consistently horrible. I hate to even give them ONE star. Every prescription we've ever had to get filled here is always late- like over an hour when your doctor has called it in the day before, OR they click on their keyboard and tell you that they have received nothing from your doctor, when you know that they have. We have also had them call us to tell us that a prescription was ready, only to get there, and they tell us that it is backordered and out of stock. The techs are extremely rude- I've witnessed eye-rolls and dramatic sighs (not just at myself but also other patients), and they don't seem to be very efficient at their jobs. The ONLY reason we EVER use this place is because they are the only 24-hour pharmacy in the area. If it weren't for that, we would never ever return our business here.

name: Justin Brandy Smith
text: The pharmacy is so very slow and the staff back there are all rude. My spouse and I both work in the medical industry and I don't see how our patients could trust us with their health concerns if we were to be that rude and unconcerned to them in return.

text: I once gave this store a 5 star rating but I don't understand why these store employees have a problem with me getting cleaning supplies. Sure I get what I see, I have had close family members with COVID and even one to pass from it. Not only that I gift to the elderly that can't get out and get some. Now they don't put anything on the shelves. The manager, Stephen, whom I thought was so friendly, told one of my white friends that a lady comes in and gets all their supplies. I guess that's why nothing is even on their shelves anymore. I drive almost two hours to find supplies for myself, my kids, and others. I know for a fact they had 22 units as they called the boxes and then another truck. So tell me why they didn't put out any supplies: Disinfectant wipes, lysol, microban, dg disinfectants or alcohol. I find it hard to believe that out of 4 loads not one single cleaning items. My money is green to. I have an autoimmune disease and I need stuff myself. I have spent $650 in one month at these dollar generals because Aliceville don't have any. They are  not too friendly anymore. I guess they see my face too much but they don't mind taking my  money for other stuff that I purchase.

When she finally got there she said nothing, only grunted when I said good morning. No welcome, no smile, no good morning. Her first and only words were to ask if I had a rewards card. C’mon Walgreens, these are your ambassadors to the public. Train them to be nice. Your pharmacist is great! Have them shadow her.

name: K
text: I have been using this pharmacy for several years. I have had just a few minor negative experiences during this time. Most of the time I was comfortable with the service. Today was a different story. I called about an hour before they closed to finalize 2 scrip. orders. I called at this time because I had tried several times in the past week and today to get thru to someone on the phone, but had too long of a hold time each time. I thought it might be less busy at 7pm. The woman who answered, who I believe was the pharmacist on duty, had a disrespectful tone a couple of times during the call. I mentally excused her then drove to pick up my orders almost immediately. When I arrived the assistant, who was one of the distasteful encounters I've witnessed in the past, was working the drive thru. I told her I needed the pills cut in the required dose which I'd gotten done many times before without problems. It usually doesn't take very long to do as well. I went to wait across the lot when I saw a multitude of cars arriving at the drive thru right before closing time. 15 or so minutes had elapsed and it was closing time by that time so I decided to drive back over to the window to pick up my meds. When I arrived the tech ignored me for about a minute or 2 and then she mouthed something to me without the microphone and immediately walked away out of my sight. I could not make out what she said, of course. I continued to wait patiently. Within that time the pharmacist walked over and in a scolding tone told me to tell her ahead of time I needed them cut. I informed her I did not because I was informed in the past not to do that because I must pay for them before they are cut. She then continued her scolding by telling me "Well it's just so late." Omg...are you not still open for business when I arrived 15 to 20 minutes prior? And it doesn't take that long to cut them. And I would of done it sooner if I could of gotten someone on the telephone without a long hold time every time I called! That response was rude, unprofessional and unfair and I did nothing wrong. How dare her and that tech or whatever she is treat a good customer this way. I have always been fair and courteous to the staff. I have already found another pharmacy and will pull my business out of there tomorrow. Thanks for reading) Hope this helps!

text: The worst pharmacy I've ever dealt with! The locally owned pharmacy I was using closed so 2 months ago I moved my prescriptions to this Walgreen's. BOTH TIMES, last month & this month, I've gone to pick up my script the medicine was out of stock which means I have to go DAYS without it. Not only that, it pushes my fill date back which is supposed to sync up with my doc appointment... & the staff are not caring or sympathetic.... it's just a job to them & clearly doesn't phase them AT ALL... The least they could do is apologize for the inconvenience but no... cant even do that... GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!

name: Schwifty Cheese
text: The bald shift starter/manager with the gray goatee told me I needed to "take my change accross the street because we are NOT a bank" then grabbed the 2 things I was purchasing and walked off I guess to the back or through the photo lab area door. I mean I know that's not ideal... But even as kids we are taught to save our change for the tough times... I just needed to buy my mother a birthday card and a soda. Wasn't like I was buying a cheap over priced drug store pair of glasses or anything.

text:
I have to call them every single month.........

Edit: they have now since corrected this and I've had no further problems as of late.

name: Craig Parker
text: Rebecca and her team act as one.  While each play a different role, the operation is smooth as silk.  Titles mean nothing to the employees/pharmacists.  They care about their customers and often habe seen thr pharmacist running dribe through when it het backed up.  Great job team. Keep it up!

text: Every time I come the meds are never ready!! You have to wait 20mins or more! It was called in the day before.... I hate coming here!!!!

text: very rude and uncaring staff at the pharmacy

name: Frog Price
text: Excellent pharmacy. They keep great records do that meds don't contraindicated each other.

name: matthew Mccullough
text:
Everytime I use the automatic phone serrvice to order refills, there is always a problem and at least one isn't filled and I have to wait for them to fill it or have to come back!!! On Wednesday August 24, 2017, I called automatic phone service to order my desvenlafaxine and the recording said "we recently tried to call you to see if you wanted your armodafinil  its due to be refilled" I said yes, so it was to be ready after 11am that day. I got to the pharmacy and they said that I didn't have anything!!! I told her what I had ordered so she said I'll get it fixed, it will take a few minutes! When it was ready, she said she only had part of meds in stock and would have to order it!!!! I took the partial prescriptions and left. Thursday I called and asked were the meds in and the lady said yes. I got there and only one was available. When I questioned her about the other medication she said it didn't come in. That night I called and spoke with a lady and asked her what time my meds would be there, cause I was going to Florida at 9am the following medicine, she said it would be after 10am. I told her I was leaving to go to Florida at 9am the next day. I then asked "why is it taking so long after you ordered it to come in? She said it's because it's a narcotic. So I went on to Florida. Now I had already received 5 pills, and you would think that they would have been on the look out for it!!!!!! so when I got home Monday I went to Walgreens to pick up meds, GUESS WHAT?????? NO MEDS!!!!!!!!! She had not explanation on invoice of why meds did not come in!!!!! And now I'm being told it will be in tomorrow.....we'll see!!!!!!!
Update: I called to check to see if my medicine came in and the lady said no it still hasn't come in!!!!!! She said I'm going to give it one more day...I interrupted her and said tomorrow makes a week since you first ordered it and she said "it's because it's a narcotic (?)!!!!! I'm not a dummy, I don't know what they are doing but I will be changing pharmacies!!!!!!!

Guess what - according to the rude incompetent worker, they don't do passport photos. Or she just didn't know how to do it. We had already moved our prescriptions elsewhere because of the poor service and now after this passport photo fiasco, I will never set foot through their sliding doors again.

name: josh hood
text: I don't understand how this pharmacy has not been sued into bankruptcy. They never have the prescriptions ready. They have lost my medicine more than 3 times and took 4 different people 20 mins of digging thru everything to find it. I have called at least once a day for the last 5 days trying to get my medicine and finally was told it would be ready today. I have now been here 30 minutes waiting on them to try to fix it. A lady just came up behind me who had been given the wrong medication for her 75 yr old mother.

name: Karen Boykin
text: Suggest calling before arrive for pharmaceuticals.  Looks like folks don't make until ask.  This may not be just this location.  Seems lots of drug stores are waiting now for arrivals to process.

name: Cindy Bunch
text: This pharmacy is understaffed. Waited 15 min in drive through, & no one ever came to the window. Got out of line & went inside pharmacy with only 2 people in front of me. One person who was having an issue with her refill took 30 min with the pharmacy tech. Waited 30 min before an African American man was stocking shelves & was obviously called into the pharmacy to help out. Why would someone be stocking shelves in an almost empty store instead of helping out at one of the busiest times of the day 3:30-4:30 pm. There was no one minding the drive-through at all, & no one really cared. Where was the store mgr?  Where was the pharmacy staff. Ironically I went to CVS immediately after to pick up a script for someone one else, & they were very prompt.

name: Destini Reed
text: Employees closed the store nearly 15 minutes early as my husband was approaching the doors on the 13th. Trying to avoid writing a bad review, I sent a concerned message to the store manager who replied with an unapologetic phone call today stating that they actually didn't lock the doors at 9:58. Nice. Nevermind that they turned the lights out or that my complaint was sent at 9:55 AFTER the doors were locked. Wow. Just wow.

name: K Reaves
text: I dropped off my prescriptions and said I’d be waiting for them. Here I am writing a review in the waiting chairs AN HOUR LATER. I willing NEVER take a prescription here again. CVS fills prescriptions in record time with the same number of employees.

text: this Place serious makes me weigh skipping medicine each and every time I go. It’s awful

name: Brooke elaine
text: Never again. I got out of hospital so wasnt feeling good anyways. Long line. Well a lady that was n pharmacy today with blue scrubs on and circle brown dangly earrings was rude! I ask her how long my script would take. She said 20 to 25 min i can wait or come back.so i said come back. 3 hrs later just getting done as she said to my boyfriend who picked it up.she didnt know nothing about it smh. Yeah horrible service.wow just called and spoke to manager to complain and he was even ruder!!! He said i had to wait 3 hrs bc i left and came back. I said well she ask me to wait 20 or 25 min or pick up 20 to 25 min..means same thing? He said no when u say come back they put people n store first but that makes no sense ..even makes no sense when i was there at 10:34 am but says script didnt go in until 12:08!! Dont go here rudest people ever..they need to learn customer service

I tried three times to get someone on the  phone. Forget about it.  Not important to CVS!  The only person that cares is the young dude up front.  That's it!  He is so young, he has not been taught yet how to not care.  Give it time!

name: Josh Padgham
text: I am not leaving a review or rating the store, but simply want to let everyone know that as of January 2021, the pharmacy is no longer open 24 hours a day.  The store itself is still open 24 hours, but the pharmacy does not open until 8:00 AM.  Thanks.

text: Better watch out or the Karen Pharmacist will get you if you don't obey the mask rule to a T.

text: I can relate to many others who have tried calling this store and after 15+ minutes of waiting 3 different times! One of which I waited 30 minutes, theres no excuse to not answer the phone on an easy day like this. There might be 2 or 3 vehicles in there parking lot at a time like this, ridiculous..

text: this is the only pharmacy i know in the area that is open 24 hours. Including the Pharmacy section. Great and a life saver as always

name: Michal Matousek
text: Wow... Gautam was the man behind the counter. Service was amazing and it made my day to see someone actually love their job and their customer. Guy is awesome and CVS is lucky to have him.

name: Oliver White
text: Lazy employees. On their phones watching YouTube and on personal phone calls when they're checking you out. Because of how distracted the employees are, they've done stuff like charge me twice for one item. They clearly don't care about their jobs. Don't go here, you'll regret it.

name: brynn perry
text:
Joseph Witten, the store manager of the Inverness location seriously needs customer service retraining and corporate intervention.
I purchased an item online and was sent the wrong thing and  went to this store to return it. Mr. Witten  was rude from the start. When I explained about the return he cut me off with a terse "calm down."  Had he let me finish he would have known that I wanted to see if they carried the actual item I wanted and I could do an exchange. However, I never got that far because Joe followed up with more mature declarations of  "it's not my fault you got the wrong thing" and "I didn't do it". So now I am just looking  wide-eyed and gape-mouthed at this pudgy man getting all worked up over a return for SKIN MOISTURIZER.  Mind you,  the item was unopened, still in the original packaging, with the receipt and was within the return period and this guy is giving off all kinds of micro-aggressive vibes like I have done something wrong. I felt super uncomfortable as the store was full of people who could all hear this man lose his composure over a return.  He asks for my driver's license TWICE  which I understand if a receipt is not present but again, I had a valid receipt. When he  finally gets around to processing the return Joe gives me a CVS Gift card and tells me it's a money card. I have never returned anything to CVS before so when I ask him how to use it he admits that it can only be redeemed at CVS.  I point blank ask him why he didn't process the refund per the original method of payment  (my bank card) he smirks at me and says "alright, alright, I said I would take care of it."  He then processes the return to my card but botches the transaction and ends up having to give me a partial cash refund.
I will NEVER, EVER, EVER  go to CVS again! It is my opinion that Mr. Witten  needs to be terminated  but at the very least he needs some time away from that store to undergo re-training. As long as he is employed with the organization they will not get one dime of my money. I transferred my prescriptions to Walgreens the next day.

name: Douglas Stephens
text:
Filling a prescription should be simple
But the pharmacy manager ashley, she shorted me 3 pills on a narcotic, which they can’t fix

And shorted me 1 pill on my inflammatory.

COUNT YOUR PILLS BEFORE LEAVING

name: Krystian Stern
text: Great customer service! cashier was excellent and im pleased with this store.

name: Max Gannondorf
text: I legit don't think they know how to answer the phone. I've tried 3 times on 3 different days. After 7-10 minutes of waiting for someone to answer I just gave up each time. And they are jerks when you go in too. I just need to know if they have a medication.

name: Christina McClellan
text: Absolutely terrible service. We had a doctor call in a prescription we needed that night. Gave it an hour after it was supposed to be ready just to make sure it would be ready. Drive up, they have "Lost" the prescription, then miraculously "found it" then said it would be 15 minutes to fill it. 25 minutes later it was ready, but then they didn't want to check us out yet. One hour later they decided to finally process the insurance because they wanted to serve other people before even entering in the insurance information into the computer, making our total wait time over an hour.

name: Crystal Burke
text: I will NEVER order photos from this CVS again. Ive placed orders online for pickup at the Inverness store#4864 on several isolated instances. And every time, they "do not have the toner in to print". I took a chance recently and was told the same bs. They didn't even call me to let me know that their was an issue. But I knew better and called before heading there. I hate them so much. They really need to do away with their photo department all together.

name: Randell Hill
text: Absolutely horrible. The drive thru needs to get their act together. I was told 30 minutes.... I had to call from the parking lot to make sure that they had the correct phone number. 30 minutes later I drove back through the drive-thru and asked if was ready...."I'm sorry didn't you get a text "? I was there 45 to 50 minutes total  and didn't get a text for another 20 minutes after I had left. Unbelievable.

name: Gail Thomas
text:
Went to pick up a prescription that I thought was filled at Winn Dixie, Inverness not realizing that the pharmacy had closed and my prescription was transferred to the CVS in Inverness.  When my husband went to CVS, he was told that it was $122 for 90 days instead of the $10 for 90 days at Winn Dixie.  The pharmacist told my husband that the medication wasn't even covered.  We had it transferred to our store, the Rite Aid on Valleydale Road and the cost was $11.00 for 90 days.  These people tried to rip us off.
Beware!!

name: matthew george
text:
I have been a loyal customer of CVS for many years. I started  night shift several months ago so I need to use a 24 pharmacy when I get off work. I drove past several 24 hour pharmacies to use the Inverness store.
Last month the pharmacist on duty said the didn't have enough medication in stock to fill my prescription. Tonight, a month later, I dropped in and was told the same thing.
I wound up going back to a store I had passed up to get my prescription filled.
What good is it to have a store operating 24 hours they fail to stock medication.
Is anyone held responsible for failing to provide customer service or do they have so many customers they don't care?

I'd rather drive farther and receive this kind of AMAZING customer service than close to home with none! You've got GEMS at this location!!!

text: Quick and good customer service

name: Lashay Gibson
text: they have some good deal and the hours r good they close at midnight

name: jamilah b
text: I went in to grab something the other night. I made sure to check their hours before I left my house. No one updated their hours online, so I was greeted with a notice saying they were closed when I got to the door. It didn’t say when they would open or any new hours and it still hasn’t been updated online. Very frustrating.

name: Andrew Phillips
text: Ordered a canvas Friday online. Pick up was set for Sunday @ 8:00am. I called at 9:00 to ask if it was ready. They told me yea! I went at 1:00 and the lady couldn’t find it, called someone else to the front, she said it never printed but she would print it now. After 3 tries she says something is wrong with the printer, and it’s not going to work. She seemed to have no idea what she was doing. I asked her if I call back later, would someone be able to tell me if it was actually ready this time, or would I waist another trip up here? She told me I could just cancel my order. So I did... Went to Walmart and they printed my canvas right then and there.

name: April Renfro
text: Tried to pick up my daughters refill (which she was emailed a reminder) I gave the info to Jennifer at the drive thru window she not so politely informed the insurance was denied bc she’s not eligible until April 21. I explained this is a refill so that didn’t make sense it was just a 30 day supply. Jennifer was very rude not offering to assist in the situation at hand. She kept saying I don’t know what you want me to do. I said maybe someone made a mistake and keyed it in incorrectly that I am the one that picked it up and verified what it was. She continued to talk over me and tell me maybe it was misplaced. I assured her it wasn’t she first told me she didn’t see any record of my daughter EVER filling a prescription at that location ( she has been filling there for over a year) after insisted she told me it was filled in February and a 90 days supply again I tried to explain she continued to talk over me and be very very rude would not help me at all. I explained people make mistakes she stated “Not here we would be fired so maybe you misplaced it” I tried calling the store after I left to speak to the manager about my experience and was left on hold for several minutes and put on hold again I hung up and left this review.

name: A Person
text: Very Selective, open! Waits are very minimal

name: Corey Bell
text: Only had one employee at the checkout line.. Made for a strangely long wait for a slow time of day. The single employee did go through the line fairly quickly though. Store seemed to have quite a bit of items on sale. You could probably find a few good deals in there if you are a smart shopper.

name: Just Flea
text: This is the BEST pharmacy. The folks here go out of their way to help their customers.

name: Mercedes Klebba
text: Two stars only because I was given the correct medication. However the medication which was prescribed went through so many hands and no one caught the dosage error. After calling and speaking to the pharmacist nothing was done or said about the error and I was given a very rude and curt answer back. I am from out of state and I feel as though this was completely unacceptable as this medication was for a thin 6 year old child. If the medication was given at the dosage which was written on the bottle then he would have ended up with more severe symptoms then he had been to the ER with in the first place. I can guarantee if I come up to Daleville again I will never go to this Walgreens.

name: Kimberly F
text: Prices tend to be a bit higher, but it's open 24/7 and offers weekly sales that keep me coming back. Also, the service has always been good and that's a big deal for me these days!

name: Andrea Brown
text: The pharmacist (the older guy with white hair)  by far is the rudest pharmacist I have ever met. The meds were for my 5 year old daughter with ADHD. His attitude toward me was almost embarrassing, this was my first time here and it will definitely be the last.

name: J C
text:
Don’t shop here.
I signed up my wife to get her Covid-19 vaccines at this store. If they tried to make it more difficult they couldn’t. When we got there we checked in a the front and had to go to the pharmacy to have her insurance verified. I had it verified online a week early. The lady at the pharmacy didn’t know what she was doing and had to get someone else to do it. We then had to back up front to sign in and get the vaccine card then go back and get her shot.
The second time we had to do the same thing over again.

text: One of the better CVS I have been to. Everyone is super nice and always ready to help. Tiffanie is always friendly and ready to help as well.

name: Jaded Gal
text:
I guess it depends on the person but I love this CVS. I recently became a convert to them after years of staying well clear once I figured out how much you could save with a CVS card! Especially in their beauty club...talk about shocked. Normally I go to the Whitesburg Drive location but I’m a fan of this one as well. They have similar merchandise, not as much foot traffic & it’s happily situated next to a super Walmart which is also very nice.

I’ve never found the staff to be anything but absolutely lovely and wonderful at this location. Ladies if you’re a fan of Kerstase, Fekkai, Living Proof and Redken hair care, as well as very cool K-Beauty offerings, give them a look!

name: Brenda Peacher
text: I love my CVS,  all my people at the pharmacy take wonderful care of me. Wouldn't go anywhere else ever!

name: U No
text: Tiffanie was extremely nice. She made me want to visit this cvs more often than other stores. Great job Tiffanie! Thanks for beings so nice and making a stressful day a lot better

name: Alisha Lowery
text: I have been getting my meds filled here for years now. Every month on the same day and I showed up at 7:56 PM and they refused to fill them because they close at 8. Now normally this wouldn't be a big deal, but I live 2 hours away. If you close at 8, then close at 8. Not early. I have 2 retail stores and I would NEVER do this to a customer, especially a regular customer. So now I have to miss another half day of work just to drive back down here. Thanks a lot CVS.

name: Brenda Hargrove
text: so I had my pain medication filled today at the 2210 Winchester road location, got home and counted my pills and was short 4 pills, Called and spoke to the pharmacist Debbie, not sure who she is. I've been going to this location for over a year. She informed me that she double counted and that she had given me the correct amount, I told her that I  could count also and that there was four missing. She was not very helpful at all, her attitude was like oh well, her word against mine. Usually when i get my meds the quanity on the bottle is circled and initialed, this one wasn't. What are we supposed to do when this happens? Someone helped themselves to 4 of my pain pills.

name: Jane Knauss
text: The pharmacy staff are incredibly rude. I have had to speak with managers because they have given me the wrong prescription more than once. I’m transferring my prescription immediately.

name: Judy Myers
text: Went to pick up a prescription and as always very courteous and prompt.

name: Greg Parde
text:
I have a kidney stone my medication was out of stock no problem we can have tomorrow morning I was told.  I called to check the next morning and was told it would be another 3 to 4 hours. i called again at 11:30 first I was told that my medication was shorted from the order, and then they told me their supplier was out.
This was not my first issue with them but it will be my last!

name: Bohemian Chic Vibe
text:
The young male cashier working the register  on Dec. 26th greeted us nicely but when we went to make our purchase of a lovely African American santa & angel he felt the need to tell us the following:
He doesn't understand the purpose of black Santa's bc it's "historically inaccurate" ...
He then proceeds to ask me if I think that makes the black santa "cultural appropriation"?? He tries to give me some facts on the "real st. Nick"... I politely cut him off with a general explanation of why I find the item appropriate FOR ME... but I shouldn't be engaged in such topics by an employee who in essence challenged my choice & came across as biogoted by breaching the topic  for no apparent reason!

Who does that??? I've trained many employees and I've NEVER heard such a violation of policy.
As a manager who's trained many I found his behavior extremely inappropriate! It made me uncomfortable and quite frankly ANGRY when I later thought about it.
It is the employees job to SELL not to give unsolicited opinions on the merchandise, especially NEGATIVE opinions!!. If he has a problem with black santas, angels, etc. he should keep it to himself. Check your personal opinions at the door unless you are ASKED & I certainly didn't ask for his opinion.
He needs to be re-trained and relocated to a location where all the product is "historically accurate" in his opinion.

Does CVS support this kind of employee behavior? I'm appalled!

text: They refused us dropping off a medication at the window because "you have to do that inside". I looked it up you do not in fact have to do it inside. Just a mere 40 minutes after surgery the last thing someone wants to do is go by tons of people. Why i could just drop it off and come back is beyond me. Ridiculous.

name: Krystal Young
text: Just like the other reviewers have said. Absolute Worst CVS I have ever encountered in my life. First they completely didn't fill my insulin prescription. I had to call it in twice & by the time they finally decided "oh, maybe we should do our jobs", they were out of my insulin. By this time, I had run out of insulin because I had been waiting several days. Never go to this CVS. I had to transfer my prescription out. My CVS in Atlanta was Great. This one should have their doors closed. They also don't have Curbside & refused to price match.

name: Andrea W
text: The pharmacy techs repeatedly refuse to sell syringes with needles for delivery of insulin.  Tonight was just the most recent incident.  In spite of having 8+ years history of purchasing insulin and supplies in the computer, due to not having an active Rx (we can't have an active Rx at every pharmacy in town "just in case" our insurance-dictated regular pharmacy is not accessible at that moment of need), the pharmacy tech gets to decide, based on personal bias/mood, not to sell the only safe method of delivery of insulin (which is now prohibitively expensive without insurance) to a type-1 diabetic who has a documented history of his need for that medicine.  Diabetes does not go away! Once insulin dependent, always insulin dependent!  A pharmacy tech just decided she wants a customer to either use dirty needles (infection risk, tissue damage, increased pain to use) or go without insulin and let his blood slowly turn to poison and kill him.  I hope you sleep well at night knowing your company and staff are directly and indirectly causing death, injury, and diminished quality of life.

name: Sam Gore
text: Came in with a prescription that was more complicated than intend. Multiple members of the staff assisted me, with Mrs. Cheryl being one who especially stood out as patient, helpful and pleasant to interact with. Couldn't be happier with how I was treated at the pharmacy.
