text: This CVS is great! I shop here often. Becky, the pharmacist and her staff are courteous and professional, the prices for medicine is reasonable. I also like the large selection of make-up items, it's a great buy when I use my extra-bucks rewards. CVS also sends out discount coupons as an additional reward.

name: Delia Derrick
text: Trying to have my medications filled at the Hanceville CVS has been very frustrating.  Many times the employees say I don't have refills or that the doctor had not called a prescription in, when actually, the medications WERE ready to refill.  Also, many, many times I received phone texts from CVS telling me that a medicine was automatically refilled or that a prescription was ready for pick up.  When I arrived at the stores, the employees didn't know what I was talking about.   They had NOTHING ready for pick up.  Because of these errors, I have had to go without my medication for several days while they figured out their error... The employees were always friendly, however.   I  now do business with Blue and Gray Drugs in Hanceville.  Their service is much more dependable.

name: Heather Murphy
text: I needed Benadryl for my dog and was afraid to leave her alone in the car. The pharmacy picked it out for me and let me go through the drive through. That’s customer service at its finest. Thank you so much.

name: bjt 2077
text: Rude pharmacist,  long wait times for prescriptions to be filled and if you are going to pick a family members medication up be prepared to show every form of Id possible.

name: brandon brooks
text:
I tried to fill 2 prescriptions and had one of the worst retail experiences that i have ever had. When i gave the pharmacist my prescriptions I told him that I had Good RX coupons on my phone and tried to show him but he just walked off so I thought everything was ok. When I was called back to pay one of the meds was almost 50 dollars than the coupon rate. When I questioned the price the Pharmacy Tech rolled her eyes and started popping her gum in my face. The Pharmacist then said I told him I had the coupon but did not give a card, Good RX is an app, so i didn't get the discount. So i showed the tech the coupons and she told me she didn't need them she could just do it herself. She told me that it would be another 10 minutes and when I questioned why such a long time to change the price they refused to fill the medicine and returned my paper prescriptions. I asked to speak to the store manager and was informed by the Tech that he was not there so at this point all i could do is leave.

Once home called back to the store to get the pharmacist and technicians names and licences number. Well the store manager answered the phone. He then preceeded to tell me that he could not give that information until I told him that it was a matter of public record and that if it was not posted in plain view that they were committing a crime. So when he finally gave me the pharmacist's name , Charlie, i filed a complaint with CVS and the state pharmacy board.

Also I called around to 2 other CVS stores to check cash prices and found out that he was going to charge me more than the other stores.

It is no wonder that BCBS of Alabama will no longer deal with CVS.

I would avoid doing this store at all costs in the future. It would seem that CVS has a standard to only hire rude people along with liars and cheats.

name: Melissa Heigl
text:
This is a typical Dollar General. You aren't going to get stellar service or anything like that. It was clean, and well stocked which is all most people need.

I didn't much care for waiting at the register for several minutes because all employees were in the back. When one finally came out, she glanced at me and said, "Someone will be out to help you in bit" and walked away, to (apparently) browse the store shelves.

Worth noting: if you use your debit card and opt to receive cash back, they will charge you an extra $1.50 in convenience fees.

name: Taylor Mullins
text: If i could give this walgreens a negative star i would! i always use walgreens so i didn’t think this one would be much different. i had a prescription for my 2 month old son sent over last thursday, they said the medicine would be on monday because they had to order it, which is fine. monday i come to pick his prescription up and they couldn’t find it for 10 mins. finally after they found it they said it wasn’t done yet to come back in 30 mins. i cone back later and they said that they were waiting on an approval from a doctor. well it is tuesday now and they have ordered the wrong medication. i will never return here. my son has really bad acid reflux and is in an extreme amount of pain so this medicine is very important for him. will never return here ever

name: Ronald Rupert
text: I've been going to this Walgreens pharmacy for many years, but today is the last day.  There was a problem with one of my prescriptions and they could only give me a partial amount until they restocked.  That's annoying, but not too bad.  The remainder will be ready in a few days.  A week later my wife went in to pick them up.  They had done nothing and the prescription showed as completed.  They said they would order and the pills would be available in two days.  I went back 3 days later and they didn't have them and they hadn't been ordered.  People at the counter where trying to be helpful, but the Pharmacist clearly didn't care.  No, "I'm sorry", no engagement at all.  They finally told me they would order and to come back in two days.  I went back in 3 days later.  The pills are now in stock, but nobody had filled the remainder of my prescription and the system was still showing that it was completed.  The person working the counter was helpful and apologetic, but when the Pharmacist came back, she said "we don't manufacture the pills, so it's not out fault".  She obviously missed the training for customer service.  This was the fourth time I was told the prescription would be filled and it still wasn't done.  An apology, at a minimum, should have given, but I surely didn't expect to get attitude.  Completely unprofessional.  I told them not to fill my prescription and I left and will not return.  I'm transferring my prescriptions to CVS later today.

name: Fair Reviews
text: I have worked at Walgreens.  I know the rules and they are stretching them at the pharmacy.  The attendant in drive thru was rude.  It took a very long time for him to come to the window.  Then he said it would take 20 min fill the prescription and I should come back.  I timed the cars ahead of me.  One was more than 15 min.  One was over 20 min.  I recommend corporate and store manager look into it.  Until the young man's attitude is fixed go somewhere else.  I will be praying for him.

name: Margaret Anne Parker
text: Minus 50+ stars for this pharmacy. It's a pharmacy, first and foremost in the business to take care of a patient's needs by filling doctor prescribed medication for sick people. That alone should mean the employees will be kind, considerate, and have the patient's best interest at heart, which requires a certain level of customer service skills. I can honestly say, this is by far the WORST customer service experience I've ever had, in ANY industry! From the pharmacist herself to the tech working the counter, they are the rudest people I've encountered! My particular issue began with a refill which I called in back in August. Once I received a text that it was ready for pickup, I drove over to collect it, only to be told once I got there that the RX was not ready and the drug was not in stock. The tech argued with me about being notified that it was ready until I showed her the text message and then she had nothing to say. I was then told they would call me when the drug was back in stock and my RX had been filled. Three weeks went by and no word so I drove back over to check on it. This time, I spoke with the pharmacist who literally could not be bothered with my questions about when I might be able to get my prescription. She said it was ordered from the 'warehouse' and that they would call me when it came in but if I didn't want to wait, I could go somewhere else and get them to transfer the RX. I opted to wait. Huge mistake! Yesterday, while picking up 2 other prescriptions, I inquired about my refill on backorder. I explained everything that had taken place thus far to the tech and gave her my previous RX bottle for informational purposes. She checked on the computer and said 'this RX has already been filled.' And so I say to her, no, as I so painstakingly explained, it was never filled because you were out of the drug and could not fill it and I've been waiting for you guys to call me when it came in. Immediately she became combative! Then she tells me that, yes, they have the drug in now, BUT, I can't have it because 'oh look, this refill expired a few weeks ago.' Umm. No, it didn't 'expire,' it's been in your system awaiting the restock of the drug! She very rudely tells me that I'll have to go see my dr (and pay the $30 copay,) and obtain a new prescription. What? I'm in disbelief at this point. And when I asked if she heard any of what I had said to her previously, she began talking over me saying it's not their fault because they're all new and training and learning the rules and I'm out of luck! And that she would be happy if I took my prescriptions elsewhere! DONE! Not to worry! WALGREEN'S will never get my business again for anything!

name: stephen clanton
text: Totally lacks customer service, in addition, they always say we have to order that prescription and then you never hear back again...when you call to ask if it is in, it’s like they don’t know anything about it

name: Claudia Carson
text: Worst pharmacy experience ever! First off, it took and hour and 15 minutes to fill one prescription and then I paid online to save time (like the service advertises). When I pulled through drive thru with my toddler and infant in the car the pharmacy tech tells me that my total is blank amount...I proceed to tell her that I already paid. She then tells me that since I paid online, I had to come inside the store to get my child’s medicine. I begged her to help me out since I had both my toddler and infant in the car but she just told me the same thing again. At this point I’m mad because how can they send you a link on your phone to “save time” but then make you come inside to get your prescription?!?!?! Busy moms beg you to come up with a better solution! Until then, I will no longer get my prescriptions filled here (or shop here for that point).

name: JACK SMITH
text:
YOUR PHARMACY TECH JAIME DID A FANTASTIC JOB HELPING ME WITH MY DIABETIC SUPPLIES. I CANNOT SAY ENOUGH GOOD THINGS ABOUT HER. MY CVS PRESCRIPTIONS ARE NOW AT YOUR STORE.

THANKS AGAIN JAIME
